6GJitgBnyGFoJDjc-Layuw.text: I am from Sf Bay Area! But this is the best Asian fusion restaurant I ever have. I hope I don't post it to let people know how good it is. Because it might get popular and a long line to wait just like other Las Vegas restaurant. But sorry I can not help to posting my review.

ql68USaRsT7TaXoeDC_Bsg.text: Recently went for the second time while visiting Las Vegas (was there the night they opened). Good atmosphere, wait staff and  food and wine list. Excellent option if you want to get off the strip and try something local.

iz2gddhIBam02VHiaxF3Iw.text: I'm not sure what the hype is for, the food is good, but definitely not worth the price and the portion size (which is small, slightly bigger than tapas). We tried the campfire duck, the pork shoulder and the dumplings (that is also how we would rank them from highest to lowest).   The staff is nice, decor is nice but it was hot! Granted it was 109 outside, but their AC could not keep up and we were literally sweating sitting there. Very uncomfortable.  Again, food is good, but I probably won't be back.

7AvSL_UgCKXXowX61hSBoA.text: If you think the best places in Vegas are on the strip, you are dead wrong.  The best places are off the strip (usually on Spring Mountain) and are founded by chefs who ditched life at giant hotels to do things their way.  Sparrow + Wolf is an excellent chef who understands food doing things his way - with an amazing staff to create a perfect environment.  Visit this place.  You won't forget it.

mCIzxXB3E34CoxdsFS831A.text: Congratulations to Chef Brian Howard and his entire crew. My group of 14 was very impressed. We've been looking forward to this opening night for a long time.  The service was incredible - this is a crew of professionals that were on their game - I suspect they did a few rehearsals because service was nearly flawless. I don't know the GM's name, but he was fast, accurate and a good host who treats you like your patronage is valued. Jason, our server, was a great guy - very witty, and very attentive. Jackie was handling our drink orders, and she was sharp and helpful as well. Even though the chefs were busy in the back turning out some wonderful food, Brian Howard took the time to come out and say hello to everyone.  The food was, well, Brian Howard. We loved every dish - and we tried almost everything on the menu. The Bento Box included 4 large prawns, a couple of huge crab claws, 6 oysters, a Full Monty (every meat available on the extensive charcuterie menu) - it was incredible. But so was everything! We all passed around our plates; we couldn't get over the tastes. Favorites were the Duck Confit with Foie Gras; Beef Skewers with the best crepe I've ever tasted; the Farm Egg; Charcuterie; Beet & Endive (the endive was smoky goodness) - I could go on and on.  The drinks were excellent. While we all enjoyed the unique cocktails or a glass of wine before and during dinner, there were some real surprises on the drink menu at the end that we enjoyed exposing our group to. The Pedro Jimenez sherry was a huge hit, followed by the Amaro Nonino (there were FIVE amaros on the menu). Chef Howard is way ahead of the game with his cocktail menu, tapping into the rising popularity of sherry and amaros among millenials, and popularizing Cognac again before the whiskey shortage hits.  The restaurant itself is very visually appealing as well as perfectly comfortable for enjoying a long and varied meal.   Go here!

Jw4iXhJ0QibTPwiCp-at6A.text: Great cocktails and amazing food, most dishes is tapas so you can try many different dishes.

eDiBXGAfx4BV6mb9ib8xhg.text: Omg! Hands down best oysters I've ever had. The skewers were amazing I love all the flavor combos with the chickpeas and the crepes. The clams casino was also amazing and has a unique flavor you wouldn't know you're eating seafood. The drinks were the biggest excitement. I ordered the Get off my Lawn and the Model T. Both were amazing in flavor and the elaborate presentation added to the excitement. The atmosphere was super chill And the staff was very friendly and helpful with describing what is included in each meal. Can't wait to come here again.

iXUuPj4E81yoviF8wJJKxA.text: Blown Away! It's not often that I come across a restaurant that hits so many elements that create an amazing experience for me. Usually I settle for one or two of the 5 things I look for and choose to be happy with that. For me personally my experience last night at Sparrow + wolf is worthy of an explanation. Location: Center of town and easy to get to from anywhere with tons of parking = No stress getting there or leading up to walking in. First Impression: Room is gorgeous, Music choice and volume is instantly noticeable and pleasant and the instant view of kitchen and staff working has a good vibe. Bar Stools: Are comfortable AF with nice backrest and arms. As someone who loves to sit at the bar for a drink and a couple appetizers THANK YOU!!! Menu: This is as close to a dream menu that I could have imagined or have come across. Last time I saw a menu that made me this happy was at The Eddy in NYC. Not to many choices to choose from and every dish seemed to be a signature item like the Udon Lam Sausage, Chinatown Clams Casino (Favorite Dish) and the Beef cheek and bone marrow dumplings. Cocktails were also amazing and I found my new favorite spirit which was like a 100% Agave Gin. Staff: I ate at the bar last night so this is about the bartenders mostly and they were on point. Sara and Cody were attentive, aware and focused on guest experience. They were also knowledgable and passionate about the food and drinks they were about to serve our group of 5 at the bar. The food runners and bussers also did a great job because the food was delivered and cleared seamlessly. Obviously the back of house killed it because everything I ate was stupid good. Congratulations Chef Brian Howard, Chef Justin Kingsley Hall and GM John Anthony for everything it must have taken from patience to passion to bring all these elements together. What a gift it is for this community to have an establishment like this available to us and thank you to the entire Sparrow + wolf team. Photos: goo.gl/photos/8K2f4rPuhU...

jpi98NTOgzv_JctsPzik4g.text: This was legit one of the best meals of my life.    My friends and I ordered: Beef Heart Tartare Hamachi Farm Egg Artichoke Octopus Beef Cheek & Bone Marrow Dumplings Sweetbreads  Beef Skewer Udon (with an egg on top) Honey Toast Beignets  My favs were the beef cheek and bone marrow dumpling and the Udon - but everything was phenomenal.  I don't even like mushrooms and I loved 2 of the dishes that had them.  The service was amazing and food was top notch.  Will DEFINITELY be back!

ZXmP6mKC1op7_HNvb_TFPA.text: We had an amazing dinner tonight ! Kudos to chef Brian Howard and his staf! We are from France and know good food. This place is a must do for locals and anyone looking for an incredible off strip eating experience . Our server Jason made sure that all ran well and did an excellent job at it. Cody at the bar blew our minds with unique and yummy beverages. John Anthony was very welcoming and helped to ensure our evening was flawless. Thanks to all and we look forward to coming back soon!

vRi7KnFH-01rAVrc4uEN_w.text: Overall, I highly recommend Sparrow and Wolf. For high end dining, the price is reasonable.  The small plates are generous and filling. The drinks, as well, quite delicious and unique. My only critique would be the seasoning of the dishes that I enjoyed. While overall taste was delectable, each dish was a bit over-salted, obscuring the natural flavors that ideally would have peaked through a bit more. Additionally, the staff, particularly my bartender Alana, were very friendly, accommodating and made me feel cared for. I would dine here again in a heartbeat.

XhaQ1R5OUEBJ_8DxJ3K4gg.text: Delicious drinks (One Gnome in Bangkok and Model T), the best grilled octopus with the right amount of char with creamy potatoes,  tasty oyster mignonette,  and incredible hamachi with the lightest rice cracker dusted with seaweed. What a great place for small shareable plates away from the strip!

photos.caption: Photo of Sparrow + Wolf - Las Vegas, NV, United States

crBVVwweoh1X6kcDKI3GVg.text: Finally had the chance to visit Sparrow+Wolf and I have to say what made the experience better was the staff. From the moment we set foot in the door we were greeted by staff and seated and from here we were tended to as if the place were empty (full restaurant, but our water glasses never went empty no matter how hard we tried) the staff was very personable and knowledgeable about the menu. Our servers were extremely attentive and personable with our table even though there were only 2 of us.  The food was absolutely delicious. We had the Farm Egg and Beef Skewers, both dishes had excellent flavor and the meat was cooked perfectly. The mango-Chick pea salsa served with the meat gave it a unique flavor that left us wanting more. The Farm egg had such a blend of flavors we ultimately ended up using the meat from the skewers to soak up the very little that was left over in the bowl just so we wouldn't miss out on any of the flavors.   We were recommended the tres leches for dessert, the first bite had the tres leches flavoring with a touch of spice from the Hennessy that was used from the cream. Absolutely amazing.

ghl6v3v3YpFKRZg2RqQ_eQ.text: Went in after work anf rhe drinks and beer are great. Selection is superb and not overwhelming. Definitely recommend coming by with friends to share some food! Congrats on yoir opening. It was delightful!

Qx5QGJbqSmfGm2x31mbqEw.text: Couldn't more highly recommend this new addition to the Vegas restaurant scene. Beautifully and skillfully prepared seasonal dishes. Gorgeously designed interior and knowledgeable staff. I will definitely be returning to try all of their dishes and crafted cocktails.

7gldRwEmFpwE033gL6KfTQ.text: One of the best off strip restaurants in town.  Succulent and artfully prepared presentations of duck, lamb, fish, meet and vegetarian dishes in a beautiful setting with gourmet service to match the food.  They use the whole animal so you can get sweetbread, organ meats, etc.  Don't be sidetracked by its Chinatown location.  This place is the real deal.  Bar menu and desserts are great too.  My foodie wife was pleasantly surprised by the whole package of this place.

rXRscA8aE3oeA7vgWH-tDw.text: Love this place.  Casino clams, grouper w/ ramps, cocktails were sensational.  Only down side was that they were out of oysters.  Will definitely be back

ox2pLHVwAZ-h-tV-emAdPQ.text: Sparrow + Wolf is a hot & new trending must try restaurant! My friends decided to take me out for my birthday celebration. They know I love places that I can wine & dine at and this definitely the place to go. Even if it's a birthday, date night or just to explore amazing types of food. Amazing on reservations for a Friday night and seating your party together!  We first started off with drinks. First, we tried Spring Mountain Sour that was like a sweet volcano in your mouth with plum & beet with a spruce of lemon zest all in one! Second, we tried Model T, which definitely takes a name after itself. Reminds me a manly drink hence the dry gin that's in it. Third, we tried Jump The Shark which came in a cute Shark decorative glass. It was a little sweet with a kick of tropics. Lastly, I had this new item drink with Hennessy, but a mix of Sparkling wine, it was my favorite! I thought the Henny would be too strong, but it balances out with all the other flavors.   Now off to the main event, we started off the Charcuterie Board The FULL Monty, the seasonal pickles are mouthwatering. Then we had the Hamachi which was amazing and presentation was amazing. Next, we moved on to Chinatown Casino Clams and it was to die for! The Uni Hollandaise sauce from it was so good I had to dip it into my bread from the charcuterie board.  After, we tried the Oak Grilled Scallops which just melted in your mouth with the corn and miso butter melting together as you chew. Maitake Mushrooms with the hummus made a good impression then we had German Butterball Potatoes to add carbs to the table, the butter, garlic & lemon ash all went well well together, can be used as a side dish. Lastly, for dessert we decided to order the beignets topped with matcha green tea powder with a meringue cream inside. Sounded amazing, but it could of been more creamy and the matcha just added a bitterness taste at the end.   Overall, it's a great place to try different types of modern Midwestern foods with a twist.

photos.caption: Photo of Sparrow + Wolf - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beignets with matcha powder
Photo of Sparrow + Wolf - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chinatown Casino Clams with the amazing uni hollandaise sauce
Photo of Sparrow + Wolf - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hamchi tar tar was amazing and great presentation

YX4ldAs4oGGxtJnsK1quqg.text: Wonderful food, lovely wine, but expensive and the customer service leaves much to be desired.  After being seated and waiting a significant amount of time, we literally had to flag down a waiter to even order a drink.  We ordered a bottle of wine and after another significant amount of time we were informed that they no longer had that wine in stock - how long does that take?  Finally we got to order.  While we were ordering, my colleague changed his mind and instead of ordering the steak, ordered the bone marrow and steak tartare - up he likes meat.  She didn't seem to be fazed by this, but when she brought the steak after two rounds of meat already - we all looked at her - like really?  Then she asked us if we wanted anyway, and I said "well, if you're going to throw it away, but we didn't order it, so I don't want to pay for it"  Thinking maybe (probably) she now couldn't re-serve it, we could at least taste it (although, we were all stuffed I wouldn't have minded a bite) and she looked at me like I was the rudest thing one earth trying to get one by on her - like we weren't paying 100's of dollars already for this meal or something.  Anyway, sit at the bar and avoid the service problems.

BU7gpXr-T9GPGccgVSYlxA.text: New place in China Town, right next to Sura Korean BBQ. If you want to try something different and creative then give Sparrow and Wolf a try. Small dishes, almost like tapas style, but we were full with 5 items at the end of our marks. The only place beside Harvest that I find sweetbread on the menu. Great service and environment. Great cocktails selections!

AlKwMjDQ29V_u7GzWncLsw.text: Had a reservation for 7pm on a Wednesday night. Restaurant was just starting to pick up.  We ended up ordering bunch of plates and sharing them. Everything was tasty and service was great. Highly recommend.

JF5Byobfo27tZfcu0Hv1Tw.text: I am nothing but amazed by this establishment!  I recently joined an epicurean club, who invited by Jacob and me to come to dinner with them for a special crafted tasting menu tonight. I am so happy that I have finally come here!  As a resident of China Town, I have never been surprised by the variety of restaurants that are located here, until tonight. This farm to table restaurant with a variety of creative small plates, has blown my mind!  Because there were so many dishes we tried today, I placed a small description of each item under the photos. Some of the orders were specially made for us, so I'm not entirely sure of everything ate, although I enjoyed it all anyways! Originally they were informed there was only 6 of us, Jacob and I were last minute additions and they so kindly helped seat us all anyways.   Our server was extremely kind and informative and we were also greeted by the chef who regularly makes an appearance in the dining room. I loved how personal he made each experience and the multitude of specialty items we had tonight.   My favorite item was by far the bone marrow, and I wish it was on the menu for me to come back and try. It just melted in your mouth and was so sweet and succulent at the same time! I loved the seasonality of the dishes and know that each time I come in will be a new experience.   For a Wednesday night I was extremely surprised at how packed this place was in China Town! I loved the lively ambience even in such a dark space. I had so much fun tonight, this was not only a dinner to me, but also an experience, Sparrow + Wolf has exceeded my expectations, and I will definitely be back here!  Happy Eating!

pGQEoBoDYhM4Ei9zXLUU-g.text: I had seen this little gem several times while driving down Spring Mountain and had a pin in the idea of stopping in just because I loved the name. What an absolutely delicious food and drink menu!  My friend and stopped in for dinner and stayed seated at the bar for quite a long time. We had several cocktails (all super tasty) and shared plates. The steak tartare is divine. We each had all the different types of oysters which was such a delight to the palate. The dumplings were sooo good, too. I highly recommend trying these plates as well as the Japanese sweet potato dish.  I will definitely be making this a spot for regular dining and drinking.

45Mtryq2EDZpZmft2PoH1Q.text: What a wonderful spot. Alyssa the bartender guided us through our first experience. What a great bar program and what a knowledgeable gal. Thank you for making my experience great!

zLjQrtp5OlNc564UcIWl1g.text: Be prepared for a food adventure at Sparrow + Wolf! Your taste buds will be bouncing off the wall. I went on a date here & this was the perfect place. They have a full bar. Bartenders very attentive. We ordered a few plates & shared. Highly recommend the duck dumplings!! Those were my favorite. I also had scallops that were very tasty! The broccoli was just as delicious.   We also met John, who I think is the manager. He was awesome. Super friendly! Made us feel right at home.

_32oBYTQ-gs6hVYDNg72bA.text: I can't believe I didn't review this place yet!   My SO took me here back in September for my birthday date night!   We ordered the bento box and it was layers upon layers of awesomeness! Honestly, yes hefty price, but I'm telling you, it was well worth it for the amount of food.  Dem oysters, YUM. The middle section was an assortments of meats. That was probably my least favorite part but it was because I ate this last and I was pretty much getting full already.   The last section was poke and seafood! yummmm. Couldn't stop eating it. The giant shrimps! They had these cute little squirt bottles to add your sauce in. We also order their muscles which was one of the specials at that time.   It was in a Miso type sauce. it was pretty salty but that sauce with bread was BOMB!

The chef even took some time to ask us how everything was. A definite must try. We will be going back for that private room. You won't be disappointed.

gdmF-J1EJ4HH6MyN6OGsFA.text: This place came highly recommended from a hard to please foodie friend who raved about it.  I visited on a Thursday (7 pm) without a reservation with one of my favorite yelpers who's always down to yelp up...  Service: The hostess seated us immediately on a very busy Thursday evening.  Our server was very attentive throughout the evening and the dishes all came out timely.  Throughout our dinner, the manager who i found out later was the owner Brian Howard assisted the server with our table and other tables as well.  He checked on us to ensure we were enjoying our dishes which i totally appreciated.  Food & Drinky Drinks: For drinks, I tried the jump the shark and the spring mountain sour.  Jump the Shark can in a very cool shark headed glass, but the Spring Mountain sour was the winner of the two when it came down to taste.   A very cool mixologist cocktail. This is a place to go with a foodie friend and sample a lot of dishes and my favorites were the: Chinatown Clams: Tasty and after one order, we had to order another one quickly. Farm Egg: The pickled asparagus and feta mixed with the egg all complimented each other. Campfire Duck:  Great preparation of the duck for this dish. Ordering next time. Hamachi: Very fresh and digging it served on the rice paper.  Ambiance: It's a smaller dining area that I assumed it would be but very trendy, contemporary and dimly lit for a great date night.  Lots of dark wood. which keeps it classy.  Noisy because everyone is seated closely and there's definitely a pulse, but not too noisy where it distracts from table conversation.  Location is great and I love the great mixology options along with some interesting dishes to sample.  If you're sampling a lot of dishes, the bill can add up quickly but the quality of food is fantastic.  After this first visit, future visits and dishes are coming in the near future.  Enjoy yourself...it's a celebration! =)

photos.caption: Photo of Sparrow + Wolf - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Campfire Duck...very tasty.  Great imagination on this dish...
Photo of Sparrow + Wolf - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spring Mountain Sour = great house cocktail
Photo of Sparrow + Wolf - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Jump the Shark..

5sq7LhBJVHeYIcJgitERCg.text: Absolutely worth a trip off Strip to take in the place.  The bartenders have a list of cocktails that change seasonally, and they know how to make a balanced drink (sweet, acid, alcohol, aromatics). I loved the "Blister in the Sun" (Silver Tequila, Lime, Passion Fruit, Thai Chili Orgeat, Campari) which added the dimension of spiciness to the mix. But the others we had were also good.  Plate sizes are good for sharing, but the food is rich, so you can get full without having to order plate after plate.   Must haves include the cheek and marrow dumplings and the steak tartar. I am not the biggest fan of steak tartar, but this version with shitaki mushroom was fantastic.  We were able to sneak in early at the bar, but you will want to get a reservation unless you are feeling lucky.

photos.caption: Photo of Sparrow + Wolf - Las Vegas, NV, United States. beef cheek and bone marrow dumplings - an absolute must
Photo of Sparrow + Wolf - Las Vegas, NV, United States. barbecued salsify

_LPLyB1TbmvLpJcKYfWKCA.text: Really appreciated the unique dishes and innovative flavors here. I'd been meaning to go as the restaurant continues to be well-praised and so happy I finally got the chance to. Very interesting menu items, all with East and Southeast Asian flare, either through certain ingredients and spices or the preparation style more generally. This is an awesome place to come for a group that loves to share food, enjoys the flavors of different Asian cuisine, experiments with new combinations, and comes reasonably hungry. Really really beautiful plating, dishes, and colors as well. Only thing we did wrong was order two desserts, which were both really good, but were somehow bigger than the portions of each entree and we were way too full. My advice would be to try the sweet potato if you're a sweet potato lover! The creme fresh was awesome as a pairing, and they were deliciously sweet and cooked to perfection. It stood out probably because it so exceptionally surpassed expectations, and I always love a sweet potato. I reiterate that the dumplings are necessary. Loved the hamachi and grilled oyster prepared with miso. Short rib fell right off the bone and the bread cut the heaviness is the sauce. Kind of wish we tried the duck too or instead because I love a perfectly cooked duck, but still super happy with the preparation and flavor of the short rib. Toast for dessert!  To clarify, I don't think this restaurant necessarily tops popular contemporary Asian fusion restaurants in cities like NYC, DC, SF, and LA, but it sure does champion almost anything that exists in Vegas. Price point differences aside (this dinner was so reasonable compared to the strip!), the food at Sparrow + Wolf was also objectively much better than anything on the strip, but anyone from Vegas who understands the culinary scene here knows that's how it works. For Vegas, this restaurant is totally a hit, and I would easily come again to try new tastes once the menu changes. Chinatown never fails!

G5eRH-xBCfNghfHhMoi0Wg.text: Delicious food and spirits. Rotating/Seasonal menu keeps you coming back year around always pleasantly surprised. The bone marrow and salmon poke are lovely starters. Cocktails are wonderful! Highly recommend.

CZ9uFygipexEDgAih4AGiQ.text: This is a fusion/tapas trendy place but is actually REALLY good.   The drink menu is awesome especially if you want specialty cocktails. I liked the spring mountain sour. We also got the jump the shark that came in a novelty shark head. The food dishes were super creative. My favorites were the oysters, hamachi, and spanish octopus. The menu is pretty small so probably not the best place to take a picky eater. It also isn't the biggest space and there didn't seem to be a lot of big tables, but still would be perfect for a small group just because of how good the food/drinks were. Overall, I'd definitely go back!

NqO1rhwMFgFn30qK4UKbHw.text: Wow. Just wow. One of my top three picks for Restaurant Week. I am very late in getting in this review. Our server was great, he actually was our server last year when we came in. Wine list is very good and what we picked ended up pairing beautifully with the dishes served.    The swordfish aguachiles was delicious and I did not know you could put that much flavor into romanesco! And the steak tartar is a must order... ours was huge! We piled it onto the buttered, salted bread ( flip the bread over so the butter and salt gets your tongue first) and it was so tender and flavorful! It ended up being like an inch thick on the bread.   The scallops were perfectly cooked and I could have eaten six more of them. The brocollini, with a bit of heat, and the glorious lamb neck came next which was tender and flavorful and paired perfectly with the pickled fruit and veggies and the scallion pancake. Absolutely perfect and thank you so much chef for putting fried garlic chips on it!    The pecan cake for dessert - strawberry compote reminded us of our mom's homemade jam and the Thai basil on top with the crema cut back on the sweetness of the cake and made the flavors explode in our mouths.    We were offered to come back and see the kitchen which was actually fairly small for how many different ways they cook/prepare things. You can tell there is so much thought and effort put into their dishes. One of the best restaurants in Las Vegas!

WTxg9r-wMN2Lm97HW35Ltg.text: This has been on our list to try long before it was featured as one of the hot spots in LV in Desert Companion magazine. We were not disappointed.   We were seated in the back room off of the kitchen. We were the only ones in this area at 6:30 PM but that would soon change. Within the hour it was completely full.   Our waitress came no too long after to take drink orders and poll us to see if we had eaten there before. When we admitted we hadn't she explained nicely the concept of shared plates and some of the popular dishes.   They have great cocktails and spirit selections. Additionally the food was all superb. We ordered the charred romanesco, hamachi carpaccio, hearth baked bread, scallop robata, duck confit & sweet potato dumplings, and the massive 32-ounce bone-in T-bone served with all of the fixings. All food was great.   The busy restaurant did affect the service along the way as our waitress disappeared and we were wanting to reorder drinks. A sign of a good restaurant though, the manager checked in and saw we were needing refills and then began taking up the slack.   From the photos of the menus it appears they rotate their dishes depending on the season. We will definitely return to continue to explore the options!

gxjl9JHMjts9y2cwwioCeQ.text: It was a Friday night and my friend and I wanted to stay away from the strip. Sparrow and Wolf was recommended by a local. That might have been the reason for the difference of opinion. First, service was the best I've experienced in Vegas. Wish I could say the same about the food. Flavors were over powering. I like heat but I didn't expect the bone marrow to be very spicy which was disappointing. I prefer savory over sweet so I was looking forward  to the duck dumplings. This was just really salty. My friend and I had to eat bread  and drink lots of water between dishes to even out our palates. The saving grace were the oysters but we had those earlier on which served as a nice amuse bouche. The other dishes like the asparagus and scallops also too seasoned or salty. I had high hopes for this restaurant since it was highly recommended but sadly fell short. It felt like it was another Vegas restaurant that catered to tourists that didn't know any better. We didn't mention our disappointment  with the food but the Maitre'D and our server Soji were wonderful and attentative. The restaurant is quaint. Nothing really special. Being served family style, banquettes would do nicely in here vs. just the half booths Two tops are small if sharing dishes. Bar area did look appealing. Wish I could recommend this restaurant especially to my out of town friends but like me, they enjoy fine food and don't mind spending their money for it. Thank you

6NghOmLgQRLyANChGE7cXQ.text: Top notch service and food. Highly recommend this place to anyone who lives in or is visiting Las Vegas: well worth the trip  amazing and my new favorite place

yBqm7fV-U2k4ZT7nGR3vmQ.text: Had a great time tonight the food like always is amazing had beef tartare, Foie gras, and oysters. Recommend this place for everyone. They have great vegan options too

9fx-w4S0i18SxsR4YK6PAw.text: My boyfriend and I wanted to try this "hip" place for a long time and we were able to get a reservation fairly easy. The food came out pretty slow although there weren't that many people in the restaurant just yet. I really wanted to enjoy everything but cocktails were unimpressive and the food was very salty.  We had: 2 cocktails that I cannot remember + -wasabi and celery root oyster/miso&lemon oyster -hamachi carpaccio  -chinatown clam casino  -beef cheek &a bone marrow dumplings  Hamachi carpaccio came out first and was actually pretty good. But since it had so many flavors within the dish, I couldn't eat past 3 bites. The rest of the dishes were so salty, I kept drinking 4-5 glasses of water. Maybe my taste is too unrefined for these complex flavors, but I feel that they need to work on their seasonings and flavors first, not just trendy vibes and pretentious menu.

_ZnUJa_FMXLEdgjQkTXvdg.text: This is one of the restaurants we've been wanting to try for a while now and we finally made it in last night. Overall, we were very pleased with everything. The food was great and service was good for the most part. It definitely met our expectation especially after hearing and reading so much about this place. There were four of us and we spent $300 not including alcohol. We did order quite a bit of food. They're all small plates but shareable. Some of our favorites are the scallops, pate, Japanese sweet potato, the porterhouse steak, ocean parfait (uni) and the steak tartare. Here are some of the dishes that didn't quite meet our expectations. The bone marrow had way too much sauce on it and it was quite spicy. Can't really taste the bone marrow at all. The duck confit dumpling was too doughy, wasn't as flavorful as we'd like. Here comes the biggest disappointment. The special of the day, one soft shell crab in Panang sauce. The crab was too chewy yet hard to eat because the outer layer was already turning into a shell, there wasn't a whole lot of meat and what was on there had no flavor as if it had been defrosted or bought a while ago. It was not crispy and soft at the same like what you would expect from fried soft shell crab. I just feel like they missed the mark and for the price of $26 for the dish. We don't expect every dish to be perfect. However, our biggest disappointment of all which cost them 1 Star is how it was handled when we brought it up to their attention about the soft shell crab. We had a long discussion with our server about it and mentioned it to one of the managers when he came to dropped off our check and he just brushed it off. I'm not expecting any thing free but it just seems like they didn't care about our feedback enough to address it further. Would we give them another shot? Probably but won't be as enthusiastic about it like we were before.

H756VxkvTYSAIF-wrrOLZw.text: This was a great place! I took my boyfriend for his bday when we were in Vegas. It's only a short Uber from the strip. The ambiance was so neat. The service was fantastic. The food was delicious! And when they found out it was his bday, they even brought him out a little dessert. So nice! If you feel like getting away from the strip for a couple of hours for a nice meal, I would definitely recommend Sparrow + Wolf.

H_XL0TimU6AmHYW0xUnd_g.text: DELICIOUS FOIE GRAS.  MMMMMM YUMMY duck liver so rich and amazing.  Great restaurant.  Keep doing what you do best and ignore the rest. Outstanding.   Cheers.

Bq5hjJ-Qlu64R7-y0U39Iw.text: Worth the short ride off the the main strip.  Check in for your good free glass of wine. Great small menu and chilled atmosphere.

rJJktFL5o9t2cq_ksd79-A.text: Went there the other night to celebrate my husband bday. We decided to go here Bc of all the talks and raves about this place. We order the oysters, the short ribs , the beef cheek dumplings and a fish dish. Let me start by saying the only thing that was to our liking was the oysters and everything else was just mediocre.., talk about disappointment. Flavors seems to b either too salty or too much flavors going on that don't complement each other. This was our first and prob last time here. Been here tried it and nothing to rave about. We didn't even finish our meal

Kyd95171Xrx1AFdWdoByFg.text: Went for dinner mid September 2018. This place looks much bigger from the outside so for sure make a reservation!! The seating is limited! I had the dumplings and the Japanese sweet potato and my friend had the lasagna.  Both were great! Didnt get a chance to try the alcoholic beverages but they all looked great. Overall I would recommend this to anyone looking for something a little different in a cool environment.

hDl6T6gY5lXHIjZOiNcitA.text: Lovely, just lovely. I was able to try their new menu for 2018 and there were a lot of great things to try!   This time we got -Ribeye special -lobster dumplings -maitake mushroom -chinatown clams casino  -lime creme brulee   Service was okay here this time. Didn't feel like our server went so much out of his way for us but it wasn't bad either.   Finally got the full portion of the maitake mushrooms and it was just as good as the sample my friend made for me the first time I went. I almost finished the whole bowl to myself. I think that the clams are now 2 little ones for $7.50. I had ordered two pieces but our order came out with 4 shells. I was a little confused thinking they charged us for 4 but when the itemized check came out we were only charged for 2. Then I realized that the clams were a lot smaller than the last two times I went. We got the ribeye special cooked to medium. Sooo good and perfectly cooked! The lentils on this dish were amazing and everything went together so well. The lobster dumplings were eh. Not my personal fave, but honestly I think the bone marrow dumplings were better. For dessert I was torn between sticking to what I knew or trying something new. I loooove the honey toast here and it is honestly one of the reasons why I come back. I decided to step out of my comfort zone lol. I tried the lime creme brulee, which our server suggested was better than the honey toast. I gave it a try, really delicious, buuuuuut.... I have to say my heart is stuck on the honey toast.  Overall, still a great dining experience and it was actually better than the last time I came in. I love this place and I will keep coming back so long there is honey toast hahaha.

RPfsvu8kTD7wpWaF_gmcOg.text: Found this place after reading a story of crazy vegans protesting the place. Immediately booked a table (missed the protesters which I thought would have been great entertainment). Stepping into the door the atmosphere was electric and you could tell the people were enjoying their food and drinks. My bride and I were quickly seated and drink selection began. My wife ordered the apropos and although my drink tastes are simpler I have to admit it was amazing.  Our server could be an auctioneer telling us the specials and the staff on water duty were faster than a ball boy at Wimbledon. We ordered the steak tartare, oysters and tiger prawn appetizer which was amazing. A bit af a religious act as the server guided me through mixing the egg yolk in. I ordered the roasted duck and my wife the short rib.  The duck was amazingly delicious and rich. It was filling and I had a bite left at the end of the meal and was sorry there were no militant vegans I could share with and baptize them into the world of amazing food at the top if the food chain. My wife's short rib was perfectly seasoned but the bone was anything but short. I suppose its as a hand to hand weapon if your accosted by the nut job shouting guys in the parking lot on Fridays.  Management stopped by to ensure everything was to our satisfaction and informed us if upcoming events that although I was stuffed almost got my mouth watering again. Needless to say we will be back. Hopefully we will coordinate for a protest day and convert some misguided soul back to the path of sanity and deliciousness.

eO4WH1JIG_wpYPqN3n6FUg.text: This is the second time I've been here and the second time I indulged in the Chef's menu. If you come here it is worth every bite! The "Beef Short Rib Flinstone Bone" is to die for and the first time I came I had the scallop robots that just melted in your mouth. I know I will be back again and most like be doing the Chef's tasting menu for the 3rd time

P1_18znlSjuRrdqa50hvow.text: Must do the tasting menu and beverage pairing to get the full taste of what the kitchen at this place can do. My favorites are the "Flintstone" beef rib bone, the BBQ salsify, and the beef cheeks dumplings. It's only about a $9 lyft ride from the Cesar's on the strip and the food is better then most places on the strip. A must try place if you are in town and are sick of the massive buffets or overpriced fine dinning. This place delivers with food and drinks for half the price. Skip the crowds and hit Sparrow & Wolf. It will not disappoint. L

NRMRDnYPr2_4NN1MmAdG0A.text: Wow, Wow, Wow - walking into Sparrow + Wolf and you know these entrepreneurs have been to New York and Los Angeles. If you are a foodie or not this is a Must on your list. Longing for a cosmopolitan feel and Meat Packing District decor. This is a must on your list. Want to impress that lady or man and I say, a must on your list. The staff is going to explain the dishes and deconstruct them for you in descriptions all restaurants should take a page from.  Now for the food! Foie Gras over Brioche, Beef Cheek in Bone Marrow dumplings. Salmon Poke. All of it unique, delicious for the savory palette.   The entire experience was delicious and special! For those jaded but appreciative of eclectic and professional ability, please make this a mainstay in Las Vegas so I CAN RETURN TIME AFTER TIME.   Buon Appetite!

F59JCqct7Hc93-c5BlucOg.text: I through a large dinner party at S&W last night for 20 of my friends. I made all the arrangement with John the manager over the phone who by the way was extremely professional, courteous and accommodating despite my numerous demands. It ended up being a perfect dinner. It greatly exceeded my expectations!! From the unique intimate ambience, personnel treatment, delicious out of the box food ideas, exotic delicious and innovative cocktails and most importantly John's hospitality which is something you only encounter at the most sophisticated highly ranked restaurants. My guest loved and enjoyed the experience. Very highly recommended

E9Ng8c8oVYjSnMgyFnqAIw.text: Fantastic! Amazing drinks, great service and knowledgeable staff. Super fun and fabulous food. Off the strip by 2 miles and with the visit.

xdZJk_j3KqycWLqjwgMRxg.text: Solid.  Went to Sparrow + Wolf last night, and was not disappointed.  Very refreshing menu, great flavors.  The chefs did a good job with the menu selection.    They characterize the menus as small shareable plates.  The portions are larger than typical tapas, and 2 or 3 options are good for 1 person with a large appetite, 4 for 2 people with modest appetites.  The bolognese lamb lasagna is *really good*.  I hope that is a permanent dish on the menu.    Get the Caramelized Honey Toast for dessert.  Holy s*** it's good. Served with tarragon ice cream, and it is delicious.  Yep, tarragon ice cream.

WdE7kI6P0NOVDRlZbSj6QA.text: This is a great restaurant. Everything we ordered was fantastic. My husband and I try the steak tartare everywhere we go, but Sparrow and Wolf is the best we've had. The butter on the hearth baked bread is really good. We also had the charcuterie, beef cheek and bone marrow dumplings, and lasagna and we'd come back and eat everything again. The cocktails were different and delicious. Highly recommend.

xRhmdql0qMPG35JSWK9FBw.text: One of the best restaurants on or off the strip. If you want to eat at a place where the manager (John) touches each table with a passion for food and hospitality that's second to none - a place where the small plates are a hybrid of Providence on Melrose and Factory Kitchen in the Los Angeles Arts district - this is the place. Each small plate gives four guests a pretty good sampling. Some of the best dishes we've had in a long, long time were the beet salad with charred lemon ash and blue cheese; perfectly cooked octopus with house-made XO sauce; and beef cheek and bone marrow dumplings with reduced balsamic vinaigrette. We have never had digestives after the meal but this time we decided to try a couple and boy were we surprised on how effective they were. If the manger (John) isn't too busy, it's fun to hear him discuss the history of digestives.  This place is on its way to becoming one of the best restaurants in Las Vegas. Grab a seat now before the word gets out. It's only been open three months and it was packed tonight. I foresee in the near future that you will need to make reservations a month before your visit.   Loved this place loved the staff. John: thanks! You brought life to the food and took us on a culinary journey we will never forget.

W4c7zvZEY9nmB0Pve-rxew.text: We started with the charcuterie and were very impressed with the quality.  The beef cheek and bone marrow dumplings were so delicious !!   I had to sop up the broth with there spectacular bread .  We then split the scallop special.. also amazing .  Hand crafted cocktails scrumptious!!  I can't wait to go back

8xZdQqLeLtkKd3K6xZfujw.text: Our first time in after much anticipation.  I must say this place has great potential HOWEVER... Called ahead and a table was available.  Small room, intimate but loud. If that makes any sense.  The hostess informed us that they had just re-opened after re-tooling the entire menu.  This information really did not need to be disclosed. It just made us wonder why, and if something was wrong.   We were sat right away at a deuce in the middle of the room. But with no reservation on a Saturday night we weren't going to be too picky.   The server came to the table and just started our order. No greeting. No menu explanation. No specials. Nothing. So I introduced myself to her and greeted her instead to get things going.   We ordered cocktails before dinner. It took, and I am not exaggerating, 20 minutes to get an Old Fashion and a glass of wine.   We decided to order the charcuterie plate as a first course. A few minutes later she asked us if we wanted to order apps. So we did. 35 minutes later the second courses of apps arrived. When we asked for the first course they just said this is how it comes out. So finally after another ten minutes the manager brought out the first course.  The server talked me into the foie gras special app. At Market Price. Watch out for MP!  $30 for this dish.   Now it's been an hour and a half and we are really digging the food. Amazing flavor. The chef is very talented. The use of beets in 3 out of four of our dishes but all completely different in taste and texture was amazing.   When it came to finally ordering our main course we were informed that they were out of the dish. When u only have five entrees and u run out of one at 8 pm that's not a good sign.   The GF didn't want or couldn't eat any of the other four entrees so we decided to go directly to dessert and after dinner cocktail.   Upon finishing I tried unsuccessfully to wave down our server for fifteen more minutes. By now I am tired and getting ornery and just wanted to go home.   All in all the food was amazing. But the operations needs ALOT of work still.  I just don't know if I want to spend another two and a half hours and not even get dinner for another $150.   Good luck

b2cR7KYAZfn7LiSKYfM9Og.text: I would dine here every weekend if my wallet didn't hurt so much afterwards. Definitely a gem in Las Vegas for locals. They change their menu frequently and present amazingly thought out dishes. Definitely a must for the Locals to try out. Be prepared to spend a little if you want to experience a hand full of their dishes.

rAfHdypZYXEETzGPMdzKMg.text: How lucky are we to enjoy Chef Brian Howard's delicious, creative food. I relish his vegetarian and plant forward dishes as much as his traditional ones. This is such a wonderful complex chef driven menu with some of the best dishes in Las Vegas. I love sharing it with friends and family. His staff couldn't be more welcoming and expert.

ax_-5Fo2J8xDNETbEclqnw.text: Place is fantastic!  My wife and I went here and sat at the bar on a busy Saturday night and we had a great time.  The food is phenomenal and the service outstanding.  One of the best restaurants in the city!  Well done!

Co2Zqqd2-HpyX_FXs3QpGg.text: At first. I had high hopes. The decor is super cute with cool wall art all around. The hostess was very accommodating even after we showed up really late with reservations. Then things start to turn sour when our server takes our order. She was not friendly and had attitude. Think big blonde hair. After we placed our order she made it a point to tell us the dishes come out in order and not sporadic. We order bread, tartare, romanesco, soba duck for starters. Dumplings & duck for main. After about an hour after receiving starters we asked about our mains. The manager it seems, told us they were plating them. Ok cool. 20 minutes later nothing. My friend decides she was not hungry anymore and candles dumplings but I still want my duck. I was hangry at this point bc I saved my stomach for the main. I was then told that my duck was never ordered  the chefs comes out and says it will take 6-7 mins to make so I said ok I'll wait. 17 mins pass and nothing. Finally get my duck and it's salty and under cooked so it was chewy and not tender.  What a disappointment. So much pot

KRot2Pfu1vNqpc-XoVIXZw.text: So glad my wife and i made it here prior to starting Keto last week - kept the meal simple but so good.  The sour dough bread and butter is some of the best i have ever had and i lived in Bay Area where many tbibk it is an art form.  We also had the duck confut dumplings which were spot on with just enough flavor to make you think of having a second order (or third).  we also had the Pate en croute which was also spot on.  All of these items are no go now on keto but damn were they good.  As a former F&B resort dude and a life long foidie - this is now a spot for me.

4RKTKiuuSKxlFuTmxSchKg.text: We decided to do Thank$giving in La$ Vega$ this year, and was happy to find that several restaurants offered interesting twists on the traditional turkey dinner.  After having an excellent dinner at the new (less than 2 years old) Sparrow + Wolf, we find that we should eat off-strip more often!    LOCATION Vegas sort of has a Chinatown on the North side, but the layout reminds me a bit like Rowland Heights with lots of distributed strip malls loaded with restaurants and groceries that tend to open late.  Look for the mall with Macy's furniture and Sura BBQ Buffet and you'll see Sparrow + Wolf in bright white lights.  DRINKS Definitely recommend trying their libations.  Safeword is a nice, sweeter cocktail of pineapple rum,hazelnut orgeat, and chocolate sea salt.    FOOD We went for their special Thanksgiving menu.  I liked how they used lots of Asian flavors throughout the traditional turkey dinner.  They also specialize in wood-roasting their meats.  * Fuji Apple and Endive Salad was crunchy, bitter, tart, and savory at the same time. * Deviled duck eggs were really creamy and the mix of smoked salmon into the yolk added some extra umami. * Duck Confit Dumplings with sweet potatoes is a cute, Asian-inspired appetizer with a thick, rubbery skin to hold everything together and to soak up that bone broth. * For the turkeys, the wood-roasted breast was among the juiciest I've had.  The default gravy here was excellent.  We found the chicken-fried dark meat a bit on the dry side.  Apparently you need to use either the sweet cranberry or the super-spicy Japanese Mustard with the fried stuff. * Both sides were awesome - creamy mashed potatoes with dashi gravy was smooth.  Acorn squash with Korean sauce was sweet and spicy with nice crunch from the pumpkin seeds.  It was borderline dessert-like! * Lastly, pumpkin pie ended the meal perfectly.  Not overly sweet nor overly thick or rich. A well-executed Asian-style dessert where the miso whipped cream gives a light salty kiss.  Definitely a 5-star dining experience for Thank$giving!

3-U5NAlRvbDTol9RnPwY-w.text: We took our little one here knowing it wasn't kid friendly yet she enjoyed it although she was tired and sleepy.  She devoured the lasagna, giving it 9 out of 10. vsGd7Iol47AhR4u_6FFwfA.text: One of our favorite spots to go!  Everything from the staff to drink selection is top notch but the food is just extraordinary!  The menu is small but we like that the menu changes and we can try new things all the time.  The food is very creative and nothing you'll have anywhere else. They are the Picasso's of food!  We have been here about 3-4 times and each time there's something new that we want to come back for (like their hamachi collar!)   The ingredients always taste of the highest quality and extremely fresh. Staff is always attentive and polite but yet laid back and easy going. Place is always full and causally loud with table sod friends talking and laughing. The music is a good mix and not loud enough to have to scream over it to talk to your table. The openness of the kitchen is extremely inviting.   Can't wait for another date night to go back!

_uBSfg4Wamk70ORri-zlfg.text: I was taken here by a good friend of mine who knew me for more than twenty years and counting. He took me here because he had already been here once before, when it was less known.   It's in an old location, Chinatown of Vegas which is more of an Asian town, full of interesting restaurants and ethnically Asian beyond just Chinese.  Sparrow + Wolf is an interesting name and definitely much more subdued than your usual strip experience. He described it as more San Francisco restaurant, a bit of West meets East, a bit quirky and unexpected combination of ingredients mixed together. I can't help but wonder if he was describing the two of us. Completely different cultural background and experiences, a chance meeting on a white water rafting trip in the American river twenty some odd years ago that paired us together out of pure coincidence, and still together in our unusual ways, finding good eats wherever we go.   I didn't do the ordering as he ordered for us. Definitely the foie gras. Sweetbread, Hamachi, Salad, and Duck and some wine later. I don't think I've had a good meal like this in a while, the back east traveling and Asia travel did not yield any finds like this.  We had come here a few times now together, this was by far a more interesting outing than some of the other meals we have had in the past in Vegas.   Funny enough, A friend of mine just checked into this spot the very next night, clearly a crowd pleaser. I would absolutely recommend a reservation for those who come in a group. Otherwise, expect a wait.

2ai7eMinYb9tCVW7hI43Ig.text: The food was really delicious, no doubt. But the experience was soured by our car getting broken into. LVMPD gave us the impression this is a known problem by the owners. It's a shame the restaurants don't want to pay for security in their parking to take care of their guests. The wait staff however were sympathetic. I wish I could say I'd be back, but I'm doubtful.

L5WG6Kj_DnmpodOjPsFlNg.text: Absolutely the best place I've been too overall for the pure experience and service. Food was amazing the service was to a point. Magnificent. The drinks on top of it all were awesome too !  Ordered Steak tartare  Duck dumplings  Octopus salad  Cheese platter prosciutto ! Lots of drinks haha

UVm6PlIx_fvxhyjZxDfJ2g.text: Going against the crowd on this one...  Was so excited to try this place based off the reviews and beautiful photos...simply mouthwatering!  Unfortunately our dining experience was just a little bleh. Don't get me wrong, the food was yummy, but not "blow your mind, this is amazeballs, I want this again" kind of yummy that I was expecting.  Ordered a couple of cocktails, creative but a little strong on their flavors.  We also ordered charred romanesco (really good), duck confit and sweet potato dumplings (meh), scallops and a their fresh baked bread.  Interestingly the scallops were served with 3 turnips that were poached to "mimic" scallops...I rarely don't eat something on a plate but these weren't my thing (and I do like turnips!) The harvest bread with umami butter and salt flake was too hard for me. The crust was quite thick and difficult to chew :(  Butter was good, but hey who doesn't like butter!! The restaurant has a rotating menu, so we may have just hit it on a bad night or ordered the wrong things.  All in all i was a bit disappointed, may try again though!  All these great reviews cant be wrong, but for now 3 stars from me!

33_d8fZINvrpa5IB5zHABA.text: This restaurant had great service and everyone was very attentive to keep glasses full throughout the dinner. Everyone was very friendly as well.    For food just be aware that portions are very small, almost like tapas.  We ate family style which was a good choice because there were so many delicious items on the menu. We had 6 people in our group which gave us each a small taste of some of the smaller dishes. For our main courses we ordered the porterhouse special which was large and gave us all a decent amount of meat. It comes with a lot of side dishes as well so if you go with this option I would hold off on ordering sides until you find out what the steak is served with.   I'm gonna start a new section to talk about the scallops separately because they were SOO good.  If you're deciding between scallops and something else either order both or just the scallops.    Drinks were good. Tried a few and all were delicious.  Oyster were decent but not fantastic.

2K7cxdoFQ-Q3eqcIskPA8A.text: This place....is amazing. We started with their specialty cocktails and all were amazing. They can, also, make a dirty martini. The bento box was the perfect way to begin our dining experience. Between the five of us, we almost couldn't order more food! But I'm glad we did. We had the kumato tomato tartine, charred romanesco, osso buco tortellini and then...the dry aged porterhouse. I've never had a porterhouse cooked more perfectly throughout. What an amazing experience in Chinatown!

gORzh1Sm-M6G9fuVPFfqgA.text: Came here and got the Salmon Poke, Beef cheeks + bone marrow dumplings, Lasagna, octopus, duck, and mushrooms.  There were some tiers in terms of the quality of food IMO.The dishes on one level were the poke, dumplings, and duck.   The poke was on this crunchy rice wrap and had the szechuan peppercon flavoring. Loved using the wrap as a vessel to consume the poke and the spice had a nice subtle kick (assuming you are used to szechuan cuisine).  The dumpling had this green onion foam on it, which I didn't think added much except for presentation. The actual dumpling had a thicker/harder skin than most dumplings. I think it really meshed with the thicker filling well though. Make sure you use the base with the dumpling as it might be a bit bland without it (since the skin is thick).  The duck had some foie gras on it and that was delicious. The duck stole the show though. Definitely had no gamey taste and was just cooked perfectly. On the more rare side, and had a nice outer layer vs just meat. It had a great balance of meat + skin/fat and that made the bites that much more delicious. I really prefer having both in my bites.  The mushrooms. It was hummus (not special) + some terra chips (def not special) with 3 pieces of mushrooms. Was not worth...  The octopus had some korean sauce on the outside and it was pretty spicy. I thought the quality of the octopus was really good, it was just that there was too much sauce and that didn't sit well with me. Overwhelming flavor, because of that reason I'd pass on that.  The lasagna wasn't that special IMO. The doughy layers were very soft, almost like mac and cheese texture so that was nice. I couldn't tell the lamb was lamb (tasted like beef tbh). Not sure why use lamb when it just tastes like beef.  Overall it's a great experience. If you stick with some certain dishes you will love this place

photos.caption: Photo of Sparrow + Wolf - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Sparrow + Wolf - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Cg3OsF_BPr4o7chm4VClTA.text: I've been wanting to try this place since it opened last year, but every time we craved American food, we would go to the strip. Finally, the boyfie surprised me with dinner here after my flight. We were on time for our reservation, but still had to wait 15 mins. It was fine because we ordered drinks in the waiting area :)  Ordered: x Casino Clams - This was probably my favorite dish of the night. One clam topped with a couple pieces of uni. Delicious, but very rich. Expensive, though.  x Bone Marrow - MMM, I love bone marrow! Can never go wrong with this dish. I just didn't like how they put meat on top of the marrow... it was almost TOO rich. We actually ended up taking all the meat off and pushing it aside.  x Beef Cheek and Bone Marrow Dumplings - I couldn't really taste the bone marrow because the beef cheek was so overpowering. It was tasty, but a very heavy dish. wish there was more texture inside the dumpling. Beautiful presentation, but just didn't cut it for me. x Duck Entree - Delicious duck. Really enjoyed how this was prepared and it was cooked perfectly. Flavors were good.  I left feeling stuffed, which I HATE. Everything was so heavy and buttery... Maybe next time around I'll order a few lighter dishes and maybe less meaty dishes? I really like the innovation here, but it's just sooooo heavy :(

photos.caption: Photo of Sparrow + Wolf - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Sparrow + Wolf - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Sparrow + Wolf - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Q-vqUn5PdxOYWRprZPu07w.text: TL;DR. Casual Fancy. Family-style sharing meals. Great quality!  Come, my friendly folk. Come around the digital campfire! I came here with five other friends. We ordered ten items to share. Some of us got cocktails, which were great! Three of the six in the party could eat big meals as a norm, but we were all full by the eighth item.  Gastronomically fantastic. Surprising blend of flavors. Great for dates, meetup with a friend, or celebrations. Not much in terms of large tables. Keep your party to two people or up to four. Anything larger, you may need to secure reservations early.  The dress attire of the crowd goes from business casual to fancy.

tIVSA2FnTlVI0CLO8gxA2g.text: After going here twice in one month, all I have to say is this place is AMAZING. But some important points first:   1) MAKE A RESERVATION !!!! It's a small restaurant, if you just randomly walk in on Friday/Saturday night, I promise your wait will be 1-2 hours.   (Also, for a reservation online you must submit a credit card and they WILL charge you if you don't show OR arrive late, they will even charge you a percentage for each guest - so take your reservation seriously)   2) Meals are generally for sharing   3) Unless you are a chef or a member of the culinary academy - I wouldn't expect to understand the menu - it's as if it's written in another language and a bit confusing - BUT I PROMISE the food is actually amazingly delicious!!   The servers were knowledgeable about the menu, which we all appreciated because no one understood what the menu had to offer, but they were patient and answered all our questions.   My favorite cocktail is the Wooden Shoe  My favorite meals were the porter house steak and duck   It's an upscale restaurant in Chinatown without the cost and annoyance of the strip. You could possibly spend hundreds of dollars here or at least $50 for one meal/drink

-DVstzGJ-iKd_93SiONjiQ.text: After years of patronizing the Las Vegas strip, I have finally had it. All these big name restaurateurs have in the last decade or so set up shop on the strip. The food is, for the most part, average; the prices are sky high and the service stinks.  So lately I have taken to checking out the off-the-strip establishments. And I have to say I have been amply rewarded. Case in point, Sparrow + Wolf. OMG! A foodie's haven away from the torture of the strip. Located in Chinatown, it is nouveau cuisine but totally relatable. Fresh new takes on the classics.  The place is cozy, intimate and friendly. The fare superb.  Tuna poke, wood fired lasagne, beef cheek and marrow dumplings and short rib (see pictures) just blew us away (my daughter and her husband from New York were my dining companions). A lovely experience complemented by very friendly staff.

photos.caption: Photo of Sparrow + Wolf - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Wood-fired lasagne
Photo of Sparrow + Wolf - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef short rib
Photo of Sparrow + Wolf - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef cheek and marrow dumplings

tQL-SaPxyEGDcaCG9j5d6g.text: As a foodie i appreciate their creativity and long outside the box.  I enjoyed most of our 11 items but i wish i knew the porterhouse was huge! We got a free wine after checking in.

photos.caption: Photo of Sparrow + Wolf - Las Vegas, NV, United States

yLW0TetN8oQgN6rOOEt7eA.text: Finding a neighborhood gem outside the strip is always a big plus for me. I get to avoid all the hassle and parking that dining on the strip brings about.  Sparrow and Wolf is definitely a gem, arguably a diamond. It has a cozy vibe, and a lot of energy in the room from other tables conversations. I love that the menu is simple, yet there is enough in there to satisfy anybody and your party.   We went with the beef cheek and bone marrow dumplings, the roasted mushrooms with Turkish hummus, The flintstone short rib, and the duck breast with foie gras.  Everything was fantastic! We were both surprised how great each plate was - a perfect combination of textures, flavors, and spices. We then went for dessert and had the honey toast and the coconut beignets. Both really amazing, but the honey toast had me at hello.   All the plates are designed for sharing (including desserts), so bring friends and try to sample as many plates as you can, as everything we tried was excellent. I will be back soon :)

vvmWx9sYSe3aOd5NQlXF7Q.text: First, John and Acacia are so good at what they do. They, along with the service staff are knowledgeable, professional, and accommodating. EVERYTHING has been AMAZING every.single.time we eat here! The menu changes often enough it's easy to be surprised by new deliciousness each time we go; whether it's cocktails or food items-always creatively imagined, always beautifully presented. We'll keep coming back; we'll keep bringing our friends.

CE7cPiJwk69Grf_Kz_G02Q.text: The service is great. The ambience is perfect for a date or night out. The food here has potential. There is an Asian fusion style to it. I believe they should add more entrees but perhaps they are going for tapas style. I tried the bone marrow and they were tasty!

z7_PfEa_65v9tnLojAdHFQ.text: Amazing food, John and Jason did a terrific job in assisting us with the menu. Extremely helpful.

photos.caption: Photo of Sparrow + Wolf - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Absolutely amazing , service was on point.  John and Jason did a wonderful job with assisting us in a fabulous menu selection .

YDDTuWqCEcyJDK-V2pctnA.text: Had my BfFF's bday dinner here. Love everything about this place, the food, the ambiance, the service. 5-star deserving!

T5FPiBIC9HF5NwbVX-_LtQ.text: Was taken here for a surprise dinner for my birthday last night. And I did not mind it at all.  Our party of 3 walked in around 8:30 pm with no reservations but we got seated at the bar immediately by John, who was happy and friendly when greeting us. The restaurant is very hipster but also stylish and upscale. Loved the interior decor.   Our bartender, Andrew, had lots of suggestions on wines. I love it when bartenders share the wealth of knowledge that they have. We were also asked if we wanted tap water or bottled Voss water and I know that made my friend happy because she's such a water snob, lol. The menu is simple but has lots of variety.   We ordered the maitake mushrooms, 2 orders of the lamb udon, and the scallops. My friends were raging over how good the maitake mushrooms were. I tasted the scallops and was very impressed. So buttery! It makes up for the fact that the scallops came out later than the rest of our food. Also, I want to say that the lamb udon IS ALL THE HYPE because it was soooo bomb. It needs to be ordered with the egg, in my opinion.  Will definitely be coming back! Andrew and John were so amicable and professional and customer service did not disappoint.

photos.caption: Photo of Sparrow + Wolf - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The cutest little shot, thanks to Andrew, the bartender
Photo of Sparrow + Wolf - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lamb bolognese udon

rwSUsF85ubnmpE-4KeEplw.text: This probably is my favorite restaurant in town right now! I was born and raised in Las Vegas, I came up in the Las Vegas service industry from a Busser to a GM at the top restaurants and lounges on the strip including, Aureole...I've dined at most of all the top spots on and off the strip - so I like to think I know what a great dining experience is. The menu is always amazing here and I've got to rank the oysters, porterhouse, and foie gras at the top with all of the different small dishes and sauces that compliment this mastery of dry aged meat, chimichurri, and chili paste were my favorites! The wait staff is friendly and knowledgeable the hostess was very accommodating and the two times I've been there I've had conversations with the owner and chef who is extremely talented in his craft; definitely world class skill and devotion. I'd recommend this restaurant to anyone who likes great food and service and wants an awesome dining experience!

Photo of Sparrow + Wolf - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oysters on a Half With Various Toppings

3OWzuH_5gQFcusUr6GjR5g.text: I had a pleasant experience, the food was great I didn't try any beverages besides rose. I felt a little rushed, the waitress initially said they closed at a later hour. Then once my friends arrived she said they closed at 10pm. We would have enjoyed more food and cocktails if they stayed opened a little later but still not a deal breaker. My friend said she was very informative. They had 3 specials for the evening, we enjoyed their octopus special. We also enjoyed a mix of oysters, scallops, hamachi,broccolini, and bone marrow dumplings. The scallops are a must! They are extremely spicy and trust me I can handle spicy. The broccolini was super delicious a little spice as well. The oysters tasted fresh the only down side is that one had an Asian meat according to my friends and the other trio had dairy. The hamachi was a little sweet but still delicious and finally the octopus. The octopus was my favorite dish! I don't consume red meat nor poultry so I didn't enjoy the dumplings nor the duck. My friends however, said the dumplings were amazing and the duck was a pass.

y20SR5c1pSFvPav_aSPNHQ.text: Really disappointed in this restaurant. I was looking forward to trying it. My friend made a reservation for a Friday evening. Due to a flight change, we had to cancel the reservation 28 hours in advance. They charged us 150 dollars for the cancellation. Now I will never go to this restaurant & would advise others to do the same. This is absolutely ridiculous. What if someone was in an accident on the way to their reservation? Would they get charged this inordinate amount of money too? I realize this may put a slight hardship on a restaurant to book people & then have them cancel. But, things come up & they should be more understanding.

S7K_m0o5Ct7Uq4maAcxDJw.text: What a great spot!!!!  We came to check this place out finally and were not let down!!! The ambience is great whether your looking for a date spot, bar spot or get together with friends spot.  The menu has something for everyone and we will definitely be back to try more!!  Tonight we just had a few drinks and the duck breast with foie gras which was to die for!!! Foie gras is a go to for me anytime I see it and this one was amazing!!!!  Looking forward to going back and trying the other menu items!!

y-11rAeC4CkTU0yXHcepZQ.text: There are not enough good things to say about Sparrow + Wolf. This is a terrific restaurant, run by terrific people, who understand food, service, and hospitality. It's old world and new world meeting in the same place, with great care and respect shown for ingredients and patrons alike. This is the kind of place that gives me hope about dining in Las Vegas - pushing the boundaries, but always with flavor at the forefront. And don't forget the beverage program - smart and playful cocktails with a well designed wine list... this is a don't miss!

4M3GFBNxiXFCn8VDSgbc2Q.text: Unbelievable how good the food is here. Must eat for anyone visiting Vegas. Wife and I absolutely loved it.

hKjRqW_iT35-2Vnfflvoqg.text: Probably the best restaurant in Las Vegas.  Seriously!  What else do you need to know?  The food is incredible, the cocktails are divine, the service is professional and attentive, and the decor is attractive and understated.  Get off the Strip and visit Sparrow & Wolf immediately!

cOlDUeEaZR25sn2mKh9uDQ.text: Saw all the photos and rave reviews and dropped by on a whim. The hostess was really nice and said they only had bar seating and that was fine, I thought of this place last minute....but as we sat at the bar she realized a table opened up and asked if we wanted it after they set it up...of course! We sat at the bar and waited and the bartender was uber friendly and mentioned to not feel locked down to the drinks on the menu that they loved making freestyle drinks...when our table opened up they joked that we left them haha. The waiter took awhile to get to our table but it was fine, took us much longer to decide on what we were drinking and the menu was interesting. We ordered a bottle of Pinot Noir and I love that the Pinot they have is from Willamette...it's my favorite region for a Pinot and it was delicious. We asked him for recommendations on food and the choices all sounded even better! We love the story behind the casino clams and ordered that, bone marrow, bread, and the beef rib that he said was new on the menu. The bone marrow dumpling was so delicious...he said the bread would be good with it for the sauce...but the only bad thing about this place was that bread....it was so hard....you could break a tooth! The casino clam was the most flavorful thing I've ever had and I couldn't even describe it or compare it to anything except say it's amazing and a must order. The beef rib was good, but next time I'd probably eat 2 Casino clams instead. I decided to have dessert since I was on a winning streak. I tried the lemon souffle cake, and it was very light and I love how it just finished the palate nicely. My boyfriend didn't like the noise level in here, he loves a quiet place...I had. I problem with it...the food was spectacular. I'll be back for sure. Yummy!

photos.caption: Photo of Sparrow + Wolf - Las Vegas, NV, United States

5Xpn9MpU4Fnvd0uWiwwFkA.text: Probably one of my best dining experiences I've had lately. The ambiance of the place is quite romantic and not just for a date with your significant other but with friends or family. Our waiter was really sweet & accommodating, if only I could remember his name. He made sure to share with us the specials and informed us if there was a certain dish or drink that they were running low on or wasn't available and offered recommendations for alternatives.    My friend and I order the oysters, the big ass pork shank (yes, that's the actual name), and the Bone Marrow Log with escargot and mushrooms. It doesn't seem like a lot of food but it was really filling for two people. Especially, the big ass pork shank! Everything was very flavorful and the pork shank melted in your mouth. I highly recommend it as well as the bone marrow log. I actually recommend everything we ordered. We were not disappointed at all.   As for the drinks, they're on the pricier side but they did come in a cool, rose gold Gnome. Sadly, we couldn't keep it but it was definitely IG worthy! The drinks were tasty so I have no complaints there. I will definitely be going back there again!

p4o4sq6uBcADHwKSDWUFmA.text: Perfect for a date night especially if you are willing to try something new because everything We ordered I have never tasted. Sure I've had it prepared differently but they really get creative. My boyfriend is a chef and for him to have loved this place also says a lot.   PROS: FOOD is enough!! So full!!:)  Modern intimate feel customer service was great! Well rehearsed on their menus and recommendations  CONS: We got lucky :) however if you do plan on visiting I would highly recommend a reservation:)   View my images but beware your mouth may start watering lol

gZJiasd4DDcsvUWy1r7fIg.text: Came in around 8:30 on a Monday night for a friend's bday. The place was pretty packed; there were no available tables but 3 seats at the bar were ready for us. Upon entrance, I noticed the lovely decor they have and very intimate atmosphere - perfect for a date night or girl's night out!   The menu isn't extensive but has a good variety. We started with wine (I chose Riesling) and water (you can choose from voss or tap). The bartender, Andrew, let us taste the wine before committing to anything. Im not sure if this is standard whether you're sitting at the bar and/or table or not. Anyway, we went ahead and ordered 2 of the udon, maitake mushrooms, and scallops. The udon came out first, then the mushrooms. There was a 10-15 minute wait after the udon then the scallops came out... but trust me when I say it was totally worth the wait! So buttery and so so good. The udon was cooked perfectly. The mushrooms were paired with the crispy things (i forgot what they're called lol).   The service at this establishment is wonderful, to say the least. John, the manager I believe, even took the time to chat with us - such a delightful human being! My friends and I will definitely be back!
