q5GO6IHETSGon0ECygeiPQ.text: Love this place-delicious menu, wonderful staff, and creative drinks. Love the tasting menu and they catered to our friends crazy allergies with ease! Your stomach and wallet will leave fuller than you expected for sure! John Anthony is always so personable and friendly- definitely makes you feel at home

n9_Dz4GJBhhuJF2Ao8DrHw.text: Just tried this place for the first time.  Food is devine!  Had the artichoke, farm egg, and daily special of trout for dinner.  Each ingredient in each dish made sense and really shined.  Will definitely go back to try more dishes.

D8kLnUogGE-BUSM5J41hkw.text: Absolutely amazing and delightful experience. If you're in Las Vegas, be sure and get off the Strip and indulge yourself. You will not be disappointed.

PSYXQbBh9lY0M07UNeptCg.text: Very good with a different menu, it reminded me of girl in the goat in Chicago. I like it when the owner comes to your table and gives his recommendation a very unique experience.

IftPulmKIU-rGqwBBzq_jQ.text: Very nice new restaurant. Owners are both super friendly. Restaurant is beautiful, definitely spend time and money on the decor and design. Monday's is a bartending competition with a fun young crowd. Recommend the oysters they have their own unique sauces for them. Happy that Vegas is finally getting fun hip restaurants that we need!!

hnuyX17HIOSEJWeeaRu-Ag.text: I first want to start out by saying this is the strongest four I could give and the only reason I say that is because I know the great potential that is in store for this restaurant and will only get better from the opening bumps that are occurring. Any pictures you have seen of this great restaurant do it absolutely no justice it is quite smaller than it looks and much warmer than it appears through photography it is welcoming for any people of any age it is truly a neighborhood restaurant. Upon entering the restaurant with a brief tour and sitting down our server took our drink order and sadly it took over 22 minutes to receive our cocktails. While they were fantastic, that time was just a little bit too long for comfort. It would take too many pages to describe all the food that my party had last night I believe we ordered 22 of the 25 dishes the restaurant served. I personally wanted to love every single one of them while some were exceptional some fell short of the mark.  But as I stated before I do understand opening restaurant bumps and I know these will be mended as time goes on. The best way to describe last night's evening is the wild beautiful powerful stallion was finally let loose and is finally able to do his own thing after being kept cooped up in the barn for so many years. This restaurant has nothing but a phenomenal future in front of it and I personally wish the chef and its entire staff nothing but great things that will absolutely be on the horizon for them as they continue to show the passion on each plate of food  and attention to service.

LA7egmLwfefAAgkfSW_oZA.text: Found this place on accident after shopping at the Macy's Home Store.  My fiance and I spent the afternoon working on our wedding registry and we're starving. We noticed Sparrow + Wolf and decided to give it a try. We walked in and the hostess asked if we had a reservation, when we said no, they said the next table would be be available until 9:30 so we said it was too long and started to walk out.  That's when we noticed Chef Brian come out and verify with the hostess that there was indeed no tables. As we stepped out of door trying to figure out where else we could go, Chef Brian came out if we would like to sit in kitchen. We said sure and the took a few minutes to set up a couple spots at the center counter.  The food was fantastic and Chef Brian served us himself, describing every dish as he brought them out.  Every dish we ordered was fantastic and there wasn't a single thing we didn't like and had so much fun. Every dish we saw being made made me want to try it.

UHJJL41QgGKVsu8jXtx7dA.text: Amazing experience from start to finish. The coal roasted beets and endive was a new and progressive dish that could have gone terribly wrong, but managed to be surprisingly fresh and delicious. The Big-Ass Pork Shank was delicious. The Calamansi Tart was amazing. The vanilla, lemon and blueberry flavors were a perfect combo. Finally, the "Get Off My Lawn" cocktail was quite possibly the best cocktail I've had. The smooth cognac and maple syrup taste slowly faded as the bitter Amari and smoky cedar slowly crescendoed to form a perfect balance.

ER0i1fl9dT2CW1PzPDgWfg.text: What an incredible experience for the senses. This is exactly the type of restaurant the Las Vegas Local scene needs. The atmosphere and overall aesthetic appeal is very inviting, with the modern/rustic touch that has been on the rise. The menu offerings are eclectic and elegant. Every dish was well planned. We ordered the China town clams - possible the best bite of the night. The farm egg was a heavenly complete breakfast satisfying the every breakfast craving possible. Beef check & bone marrow dumplings left us in a euphoric sublime culinary daze. Holy F*ck those are incredible!!! We then moved on the Farm Beef Skewers and we found ourselves once again sapping up every last morsel of flavor from the plate. Sparrow & Wolf is a must try if you haven't already.

kpSM16z2wq6PFvyVKdvVpQ.text: Eat the duck! The people are great. Food is great. Atmosphere and music is unique and fun. Great unique drinks expertly crafted. Cant say enough good things. Just go try it.

1YhwV2l0qfhiae5WMtL3Tw.text: So disappointing!!! After all the great reviews and premise of a creative, tasty menu I left wondering what all the fanfare was about. My husband and I got there for an early 5:45 reservation and yet the service was so incredibly slow. It took about an hour to get a charcuterie plate (no cooking involved) and the bone marrow (which contained about a tablespoon of actual marrow). We both got the duck which was good but small in portion. We're not ones with huge appetites yet left wondering what we'd eat when we got home.

T0UcUGJxdJO2jJVGlkgt4Q.text: Tried this place out today, service was great, food was good too. Some dishes more exceptional than others, but overall everything was tasty. Worth a visit!

BYl9JAJJ_Fzs862EfLNgfw.text: This is the best food in the world, my suggestion for something to order is the udon or the pork shoulder, I would highly recommend this restaurant to everyone, the way this food is crafted is like never before.

USspMmb79HoFASivyrAWlg.text: The food here is great. We had the cod and sweetbreads and I had the duck ending with Matcha beignet. All fantastic. The service was also pleasing. My companions and I didn't enjoy the ambiance nor the overall look of Sparrow and Wolf. The walls looked thrown together and it was painted like a child had done it. Since I was facing a wall that's all I could see. I think it has the potential to look really classy hipster which is what I think they were going for. I'd like to return again when maybe they've been open for some time and have had a little more time to get things just the way they want.

yp4XvLBLH99abXBm1U3Czg.text: Very clever and delicious. The service was fantastic and food was very well thought out. Everything tasted very fresh and they did a great job accommodating our group size which kept changing. Presentation was beautiful.

6KFZoia73X4tQ5pGXRfhIw.text: Campfire duck and Calamasi blueberry tart are the BEST! Thanks for the great food and service. We have a fantastic experience!

lvwjov_0TTvaoO-0Az2TuQ.text: I was there on opening night with a group of 14.  I am a steak and baked potato woman so I was fortunate to have a friend sit next to me who interpreted the menu.  We all shared our dishes so I tasted so many foods that I couldn't pronounce and had sweetbreads for the first time in my life. The flavors are indescribable  and all the servers were friendly and attentive. The drinks were all yummy and each one looked so tempting.  It was an awesome experience!  Opening night was a success and I wish them great things because Vegas needs great food off the strip.

l3f3PlsQeo_5KA3flWDFBQ.text: I really enjoyed this unique place. The dishes are small but so delicious and the swrvice waa great. We got seated right away, and our waitress was very knowlegdeabble about the dishes which i find very rare in restaurants. My husband and I shared the artichoke, fried egg, pork tenderloin special, duck, and the beef skewers. My favorites were the artichoke and pork tenderloin. My husband loved the duck and the fried egg.

xm2X4lJUlZb1yfjXcS8HqQ.text: SUPERB! Great service, excellent food. When a place has the nuts to charge $6 for bread, and you order a second helping of it, you know it's good.  Chef Brian should be much more famous than he is.  The place is a little small, so I'd suggest avoiding the dinner rush, but their were plenty of seats after the rush was over on our one visit.  If there's one thing working against this place, it's location in Chinatown may be scaring away the round-eyes... but it's totally worth the trip.

3kyO3fmmeFR4UgBHKQBMVA.text: On our never ending search of the perfect Old Fashioned . . . . I think our search is OVER.  I'm hesitant to even disclose this location as we want it all for our selves.  It was hard to get a seat at the bar as we didn't have reservations and the bar was even reserved for the night.  Luckily, the owner Brian made an accommodation for us at the bar as we were just going to order drinks and would not be staying for dinner.  I'm so glad he did this for us.  The experience was amazing!!  We will definitely be back and if that is on the weekend, we will make reservations next time.  We look forward to trying the food as it is unique and looked fantastic.  And a big shout out to Jackie and Sarah the GREAT tenders of the bar!!  See you soon!  M&M

1b3vXY8a4twTP0oSKU0JGQ.text: Excellent food. I was rreally amazed at the reasonable prices for the main courses. I had the duck and had a taste of halibut. Both were excellent. I also  had a taste of the lamb tartar that was also excellent.

eqa56fmIe4lujn-HyRBq0A.text: Good meal off the strip. Great value as you get a lot more for less. The hamachi was really really well done. I've had variations of this dish many times and this may be the best.  Dinner * Hamachi (Excellent) * Clams (Great) * Cheek and Marrow Dumplings (Good) * Foie Duck (Great) * Lasagna (Good)

7-eSmMVEjBrsPa25uLuWMg.text: Dinner date on Saturday and first time here ... we made a reservation but I'm pretty sure you really don't need to make one since there was plenty of seating. I like that the menu is simple and has a great variety to choose from. Also love the ambiance nice alternative music. YaXH5H9cyFLhr4wQCByumg.text: Always a pleasure dining in here. Menu changes and that's good because I always want to try something new. Service is great as well. We have been in here multiple times and all those times did not disappoint.

dPLDgEOpRdfY_bKkARjdJg.text: Food was amazing ..will definately get that porterhouse steak again... service was great as well ty..

4N8XkpWTbdmiic8KGLjL2g.text: A fine dining experience in Chinatown! Food is excellent here, we tried six different dishes in a tapas style sharing diner, and all of them were amazing! First some grilled Miso and lemon oysters, and although oysters are generally better enjoyed raw, it was great. We followed with a swordfish ceviche, a little salty, but fresh and well seasoned. Some delicious pan roasted scallops, and grilled bone marrow; spicy and aromatic. The two main dishes were a backed whole snapper (special not on the menu), the best fish we've had in Vegas hands down, and braised lamb neck, so soft that the meat comes off the bone instantly, marinated in some amazing caramelized sauce! Truly every single dish was excellent, specially the last two! It's True the check was much higher than what we usually like to spend on a diner, but what's pricey for us might be pocket change for others...

Photo of Sparrow + Wolf - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Private dining room

obOquaQTuJmiIgijJ5K_NQ.text: I have been to sparrow and wolf three times so far, their inventive ever changing menu with high quality ingredients keeps briging me back. This last time I went, was the first time since I stopped drinking. My body just did not respond well to it at all anymore,  and it was not worth feeling terrible for days after just a drink.  However,  it made me so sad because while I was never a heavy drinker, I really do enjoy a drink with a nice meal, and sparrow and wolf bar far has served me some of the best cocktails I have ever had.   I asked if there was any possibility that they might have a mocktail option for me.  My server very diligently asked all the flavor profiles I didn't like and did like,  I also told him the two drinks I had there I loved in the past.  My past favorite drinks were the wooden shoe, and you can prevent forest fires.  They then brought me this very elegant yuzu forward drink! I have been searching for a good mocktail all these months and they were the first to get it right! Also they made me like oysters ! It's only happened one other time in Portugal on the dang beach lol their grilled miso butter oyster is everything.  I basically licked the  inside of the shell.  Now since their menu changes you can't guarantee what you enjoyed will be there again, but my top favorite items are..   The campfire duck, perfectly cooked duck with foi gras and mushroom in a sauce that is bursting with umami flavor.  China town clams casino,  such a great spin on a classic! Lap cheong and uni on a clam! Yes please!  The ocean parfait, creamy uni nestled in a warm creamy sea of magic.  Super unique,  and for sure not for someone who has issues with texture, or  does not share my extreme love of uni.    Steak tartar,  so full of flavor,  so fresh,  and the garlic bread paired so well.  Way more hearty and filling then I thought it would be. The egg always made me wary,  but I'm glad I finally tried it.   Halva ice cream with warm beignets in a yuzu sauce. Creamy,  cool,  acid,  finished with a warm hug.   Chocolate miso eclair with a gingerbread crumble.  Super rich and decadent but so many fun flavors.   There's very few items I didn't fully feel,  and only two I disliked.   The hamachi carpaccio is a story of highs and lows,  some of the fish its self, apart from the dressing, was full of flavor and other parts had no taste.  Also while the fried garlic added a unique contrast, it started to take over,  and left a very lasting taste in your mouth.   Buddha claw creme brulee.  The custard had curdled a bit so it was not smooth and creamy and for sure was not zest peices.  It had been a bit clumsy in general. I liked the concept but execution lacked.   Soothsayer cocktail,  took two sips and then no more.  It was terrible and cloying.  Didn't taste all the lovely layers I was anticipating.   The white chocolate terrine with flourless chocolate cake and pear sauce.. Confused me not really any white chocolate to be seen,  super dense cake layered with some type of nut or seed butter and dots of pear sauce.  Just so heavy,  kinda gets mucky and stuck in your mouth.   Overall they have so many highs and they make me so excited about food, so in the end they get 5 stars.  When you experiment with food as often as they do, it's hard to not once and a while have something that does not stick. The bill each time for two before tip has ranged from about 100-120, and I left feeling very satiated.  The plates range from tapas size to large appetizer.  The only exception currently I know of is their bachan porterhouse,  one is a meal for 2 and is about 85 dollars last time I checked.  The decor is fun,  and the sound levels can be a bit high for my taste.  If you have a relative who is hard of hearing,  or a date you want a quiet romantic dinner this is it.  If you want to fill yourself with unique food inventions and awaken your palate,  in a more vibey gastropub then this spot is for you.

photos.caption: Photo of Sparrow + Wolf - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Scallop with pesto
Photo of Sparrow + Wolf - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kaffir lime coconut panacotta with rhubarb. Fun idea but did not blow my mind.
Photo of Sparrow + Wolf - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ocean parfait . so yummy and totally unique.  If you love uni, get it.

o5_3yJv9V3ylQUzmiAPaxw.text: Unique food, drink and decor.  After hearing great things about Sparrow and Wolf over the past year we were finally able to make our way over and had a great experience. We arrived for an early dinner....surprised to see there was only 1 other table seated. Over the course of an hour the restaurant filled up...busy time as we were told is 7pm on. Authentic Menu with beautiful and one of a kind cocktails. Menu is intended for sharing so we did just that. Tried 4 options and shared. Not very large portions...but the presentation and flavor make up for that. We will absolutely return. Great spot for evening dinner and drinks. Beautiful art and decor everywhere. Service was exceptional.

2_oN1xTymg5fv8-lsY7NSA.text: This place knows how to cook a steak! Came here while on a birthday celebration for my friend and am so glad we stopped by!  Service: we made a reservation but didn't need it, and honestly walking in I was skeptical because of the decor and it wasn't very crowded for being 6pm on a Friday night (I was soon proved very wrong). We were greeted warmly, sat promptly, and our waiter was very attentive.   We were all QUITE hungover so I snagged a few things of water before they could get to us. The waitstaff were good sports about us needing our one watering hole.  Food: none of us were sure what to order until our waiter told us the specials...4 of the 5 of us immediately committed to the 32 oz Rib Eye! Our fifth friend got a fish entree, but I honestly wasn't paying much attention to hers. the Rib Eye was PHENOMENAL. My friend and I ordered it medium-rare and only left 2 slices on the plate. I love that it came with 3 sauces (red chili, red curry, and chimichurri), grilled naan, and small dishes of button mushrooms, cauliflower, fried rice, broccolini, eggplant, cucumber, and a house specialty taste of potatoes. Each accompaniment was seasoned, cooked, and served individually.   We all got a complimentary glass of wine (thank you, Yelp check-in deal!) but weren't up for much drinking...until later that night because Vegas lol. I saw that Veuve Clicquot Yellow Label was by the glass and asked about it; was assured by the waiter that it was okay several times but later told this wasn't the case. I wasn't surprised but was disappointed by his False confidence. This was only a small factor out of the whole experience.   Location: not on the strip but neither was where we stayed so this wasn't a problem. If you're staying on the strip and looking for a more low-key setting that totally delivers quality- this is it!

photos.caption: Photo of Sparrow + Wolf - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Sparrow + Wolf - Las Vegas, NV, United States

O6i2gVXtEwsXkrxx-3gAoA.text: This is by far my favorite restaurant. Better then Michelin 2 star restaurant. The flavors dance on your tongue like an elegantly orchestrated experience. Drinks compliment and the unbelievable knowledgeable and friendly staff will seal the night. If it exists get the lambs neck and "don't cry wolf."

pML4H3AbjrYVuo8CGT2sYQ.text: We went in on a Friday night with out a reservation and it was packed, we later found out it was for good reason!   We were sat at the bar and immediately greeted by a friendly bartender who was incredibly knowledgeable on both the cocktail and dining menus.   Everything looked delicious so we decided on the 'Bento Box', a little discouraged by it being $75, but when it arrived we were definitely not disappointed with both its quality and quantity for the two of us to share. A wide variety of oysters, charcuterie (multiple types of meat and cheese), some of the biggest and most delicious prawns I've ever had, the swordfish aquachile was insane! Also some great pate and grilled fresh bread.   They have a very unique cocktail list, with both sweet and savory cocktail options - the 'elephant in the room' with the pickled watermelon was very tasty, and the lychee spritz which was refreshing but not overly sweet. The 'pretty bird' featuring elderflower and the 'tea thyme' Jameson's based cocktail with Smokey earl gray was compliment-able both aromatic and flavorful.   It's a great restaurant off the strip for Las Vegas locals, and for people who want to go in and enjoy their dining experience, instead of being rushed in and out as many on strip restaurants do.

photos.caption: Photo of Sparrow + Wolf - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The fresh oysters from the bento box
Photo of Sparrow + Wolf - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The fresh fish portion of the bento box - huge prawns, swordfish aquachile, fish pie, uni, oysters with shiitake mushrooms and tuna tartare
Photo of Sparrow + Wolf - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Charcuterie section of the bento box - huge mix of cheese, meats, olives and pate

czylCfOIfari3jwUdkobqg.text: Great restaurant. Unbelievably tasty dishes. The best ever lamb I have ever had in ages. one morrow was also awesome! Love the atmosphere and well definitely e there again the next time i am in Vegas.

UYI-fgbn3aPqt8QO0_4yBg.text: Okayyyyy confession time. I was such a hater before I tried this place. I did not want to admit that! I thought this place was just trendy and rolling with the hype. It is, but for damn good reason. This place is amazing, from the service of every single staff (their smiles and genuine eye contact/care) to the actual food and ambiance itself. We started with the Charred Romanesco, Barbecued Salsify, and Steak Tartar. All so amazing. But the salsify especially. Then we moved onto the Scallops, Wood Fired Lasagna, and their special for the evening which was a Truffle Burger. Can't say enough good things about these dishes. We even ordered two more burgers and an additional lasagna.. definitely share dishes when you go! That way you can try more since it's all so good. Every piece of this experience was amazing. Especially the attentiveness from the staff. It's an intimate experience and you feel truly cared for while you're here! Thanks guys!

QY_84SSJCtQlkdIxjLO5KQ.text: Love this friendly place. Great food and atmosphere.. I travel to Vegas quite frequently and try to always come here.. Never got disappointed.

eVmysCJxzinsavuLhXpfQg.text: If you haven't been, you need to go!  This place is amazing...from the service to the food.  The restaurant itself has a nice intimate setting....perfect for date night.  I'm glad I decided to take the husband here for Valentines Day.  The romantic ambiance was perfect for the occasion.  I don't recall our server's name but she was freaken amazing.  She was so thorough and gave us the rundown on how they serve their food.  She explained how all the dishes are meant to be shared so that you have the opportunity to taste everything.  Honestly the husband and I were a bit worried since the portions are on the small side.  BUT definitely not lacking on flavor.  After going thru a few dishes, I actually appreciated the smaller portions, surprisingly.  Now for the food, like I mentioned above, our server was great. So great in fact, that while she was going into details about the dishes, my mouth started to water.  I couldn't wait to start eating.  We did try a few items which you can't go wrong with any of them.  Now, let me say that I am not an uni fan but after trying their OCEAN PARFAIT and CHINATOWN CLAMS CASINO, I am now.  At first I was a bit hesitant on the Ocean Parfait when she described it as "a burst of ocean flavor," but decided to get it anyway and I am so glad we did.  It was delicious and with the different textures of the uni, roe, and foam and the hint of wasabi, it all came together perfectly.  I didn't realize the clams had uni on it til it came and the husband made a comment about it.  But the combination of the uni and the bacon and bread crumbs were also perfect.  Bottom line, the uni was delicious on both dishes.    Since we were out for a special occasion, we decided to splurge a little bit and went with the DRY AGED PORTERHOUSE.  The porterhouse is served with a bunch of banchan sides.  Many of them, I didn't care for but the meat was tender and juicy.  If you're a big meat eater, you would probably love this one.  The porterhouse was huge.  We definitely got full afterwards.  Next time, we probably will not go with the porterhouse, cause like I said it was a lot of meat.  Even my meat eater husband said next time we won't get this.  But thats not to say it wasn't delicious, it was.    Now, since we decided to splurge and go for the porterhouse, we were so full that we couldn't enjoy their desserts.  One regret of mine, cause I love desserts.  Next time I will make sure to make room for desserts.  But yes, we will definitely be back.  If you haven't been, you need to go!  You won't be disappointed.  I'm looking forward to our next visit!

photos.caption: Photo of Sparrow + Wolf - Las Vegas, NV, United States. New friend? I already forgot lol
Photo of Sparrow + Wolf - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dry aged porterhouse
Photo of Sparrow + Wolf - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Wood fired lasagna

Ndh8Zb5UMNJ0xBYmV_wEYQ.text: Highly disappointed in this restaurant. My friend was coming from Chicago and made a reservation for 6 of us for Friday evening. They took her credit card and did a hold for $25 a person with a 48 hour cancellation policy. Her flight was delayed thus creating a shift in her plans for the weekend. She called 28 hours prior asking to cancel and they charged her $150 for the cancellation.  A Friday night in June. Not a holiday, not a party of 30, not even a strip property during convention season.   I have been in this town my entire life and have worked for large corporations with fine dining restaurants and have NEVER experienced ownership and management not being understanding of situations.   Shame on you and your greed. As a local Las Vegas restaurant, do better.

Wm2oKP-rwJNBrpVbokaqYQ.text: Found out about this place on yelp, we're locals and it was date night and we wanted to be totally random and try a new place. So we searched nearby restaurants while driving down spring mountain and up popped Sparrow+Wolf. We didn't have reservations but were able to sit at the bar and thank goodness we did because the service was AMAZING! Ashley and Cameron, our Bartenders, were awesome! Drinks were delicious! And you must try the Porterhouse!! It was $85 with 6 or 7 tiny sides and it was enough to share and get full. Mouthwatering to say the least  we will be back.

wG8ZJrBi609yPU804k-qdw.text: This review is not about the food, it's about the disappointing customer service I received when trying to cancel a reservation I made around a week in advance. Traveling to Las Vegas from Chicago, I made a reservation for 6 people at 8pm on Friday 6/21. I put a credit card down and agreed to their 48 hr cancellation clause, which is $25pp. They let me know that although I had a reservation for 6 people, I could adjust the # of guests prior to the reservation without penalty.  When my flight to Las Vegas from Chicago was cancelled and I had to get a flight a full day later, my plans in Las Vegas shifted, and I unfortunately had to cancel dinner. Still more than 24 hours in advance (but not within their 48 hour policy), I let them know, hoping that they could make an exception given my circumstances. Zero exceptions made. And even though they said the # of people could be adjusted, they still charged me the FULL $150 ($25pp for 6 people) for cancelling.  I understand that this is a highly sought after restaurant, but not even restaurants on the strip have this strict of a policy. Zero exceptions made for circumstances out of my control, due to weather and travel, for a restaurant of this caliber, is unheard of. Shame on you Sparrow and Wolf.

EO7iKWQ__LPUBBhmdAIW3Q.text: This was probably one of the best culinary experiences I've had. As someone said in the review, the staff is fun and passionate. They are also super knowledgeable and personable. John, one of the owners, does a great job running the front. He stopped in at our table a number of times, took the time to explain things to us and then entertained us with his wittiness.  What was interesting was our dynamic. We had some people who were not adventurous eaters and others, like myself, who were. In the end, everyone agreed this was one of the best meals they've ever had.  I'm not sure if I should start or end with the star of the night so I'll just go in order of what we got. The hamachi carpaccio, oysters, octopus and the broccoli were all excellent starts to our meal. I'd like to specifically mention the octopus as one of the best I have had - fresh (never frozen we learned, and grilled perfectly). What I thought was the star was the gnocchi dish - absolutely fantastic. If we didn't have anything else I would have been completely happy with this dish. We also ordered the shoulder which turned out to be of a fish and not of a pig! haha. Still, just another excellent dish we had. And finally, the grand finale and best dish of the night and, in my personal opinion, the best steak I've ever had was the porterhouse marinated in miso grilled to perfection and had a flavor I've never experienced before. By far, the best I've had and most memorable!  I've seen studies that when you are in a good mood and having a good time and the people around you are fun that everything tastes better than if everything was status quo. All of these things happened - the staff made it fun and memorable, our group had a lot of laughs, but I don't believe in this case any of that affected how good the food actually was. The food would have been this good even if I were in a bad mood and I'd still want to come back because it was THAT good! Yes, that steak will forever be etched into my memorable as I search for another to overtake the top spot! It just might not happen!

1vMobM6sGvTmKXZIb4bkKw.text: I am completely BLOWN AWAY by everything SPARROW + WOLF! Everything from the menus to atmosphere and everything in between was ON POINT! What I love the most about this place is the superb service you would find in a fine dining restaurant brought to you in a neighborhood type atmosphere. Jason and Destiny made it feel homey with a flare. I didn't think it was possible but they pulled it off gracefully. Jason walked us through the menu and did it with his own little quirks so his knowledge and appreciation of the menu and food really showed. The menu is setup to share and believe me when you taste the items and see the presentation of them, you'll want to try everything.  Drinks = Safeword : the OM chocolate sea salt caught my attention but the pineapple rum and hazelnut orgeat kept me sipping on my libation all night. James Brown old fashioned - the hardest working old fashion there is : I mean if the name of the drink doesn't entice you, neither will this drink. The drink is as bold in flavor as it's name.  Food = Steak tartare was finely chopped and when mixed with the confit egg and topped on the accompanied toast is a great appetizer dish.The Hamachi Carpaccio was topped with a citrus fruits and grapes is so devine, you'll wish you ordered one for yourself to enjoy alone. My favorite was the Chinatown Clams Casino and even though it was topped with Uni which I was unsure about, the other accompanying flavors of bacon, bread crumbs and the hollandaise sauce quickly let me forget the Uni dollop was there. The clam is diced up into pieces which makes it easier to eat and enjoy. For the main dish, we ordered the Duck Confit & Sweet Dumpling and the Wood Fired Lasagna. One bite of the succulent dumpling and you'll be hooked. I promise. The duck is shredded and placed in the dumpling and placed on a pond of sauce that has a little punch of spice. The wood fired lasagna was delivered with crunchy miso rubbed toasts. The baked burrata chese on top of the lasagna made this dish a delightful way to end the night.   Atmosphere = the dim lighting makes this place cozy and the playlist was an icing on the cake for a good time. There are creative art works to take in.   NOTE: START WITH DESSERT. We enjoyed so many savory dishes that I felt awful for not trying any of their desserts and I AM A SWEETS person.

nnKmGgq4UZGliiK9Defo4g.text: Service not good.  Atmosphere too loud.  Food was good but not worth the hype.  Owner/Manager has terrible follow through.  Too many much better restaurants here in Las Vegas to return.

DV6OCBr_OUuH_wiPL4PJCw.text: Can't say enough good things about this place. We came here for a quick bite before going to a show, and we ended up coming right back after the show for more!  Awesome craft cocktails, adventurous food, interesting personalities, reasonably priced to boot. Only regret is that we didn't make it back in time to eat more; the kitchen was closed. Thanks to Terry and the crew for letting us stay anyway and shut the bar down with you!  We will be back!!

cceTouyEHc8OFPXVuh7WRg.text: This was an amazing dining experience. If you're looking for a fancier date night experience without having to go on the strip, I would definitely recommend this place. Everything from the service to the plating was incredible. Reminded me of being back home in New York. Different kinds of dishes you wouldn't see in a usual restaurant.

AAS6EPIRVC57EMlTGCZiFg.text: Chef: 5 star for the food quality and execution            4 for the cocktails            5 for the wine selection  2 for the hostess( at least one of them)and some of the staff.  Details don't matter now, I will revisit and update.  That's all!

0An074I6Kve_VgyZiiu1ww.text: Omg this place is oh so good. Definitely worth the trek off the strip to get here. The staff is amazing. I always sit by the bar as I can chat with the bartender and he was just so much fun and knowledgeable. He did up being one of the ambassadors for angels envy and was just making us all some drinks. They are known for their drinks. The food is also so good we were so stuffed from eating the buffet earlier but we did have the lead host and those did not disappoint. I will definitely be back to have dinner and more drinks

v9iPtmIGX659sI6QItqy8Q.text: These guys have one of the best tasting menus in town! We were blown away by the combination of flavors and textures we were served. The steak tartare is hands down the best we've had. Fantastic service, great ambiance. Good selection of signature cocktails, highly recommend the Tea Thyme!

Um1qdGvHZBL_1iKDep7tKA.text: Exquisite. Did Chef Tasting menu--best meal in my life. We had skate wing, sea urchin, grilled fresh Spanish octopus, duck confit dumplings, scallop, hamachi, braised leg of lamb, fois gras and more-- and each presented impeccably with the most creative unique and delicious flavor combinations I've ever experienced. Started with an umami steak tartare oyster w caviar--Truly a "flavor safari" as John Anthony, our sommelier, who was phenomenal, introduced the meal to us. Funny, personable and extremely knowledgeable. And cute too!

xGjGYgAbFd8NhvcPUOvfJA.text: The good: If you are tired of the same old S+P has some unique culinary combinations. Decent Portions Hip atmosphere  The bad: Never seen Skate on a menu before, tried it with their aioli sauce... never again.  Deserts were subpar

VyEdYRgRRoMd-d9nWeRyYg.text: Recommended to us by a friend who says this is a place where local chefs like to eat. We were really looking forward to trying the beef cheek and marrow dumplings, but unfortunately were taken off the menu. Everything we ordered was delicious. I highly, highly, HIGHLY recommend getting the aged porterhouse with the assorted banchan. That steak is better than any steak I've had on the Strip. Overall an incredible meal at an incredible value.

2OB_P7B7otkFTlELarlNzg.text: Fabulous evening at Sparrow + Wolf! Three of us enjoyed libations and dined at the bar. The atmosphere is undeniably hip.   Andrew, our bartender, was as charming as he was deft at his craft.  For my cocktail, I ordered the The Golden Negroni, an off menu special, a clever blend of gin and a German Riesling. It was a refreshing concoction on a hot Vegas night; a perfect balance of crispness and sweetness in much the same way as bitting into a fresh picked apple. My husband's barrel-aged Old Fashioned was refined masculinity in a glass.  For our dining pleasure the three of us shared the Japanese sweet-potato as a prelude to our dinner. It was rich and salty from the crumbled bacon atop and the potato was creamy and decadent. Elevated comfort food at it's finest.   For our main courses my husband had the sweetbreads, our friend had the duck and I ordered the grouper. The grouper was a delicious meaty fish perfectly seasoned  and cooked beautifully. Our friend's duck was plated with skillful elegance and also cooked expertly to a perfect rare. My husband raved over his meal as well. All of our meals displyed the thoughtful restraint of the chef whom allowed the food to shine by not over-complicating the dishes.   We finished the evening by sharing the strawberry rhubarb shortcake and chocolate peanut butter torte special. Both desserts were sublime. The shortcake was sweet & tart and the house made whip was fantastically  creamy. The torte topped with a cherry compote was sinfully decadent.  I look forward to our next visit.

PolUU_vt_Q3tOXzFQ2FyBQ.text: First time to Sparrow and Wolf and it will not be my last. Wow what an incredible meal!! We went in for dinner this last weekend with a party of 8 women lol as soon we walked in Terry the bartender took excellent care of us. Specialty cocktails and the classics were great. He even made us wonderful shots through out the evening. My favorite was the spiced pear he served us with dessert that included the blueberry tart, pot de creme, strawberry rhubarb shortcake, and honey toast. All where delicious.  But back to dinner. We tried a bit of everything and shared it all pretty much. The bone marrow dumplings, steak tartare, and beet apple tartare are some of my favorites. The beet apple tartare went well in my opinion with some of the richer dishes. If you get the dumplings ask for some of their fresh baked bread. The sauce and juices from the dumplings is too good to waste. The short rib, lasagna, mitake mushrooms, scallops, and mussels are also delicious. The entire meal was the highlight of our trip.   Completely inconspicuous spot but will definitely be going back in September to try the duck, hamachi, and the sweet potato. Escape the Las Vegas strip for a night you won't regret it!!

5xepQw95Im0KlHT_2ykR0g.text: I have had Sparrow & Wolf bookmarked to try for quite some time. I called a couple of different times trying to get same day reservations, but with no luck. (I am terrible at planning out my food more than a day in advance. Who knows what they want to eat tomorrow? Not me!) Anyway this time I called and they said they could seat us at 5:15 or 9:30.... ugh, I was desperate to try them so I took the 5:15.  We arrived on time, and were seated immediately as more than half the restaurant was empty. They did just open at 5:00 though. I had done my research, read reviews on Yelp, and knew going in there were some must have dishes. I was a bit disappointed though that some of the items I wanted were not available, their menu is seasonal, which is understandable, but still disappointing. No Argentinian Red Shrimp, or Butcher Wings in the fall I guess.  We started with the Beef Cheek & Bone Marrow Dumplings and the Homemade Bread and Butter. Both were delicious and I highly recommend the combination as the bread is fabulous at soaking up all the delicious broth from the dumplings. Our entrees were the Campfire Duck and the Udon with Lamb Bolognese to which I added an egg. Both were delicious! I have absolutely no complaints over the quality of the food what so ever. I did feel like it took an extra long amount of time for the food to come out, both the appetizers and then the entrees. But it was definitely worth the wait.  I was a little irritated at the fact that even as we were leaving the restaurant almost half the tables were still empty. Either they had a whole lot of no shows that night or they could have gave us a better dinner reservation time. I do recommend this place as a great "date night" restaurant. Just make sure and call a couple of days ahead to make your reservation.

XFJV5AfEOksBB_JaxVPQMA.text: Love this spot, really nice atmosphere for tourists and locals a like. Small space with incredible quality wine and unique seafood bites. Terry is a rockstar behind the bar and will continually surprise you with his signature cocktails.

zupUg_9GrpMLUbBbai1Wyw.text: Amazing place . It really lived up to what everyone said about it. The service was outstanding the food was so delicious. Definitely will become one of my favorite places to go eat.

photos.caption: Photo of Sparrow + Wolf - Las Vegas, NV, United States. a pic of the bartenders hard at work!
Photo of Sparrow + Wolf - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Carpaccio and it&#39;s soooo goood!!!! Yummy!

eG1FIG9Dzws7p59wwetN8w.text: Not many late night spots open Sunday night, so I'm glad to have this spot as an option. Traditional Asian cuisine gets tiresome. And to top it off, they charge their menus regularly, so it keeps it exciting.   For this visit, we started off with their charcutterie plate. If you like spicy sausage, you'll love the thinly sliced hunters sausage. We also had their pate, which went well with the onion marmalade. And slices of their cows milk cheese; nothing really special, but good.  Now, their beef dumplings in celery foam is more what this restaurant is about. The flavors were unique, on top of the preparation. Everything was just so well balanced, and I believe the bone marrow was in Au jus. Amazing.   For the entree, I went wood fired lasagna with miso and burrata. It retrospect, I should've realized it was going to be kinda soupy. Still, the flavors were delicious. And the accompanying garlic bread was perfect in between bites. It was also nice the owner came over to see how we were enjoying our meal.  Unfortunately, the food was so good, I didn't save room for dessert. I totally could've gotten down for a sweet finisher.

photos.caption: Photo of Sparrow + Wolf - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Wood fired lasagna with miso and burrata
Photo of Sparrow + Wolf - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hunters sausage, pâte and cows milk cheese
Photo of Sparrow + Wolf - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef dumplings in celery foam

QBs_sN1b8lCVC2kz9v9K_w.text: Had dinner with some local friends and they took us to Sparrow + Wolf. It's a small hipster space in Chinatown. Service was friendly and fun. The bar program barrel ages cocktails and the Old Fashioned I ordered was really good. They're quite cheeky and serve a super refreshing gin-based cocktail called What The Duck in a bathtub shaped cup/glass. Very amusing and good. We ordered an assortment of shared dishes. The standouts were the seared scallops, steak tartare, uni melt (housemade focaccia and burrata used to make a grilled cheese sandwich topped with uni and a side of bacon jam), and the housemade charcuterie. I was not a fan of their beef cheek and bone marrow dumpling...it was boring and didn't have the flavors I was expecting.

VxlKkPRUcx0jFT395BUYFg.text: Went here with my good friend Jason, hes in the restaurant industry and knows a ton of places that are really awesome. Food was quality and everything on the menu is worth trying. Chef sent us some things that werent on the menu that should be on the menu. Sat at the bar area and the service was awesome, the servers knew the menu and wasnt reading off of cue cards. Had oyster shooters w/champagne, duck, a ton of appetisers, and the perfect steak for dessert w/chef recommended red wine.

r9TjkNxLXN3SSXyVmJQGPQ.text: I've always said, my 5th star is only for good Michelin Star restaurants.. the food may not look as refined and the portions may be a bit larger(thank you for that), but cooking and flavor is right up there with the Michelin joints. Sometimes a few words is all it takes to review a restaurant. Yummy, Flavorful, Cooked to perfection. Two People In our party of 9 wanted to go to an Asian Bbq next door but I'm glad they were overruled. Get away from the Strip and enjoy this wonderful neighborhood spot.

fYLGjwxG6PXH8QxNq1f6sw.text: This place never disappoints.  From the moment you arrive, parking is readily available, the hostess always greets with a warm welcome and smile, and the menu is updated seasonally.  The libations (cocktails) are always consistent and balanced, hand crafted by their talented mixologist. I'm not only referring to their cocktail recipes but classic cocktails, such as my favorite boulevardier with scotch instead of whiskey (you'd be surprised how many bartenders can't properly make this drink). I love that the manager or chef come around and talk to the guests.  They engage by asking if we, the guests, have questions about the menu.  They help with suggestions and pairings enhancing the dinning experience.   I've been here 3 times, every time I leave impressed and satisfied.  I would recommend this spot to locals and tourist, to anyone who enjoys dining, food, mixology, and wants to stay off the strip.

1nmOE3xliUhjgPNpcoq9qw.text: Loved the food.  I had the sambal Chile brioche crusted grouper. Was amazing . Drinks alittle on sweet side .  Hamachi carpaccio was delightful as well . I can't. Wait to go back and have another experience thru the food .

I3HtE3qFiKCqivMxaKzMJQ.text: a very disappointing meal, my overall impression is that the restaurant is trying to be innovative with its fusion but the basic flavours were not even done right. We ordered clam Casino, beef cheeked dumplings, Japanese sweet potato, foie gras and sweetbread. Most of them were way too salty. The sweet potato was just a huge baked sweet potato with sour cream on top. Sweetbread, I couldn't eat more than two bites. I do not understand the garnish for the dumpling, it's salty and tastes like bubble bath.

2oClwzclE314URrW1xXrEg.text: Everything is incredible, but adding real candles to the tables instead of the fake ones would be amazing!! It would make the restaurant more sophisticated and even more beautiful!

peYQTsUx50GrsX28PSkoHA.text: This place needs more than 5 stars.  We came for a customer dinner with some 25 people. The staff and owner were so attentive and enthusiastic about their food and drinks.   Such a great atmosphere...   The drinks were so fun I was shark bitten but loved it...  The food was out of this world and served with great efficiency.  This place is well worth the time and the money

i_ANBqyoWIZBKmFdDtlDcQ.text: Some really good food here. The house salad is exceptional. We had sweetbreads that were as good as we've ever tasted and pork shoulder that combined beautifully with its accompaniments. The coffee was not quite up with the rest of the meal. Service was fast and professional but still appropriately personal. My one negative was the music, which was often too loud and had too much base. On the pricey side, especially if you want to sample the excellent drink menu; but a good place for a special meal and particularly if going out for a date.

VDHAk7IknJf1cJ4fjuKJtA.text: Met up with some old school colleagues of mine last week for a party of 3 (all in the industry). We loved the atmosphere as soon as we walked in. Been in the know of Chef Brian Howard for the past 5 years here in Vegas and was highly anticipating this visit. We started with the hearth baked bread and absolutely loved it- I really love that they are doing their own bread for service! We also had the farm egg, bento (amazing spread- highly recommended), cheek & marrow dumplings, campfire duck, calamansi tart, honey toast, and beignets. The price point is great for what you get. The duck was by far my favorite dish- flavor was perfectly balanced, with the dumplings in close second. I will definitely back for future business dinners. Highly recommend you put Sparrow + Wolf on your radar if you haven't tried it yet!
