fXIsqjxLocFepVgc1tWu5Q.text: What a great restaurant! The food is unique and delicious! Asian fusion 100% done right! The staff is very friendly.   We ordered cod, which was one of the special for the night. SO DELICIOUS! It's spicier than I thought but definitely the good kind! Must order!   We also ordered the mushroom, beef cheek and bone marrow dumplings, and the duck. Must order the duck!!!   I loved Tea Thyme cocktail, but I had a friend who thought it tasted like medicine lol.   The parking lot seemed convenient to park, although we Lyft'ed to the restaurant. I highly recommended this place and will definitely come back again.

rnoQZYDKN5AardEYbwiqlQ.text: Surprised to find such a swanky place next to a Korean BBQ. Food was innovative and refreshing. Our favorites were the Romanesco...couldn't stop eating this, and the Duck Confit and Sweet Potato dumplings...sauce was to die for.   Yelp checkin offer was fantastic and the wine we picked was so good we almost had a whole bottle.   Service was a little bit off the night we went. Probably just getting into the grove since we were there really early.   We got reservations through Opentable. So easy! Overall great food and experience. Would certainly go back.

WMu_dgQh1XeYDCSk1PunEw.text: Another amazing off The Strip destination. Chef Brian and his team did an incredible job with the space and the unique dishes. Congratulations my man, keep more amazing concepts coming away from the casinos.

yZpEUyxN62Ku3-gGpkVLzw.text: Reservations are a MUST when going here! Small plates, dimly lit, intimate type of restaurant. We came as a group and tried their cheese and charcuterie board, hamachi carpaccio, beef cheek and bone marrow dumplings, hearth baked bread, uni melt, wood roasted bone marrow, sambal chile & brioche crusted grouper, and campfire duck. My favorites had to be the campfire duck, grouper, and the dumplings.   YOU CANNOT AND SHOULD NOT PASS UP THE CAMPFIRE DUCK.   Oh and use the bread to mop up the leftover dumpling sauce.   Aside from the food, I can't get over the service at this place. They are the friendliest bunch and catered to our different needs. Definitely try it when you're around the area, but just don't come when you are super hungry. Remember, small plates. So unless you won a lot from the slot machines, come when you have a reasonable appetite.

_nBIZFo93Iy1SliEY63x1g.text: This is the best food I had during stay in Las Vegas last week. We made reservation at 5:30 pm, but we almost doubt it still open after we Uber-ed there, no sign no light on their windows compared with the restaurant next to it. We arrived before peak time, the bar was empty, most tables were available, they were filled in 2 hours. Food are flavorful and decorated artistic.  Steak tartare which has raw yolk taste special than other restaurant, my foodie friend gave this comment.  Foie gros is off menu, it is toothsome, highly recommend this. Hamachi is well done but very tasty, I like their seasoning very well. Definitely will come back if I am here again.

GFHLPREYtx8y4zguz1MUpg.text: What?!?! Where did this place come from? New York... LA...? What's it doing in Vegas, Korea town?  I don't like "weird" food, but I LOVED S+W!  I was pretty convinced that I would probably leave hungry, but instead I left feeling full and happy!   The drinks are exotic and cool.  The food is funky and fresh.  The staff is hip and trendy.  The decor is out-of-this-world!   You mash that all up into one restaurant and you have a winner!

QXsJI1uP8pcSEKDI9UzASw.text: Great experience and menu! Loved many dishes, the lasagna, bread and cheese/charcuterie plate were amazing. Lots of flavor in every dish.   The bone marrow was also good, though not my favorite.   The waiter brought us a desert tasting plate we didn't remember ordering, but the table didn't object too much.   Pricing was fair for most things, though someone thought the scallops were priced very high. I didn't have them, so can't say.   Will come back to try other things.

Photo of Sparrow + Wolf - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bone marrow dish - spicy and flavorful

RntBOCBgnR95xZ84mUcstA.text: Absolutely rudest host I have ever met.  Walked in for a reservation at 8 and nobody was there.  Exposed kitchen almost had me walk back there after 5+ minutes of nobody.  Restaurant is not that busy on a Thursday.  Host is finally seen talking to some patrons leaving.  He stops them for a conversation right next to us about, "I've known the chef for a decade. He does things the French way -- everyone is yes chef no chef no matter who they are.  He knows Thomas Keller."  All trite, porous, grandstanding after having waited for him to show up.   We are shown to a table and ok! Do not care about all that let's just have the food.  Waitress has us wait another 8-10 mins as we have water filled.  She says I'll be right back and after 5 more minutes I'm ready to leave. I really wanted to go here.  I love fine American when it is well executed and the menu was something that intrigued me.  But the hipster couple struggling with some blown up chicharron and the lack of any service had me defeated. As I'm leaving I decide to tell the host who looked like an overweight Brian from Office Space with all the flair, that we're leaving we have waited too long.  He spins around and I tell him we waited 10 mins in the lobby and 15 mins at the table and didn't get served.  He replies "it was not more than 5 minutes at front".  Uhh ok maybe closer to 5 minutes of nobody greeting us on a slow Thursday: great point.  Then proceeds to say, "you were angry when you came in here, you were never going to be happy." Then pirouettes around and walks away from me. Wow.  I work customer service and I would be seriously reprimanded for saying this to someone.  Maybe they are dancing upon the hubris of their success over there, but bad service while bite you back in the end.  I really hope this guy gets a talking to because you are never supposed to be rude like that to the customer.  And I was not even being rude!  Just saying we were leaving because we waited too long.  We went to another restaurant nearby and had great food with good service.  Don't be abused by the staff because they think they are chic.

ix4pwX8QU-YmEhskXTQpOQ.text: Such a disappointment. Our group was excited to try this place & left wondering why anyone would come back. We should have known from what the place smelled like inside to just leave....Our fish was not cooked, completely raw inside. The veggies were drowned in butter & random spices & the breads were super chewy. Each dish was one mistake after another. Paid over $200 to not eat but a couple bites.

oprR-_nbG0MkjmjLSWaz2g.text: Had dinner there tonight it was amazing. Food was super tasty. Thank you Chef Brian Howard for giving this city one of its best neighborhood eats. Love you and the whole Sparrow and Wolf family

DB22Lrgh1Wtyb1kfXACUxg.text: Had dinner here last night and i was very disappointed in the service. I really thought this place was gonna be the new spot. I experienced the same kind of service the last time i had dinner here as well. The vibe I was getting from the servers and the helpers was like we were an inconvenience to them. They barely smiled, i caught a few eyerolls, the server didn't come back to take our check, we had to bring it up ourselves. The food was good but i can get better service elsewhere and get the same quality food. Safe to say that's the last time we will be coming. Las Vegas has too many amazing restaurants to go to one where they don't treat their guests well.

_AmQ1v9n199XI7oJonmTVw.text: Alright so it's been a while since I've given out a 5 Stars and want to write a review right after I finished the meal. I'm more than happy to do so. I was intrigue by their menu at first due to the foie gras duck (campfire duck) and clam w/uni (instead of the boring oysters and uni, which is always a win win). First off, we got the bar seat and John Anthony (Manager) give us the special: Hamachi Kama & Bone marrow w/escargot. Alright I have both of those in different variations, but let me TELL you! Their take on it is amazing. Hamachi is medium rare w/the balance of the pear and watermelon daikon salad is amazing. That's just their special m. We orders the clams w/uni, big ass pork loins and the camp fire duck  (I tried to convince John to call it Duck Duck Goose lol). It's like a porno experiment in my mouth . Everything was on point m-if I have to pick the least favorite dish (and that's a big IF, it's a bone marrow- can you believe it? The bone marrow w/escargot!! But yes, it was that good. Not to mention all their drinks was so innovative and amazing. Based on the quality of the food, innovative of the menu and not to mention t he reasonably priced menu-this place truly deserve a 5 stars-I wish them luck in their venture.

QwRQfYm_t7PylJVaHLTqwA.text: Absolutely delicious!  Excellent food and wonderful cocktails.  Low key in decor but well appointed.

nKvW6rbXT6wdGr8g13l1Zw.text: I've been in a few times and I have to say I've not been disappointed and have had amazing times !! Thanks to the team of Sparrow for bringing in some fun dishes to a sexy spot in china town.

DC0Plvp01-uDyIkT60j7Xw.text: Meh. S + W is fine, but nothing to write home about. Decent but overpriced American small plates. Expect to spend ~$85 per person for a meal with one drink. Black cod (typically one of my favs) was way over sauced and spiced. Beet salad was a bright spot, as was the Lead a Norse to Water drink although it's a little on the sweet side. Given the number of spectacular restaurants on Spring Mountain, I won't be back here.

s_qZfNqETJqhcqrdj1JsaA.text: Great food and attentive service. Loved the beet salad!! Great atmosphere - start with one of the fab cocktails

rAiTlkpbXU4Bi3g_eb7a4g.text: I went for Happy Hour.  Though the options were limited on the Happy Hour menu,  I did try the Argentinian shrimp ($5 off) but went with beef tartare from the main menu as well.  I also ordered a few half price draft beers (originally $8; though only 4 options so very limited selection).  Wine and cocktails were unfortunately not affected by Happy Hour either.  And Happy Hour is strictly limited to the bar only as well (5:00-6:30).  I ordered their house old fashioned which was fantastic and strong.  I also got the Spring Mountain sour which was a little too experimental and tasted too much like beets for my liking but interesting nonetheless.  As only an drink and bounce, that's fine, but combined with food, it was a bit overpowering.  The shrimp were huge and tasty but not much going on in terms of outstanding taste.  However the tartare was fantastic; some of the best I've had.  And the bread had some Indian spices on it which were truly complimentary to the tartare.  Overall the meal was very nice and Sparrow and Wolf would be perfect for a dinner out off the strip.  It's very nice to see successful chefs in the area venturing off and creating their own small menu to call their own.  A big peeve I found was that the online menu clearly had not been updated, so one of the cocktails I wanted and the lamb tartare were no longer available.  Honestly, for the quality, the price of $60 for my meal was pretty good.  Either way, Sparrow and Wolf is very good; hopefully they open for lunch or brunch in the future.

OsvjjcBZbLkYPnjF1nYBcQ.text: Chef Howard is a master at creativity in taste. The sweetbreads are a singnature dish for the culinary adventurous. The Wings are the cooked to highlight layers of flavor and succulence. And the dumplings are downright decadent. This place is for those who are hungry as wolf but want to fly upwards into the stratosphere of taste

H3SSCM0rpIZ3a8HUuL5GnQ.text: Hands down one of the most exciting places to eat in Las Vegas . Located in a super cool building in Chinatown this place is over the top in every way yet approachable , casual and affordable. Foodies rejoice! The food here is amazing in every detail. Chinatown has truly become one of the best destinations in Las Vegas for people who really know and appreciate great food and bars. After eating head to the Sand Dollar for live music or take in the tropical atmosphere and cocktails of the legendary Golden Tiki. This place is highly recommended! Run don't walk there tonight

H3P9YrFZzAe760MxRTmhAg.text: Really great food and okay prices - one large issue is that the menu needs to be larger. There is not a ton of choice, especially if you don't eat pork or beef. However everything we have tried here is good, especially the cocktails. They are holding quite a lot of special events and they are always worth checking out. It's got plenty of free parking right outside the restaurant and its nice and cosy inside. Service is always great!

Fw38VCv8SUAR2cknHOp3Nw.text: This was a really neat trendy place that I enjoyed for my Anniversary with my Husband.  The food was good and the dishes were different.   He had grilled octopus and I had the Udon noodles which was dressed as an Italian dish.  The bread with salted butter was wonderful.  Instead of a Anniversary dessert, we were given the Farm Egg appetizer which I enjoy, the husband not so much.    The drink that comes in a Shark glass seemed tacky for such a nice restaurant.

18B_lYJkPP8soyC6bAI81A.text: Delicious food and great ambiance!  Chef Brian serves up beautiful, flavorful, super tasty dishes in a cozy, modern atmosphere.   Open kitchen, wood fired oven, amazing bartender serving up great cocktails as well as a great selection of wine and beer.

ia7in7F_yY2uU6jZ2QUrlA.text: My new go to farm to table restaurant!  Ingredients were fresh. Everything was superb from their handcrafted cocktail libations to their appetizers and entrees.  I am still giving them 5 stars even if I was not that impressed with the black sesame crepe dessert (this was supposed to be one of their signature desserts).  It didn't have flavor and the crepe was very dense.

IRwpAzbhvr-2SEsbC85qlw.text: What a fantastic dining experience!  We came as a group of 8 and was seated at one of their best table.  I couldn't stop admiring the beautiful long wooden dining table that I kept wishing could be mine.  The service was phenomenal and attentive.  Everything on the menu was explained to us and you could tell how the whole staff was so passionate about it.  We started with the Bento box that included a selection of Argentinian shrimps, clams, oysters, crab meat, lamb tar tar, and a variety of charcuterie meats.  I enjoyed the freshness of the seafood and the creative sauces on the oysters.  We also shared the homemade bread, fried artichoke, beef cheek and bone marrow dumplings (my favorite), farmed eggs (2nd favorite, so simple yet elegantly put together), beef skewers, and the campfire duck with foie gras).  I was so satisfied with my meal.  I will definitely be back to try the rest of the menu, but got to make it soon as I was told the menu will always be updating with new creations.  What a surprising gem in the heart of Chinatown!

KETyhL5lxgbrtoUIpAu9tQ.text: Wonderful menu!  The staff was very attentive.  I would give 5 stars but not a huge fan of the cocktail I ordered.  Otherwise, everything was great!

ruKl-MIO3SWxUaJEDGE2rw.text: It was my first time, but definitely won't be my last.  Sparrow and Wolf is an amazing addition to our neighborhood!  The restaurant is beautiful with a great vibe, open kitchen, amazing menu, creative craft cocktails and a great wine selection.  I met Chef Brian, his wife Wendy and John whose also part owner! They've created something truly special and i can't wait to go back tomorrow night to have dinner!

EL5A-7ZKKNtAZ7_Xj6OBBQ.text: Poor management. I had made reservations on 07/05/18 for my birthday dinner on 7/14/18. At last minute, I received a phone call stating that the menu changed for the night of the reservation. At last minute, I had to cancel due to this. I found out days later that I was charged $300 for a cancelation fee. I attempted to call the management to possibly resolve the issue. I spoke with the GM John Anthony. He said that he would speak to the chef and the owner to see what can be done due to the circumstances. John said that he would call back the next day. Never received another phone call from management. Multiple attempts made to contact John Anthony to try and resolve the issue. Multiple voicemails and texts sent without response. Very unfortunate situation that management could not be professional about the situation. I unfortunately will not be returning back to the restaurant because of this. Very sad.

2W9_FqNi8K4Iz6DfEpAh1w.text: Food,  cocktails (to you hipsters cocktails=libations), ambiance! Done and done.  This place hits them all with a side of "China town is the new Downtown."  The food is for REAL, The drinks are on fleek,  and the who's who of food and bev are coming here right now,  so get a taste before it's too popular to get in.    Small place so seating is limited. The food is crazy eclectic,  just order something and taste with wild abandon.  Don't over analyze the ingredients in each dish,  just get it and enjoy.  I hear it's the chef from Comme Ca, and I wouldn't be surprised because the fusion is cra.    Honestly,  the desert menu could use a tinse bit of work,  and there seemed to be no tawny port wines to accompany my tres leches,  but they made up for it in Amaro and Frenet.   Just go.  It's fab.

idDNsQfNuNOiVXygFH1Zxg.text: I have eaten here three times and every time I had the best culinary experience. Chef Brian is my absolute favorite chef. The East Asian influence on his classically trained French cooking blows my mind and makes me want to cry in a good way. I don't understand how I'm eating foie gras and caviar, but I am being reminded of my childhood. When I eat his food it feels like falling in love. I would give five stars (more if possible) but every single time I eat here my server has been RUDE AS HELL. Maybe because I am a young woman dining alone I give the impression of not belonging in this restaurant, but I have a passion for great food AND great service. I always tip 25% minimum (even when my server is bitchy), usually much more. I would come by more often if I didn't feel bullied by my waitress.

qz2pFDThWij8BJD9m67bQQ.text: The absolute best meal I've had in write some time.   If I could give this place 10 stars I would.   The food was amazing and the service was absolutely stellar.   Upon walking in we were greeted by the hostess who was kind enough to let us choose where we sat.   This was the first in a long line of great things this restaurant provides.     Our server was attentive without being pushy and very knowledgeable.   We ordered plates to share and he coursed them out for us perfectly.  Not only that but the timing was on point as well.   He and the other service staff (and even the owner) made sure our plates cleared quickly and that we had fresh plates and silverware for each course.  The owner also made sure we had everything we needed and that we were enjoying our meal.   This was very much appreciated and such a nice touch.   Now to the food... everything we ordered was amazing!   The absolute highlight was the coal roasted beets.   You must get this!     Overall, this is a fantastic restaurant to bring a date, bring your friends, bring your family.   It's just that good.

ZPQsmRuzoRctqqYI-YtmWQ.text: We didn't expect much before coming here. I was wrong, the food was good different and tasty. The foie gras wasn't the best that I have had but well prepared and seasoned. The duck breast is also a must try, wood grilled added smoky smell on the outer fat layer which made the dish very special. Our server spent a significant time to explain detail about menu and their specials. Now is why I knocked off 1 star, we were sat at a table next to the bar end. It wasn't a busy night, they had only 5 tables at around 7pm, the bar had many seats left in the middle. But somehow, they seated another couple right next to, turned their back to us. So the girl's b*tt only couple feet from my wife face since the bar stool was must higher than our table. My wife felt very uncomfortable for the entire meal since the girl kept fixing her dress. For $150 dinner, don't do that to any of your customers, take those 2 bar tools off.

Photo of Sparrow + Wolf - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Duck breast

0caDHpY3XT3OszL2tw7LCw.text: I have been to this restaurant twice, once for happy hour and once for dinner. The service and food is top notch. Always looking forward to my next visit.

x8BCXft38MxjZLnY4AWMiw.text: Food was excellent. Service was sketchy in beginning (I think we were forgotten) but super after we brought it to staff's attention.

mHqS_CL7_5WoJaSIf5ZbeA.text: Four of us gathered to share plates at Sparrow + Wolf--a newer restaurant in Chinatown that once was a pho place.  Items served were:  Charcuterie platter with lardo and culatello ham Lamb tartare with bhatura bread Hearth baked bread Artichoke with white bean hummus, charred tomatillo, mortared herbs, pine nuts & arugula Butcher wings Beef skewer Black truffle meatballs with bonito flakes Chinatown clams on the half shell Duck breast with foie gras Lamb ragu with udon noodles Beef cheek and bone marrow dumplings Sweetbreads with grilled romaine hearts, smoked bacon, English peas & fond blanc Tres Leches--vanilla bean, orange and cocoa nib crunch Calamansi tart with vanilla meringue and blueberries Black sesame crepe with cherry yuzu, marmalade, and whipped cream  With the selection we opted for, there was something for everyone.  The charcuterie platter was nicely done with the N'duja being tops in flavor.  The lamb tartare was very good with the apple and walnuts, as were the black truffle meatballs topped with bonito flakes.  Another favorite of mine was the duck breast with foie gras.  The beef cheek and bone marrow dumplings need work.  The dumpling was very chewy.   Of the desserts we tried, the Calamansi tart and the tres leches were my picks.  The tart was excellent and the tart was a good sized dish meant for sharing.  Service was very good and the music was at a level that allowed conversation while still being able to hear the music.  Later as more people arrived, the sound in the restaurant picked up but it was never loud.  It's a little pricey for the size of the servings but the quality of the food, the preparation, and the presentation make it worth it.

vYpmZP42IuhB42oicMV92w.text: We were in Vegas only for a couple of days to decompress after a hectic holiday vacation/wedding. A family friend recommended Sparrow + Wolf, we had no idea what to expect. We were blown away! Food and drinks were unbelievable but it was the amazing service that took it to another level. John Anthony and bis staff were so attentive and kept the food and drinks coming. I look foward to my next food experience when we come in to town again and would recommend it to anyone who wants more than just to have dinner but have a culinary experience!!

00eT2q8RzSedk6WOMV5xag.text: Excellent food.   'Artsy food' type of sizes but still filling.  The service was outstanding.   Very knowledgeable staff.  I had the duck confit sweet potato dumplings.  Wildly delicious.   And it was affordable.   For a bread plate, three sparkling waters and two entrees it was only $70.  Excellent

Q57cGtbCuTIxR8CyBmNX6Q.text: Such a great dinner experience the three times  that I've gone. The service is a little off, but I think that with time hopefully the bumps smooth out.  You could definitely order just order apps, share those, and get comfortably full without having ordered a main dish (although we did). The octopus & yellowtail tartare were the stars of the show and I ordered them the second time I came. The scallops with pancetta bits were amazing, and I'm glad we got them despite being on the full side.   The duck does come prepared medium rare, so I would let your server know if you're not comfortable with it being that pink. The grilled lobster dumplings were out of this world!! Their menu does change quite often so don't fall too in love with a dish as it probably won't be there when you return lol.   The dessert wasn't anything mind blowing and the second time around I skipped it but the plates that it comes out on ARE SO CUTE.   Overall I'm really happy each time I come and definitely add this to my go-to indulgent spots!

7UnWFNcWzRCk0wiKDIzlPA.text: Bar Review:  I am obsessed! Wow was I blown away by the craftsmanship or the bartenders. Not only that, but the energy of the staff and management was so positive and exciting.   I would prefer the call these bartenders mixologists due to their extensive knowledge in beverage including spirits, extracts, aromatics...   Luckily we came in toward the end of the night we so got a lot of one on one time with the most awesome bartender Terry Clark, and another amazing female bartender with Tattoo sleeves (sorry I didn't get your name!).   They were both whipping up random concoctions to test and they will custom design a drink to your preferences.  This is the type of bar I would want to be on a first name basis with all the mixologists. It's a very inviting space and the smell of bacon is intoxicating!   I will definitely be back to try the food and hang out at the bar!  Cocktails are roughly $14.

photos.caption: Photo of Sparrow + Wolf - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Butterfly Pea Flower Tea which was used to make the most beautiful purple cocktail. It does not taste like lavender FYI.
Photo of Sparrow + Wolf - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Sparrow + Wolf - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Grey Matter... not on menu

BIBc7-oiFoTV9J2ioADuig.text: Location: five stars. Right in the Macy's home store plaza, this is a great location from any directions in Vegas. You just can't miss it.   Decor: five stars. Smart modern chic that gives the vibe of casual and fun yet effortless sophistication. Aka you can bring your hot date to this restaurant or just stop by in your casual attire and not feel out of place because this place is just so cool.   Service: five stars. We sat at the bar and the staff was very attentive; both the bar staff and the general crew. When they brought us our food, they explained the dishes in details. I really liked that because it built up the anticipations!   Food: five stars. Half a dozen fresh oysters with three different toppings: lemon jelly, pineapple flavored something and a mint something. They were all good but my personal favorite was the mint.  Artichoke salad: so delicious with the hearts of artichoke as the bed with flowers and deep fried leaves and fresh vegetables on top.  Pork shoulder - stuffed in some sort of casing and garnished with the yellow dikon pickle and black garlic paste. It was a good dish but I thought the shoulder meat could be more tender and flavorful.  Last but most definitely not least and my absolute personal favorite: the duck. Slices of perfectly seared, medium rare duck topped with a generous piece of foie gras. The perfect combination of the duck and the foie gras in each bite was orgasmic.  I purposefully chose a glass of the Troublemaker from Paso Robles just for this dish and it was heaven.   I am so in love with every aspect of S&W. The people that work there are super friendly and good at their jobs. We even met the manager, John, and he was so much fun and kind. He made us felt so welcome and like we were frequent patrons, which we will now become.   I cannot wait to return and try other dishes because I know I will not be disappointed.

photos.caption: Photo of Sparrow + Wolf - Las Vegas, NV, United States. German slurpee
Photo of Sparrow + Wolf - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef skewers - delicious!!
Photo of Sparrow + Wolf - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lamb tartar

MD-mnBwIiIBqrVYAUhv7Xg.text: Ooooh!  That "+" sign is just so HOT right now!!  And to think this was a shitty pho joint just a few months ago to a now beautiful, modern dining room executing some very creative food and drink (my first libation arrived in a large cup shaped like a shark) off the strip is awesome.  I was a big fan of Chef Brian Howard's Comme Ca (RIP...sniff, sniff) at Cosmopolitan, so my expectations were pretty high and everything we tried totally delivered.    The "Campfire Duck" had me written all over it.  The duck breast, cooked a lovely medium rare with a delectable piece of foie gras on top, wood eared mushroom, salted cucumber, plum and rich duck bone broth was so ridiculously good that I plan on writing a letter to Santa for a box of this.  Do not share.  Think selfishly.  Be an asshole if you have to.    I could handle being a vegetarian if I had their "Artichoke" every single day.  Featuring white bean hummus, charred tomatillo, mortared herbs, pine nuts and arugula, it was presented wonderfully and every bite was a great mix of char, light citrus, and earth.  Another big hit at the table was the "Udon" with its lamb bolognese topped with a sous vide egg.  If there was any downside at all, it was portion size.  Our party of 4 was still a bit hungry after 6 dishes and 2 desserts, which may just be our fault.  But if the duck is $21, why not just make it $30 for a larger sized plate?  I am positive that I'd shell out even more for a full breast (sounds dirty?) and feel confident I wouldn't be the only one.  If these plates were truly meant to be shared, 3 slices of meat to a serving just leads to a stare down for the last piece.  Who wants to get stabbed with a dinner knife on a hot date?  Not I!  So my advice would be to over order by a couple of dishes or perhaps start with some wine and their charcuterie board.   That's all minor stuff in the grand scheme.  This place is outstanding and I look forward to repeat visits!

HyMEi5EYg8vDhOroh1D57g.text: This was my second visit to Sparrow and Wolf. First visit I had the chef's tasting menu and couldn't have been happier. Everything was cooked perfectly, beautiful presentation. This second visit was a small late night meal post show at the Smith Center. Perhaps it was the late hour, but two (asparagus and hot potato pave) out of four dishes were served lukewarm. The potato pave was especially disappointing as it was over cooked and dried out. I suspect it had been made earlier in the day and then warmed up. I did mention it being disappointing to the server, but she didn't offer to do anything about it. Given how expensive the food is, we probably won't be going back. There are a lot of other restaurants in this town which are more consistent in quality at this high price point.

sF2i_dE59EKj9v4s3G-HwA.text: I am a lamb lover and wow ... the lamb neck and lamb lasagna were amazingly the best I've ever had. Purely decadent. Will definitely be back!

wSRfOewdjrJvD-_lp3cqzQ.text: Was super excited to come in to try this place. Our expectations were pretty high having dined and loving Comme Ca. Interior and atmosphere was very nice smelled of wood fire which was lovely. Only complaint would be that the tables were super close together which made a bit of a tight squeeze getting in and out. Another down side was the arguing couple right next to us who was almost elbow to elbow. It felt like the crazy lady was kinda yelling at me bc of how close they were. It was even harder to look away bc I could see her frowny face from the corner of my eye without even trying   * Get Off The Lawn was very strong. Served with an orange peel and a very very small beef jerky that is supposed to be eaten while you drink ..gonna need a much bigger piece of jerky to go with that drink tho lol  * Model T - was good. Cucumber was very refreshing   * Beef Cheek & Marrow Dumplings - We ordered this to start when we ordered our drinks but it never came out bummer bc I really wanted to try this. (We probably sat at our table foodless for at least 30 mins)   * Duck & Foie Gras - Amazeballs!! This was the first food item to come out to our table. Comes with 3 slices of duck breast over wood ear mushrooms topped with a good piece of foie gras in a savory sauce.  * Butcher Wings - sold by per wing. Really liked the wood fired char taste to it. Very moist as a wing should be.   * Argentinean Red Shrimp - Served with 3 shrimps with heads on a plate. Really enjoyed the sauce it came in   * Beef Carpaccio - Good   * Sweetbreads - Good. Haven't had good sweetbreads since Rosemarys was still open. Loved everything about this dish from the sweetbreads to grilled baby romaine wrapped with bacon to the sweet english peas and pea shoots   Tres Leches - kinda torn on this one. Served with the cake on the bottom and a chocolate Hennessy moose on top with chocolate tuilles. I'm a Hennessy shot drinker myself but the amount of cognac in the moose made the flavor too strong to enjoy. If you love the strong taste of cognac then you will like this cake more than I did.  Overall the food is good. The portions are on the smaller size but you are paying the higher price for the better quality. After being open for 1 month the service could be better. Our server was nice but she did not check back on us often. After she took our drink order and failed to put in our dumpling order she never came back to take our food order. We had to wave her down after we finished our drinks to take our food order then had to ask another server for a dessert menu. We will be back to try the other yummy items on the menu. Still want to try the dumplings we missed. Heard the happy hour is coming soon definitely can't wait for that one

M66uZGqSWWzj8Ao7CELwyw.text: After hearing raves from everyone about Sparrow + Wolf, finally went for dinner with friends. No joke...dinner tonight was the best, favor-filled occasion in recent memory. Everything from the tomato salad to the porter house special to peanut butter + chocolate + cherry dessert was amazing!  Forget a "taste bud party", this was an all out gala!!!!  Staff is knowledgeable, attentive (without being overbearing), and very engaging.    HIGHLY RECOMMEND!!

XY1_ban3sa5ooWE5q-ldeg.text: It was our first night in town.  The wife and I had made it point to dine off-Strip as much as possible to experience some of the great spots that only the locals know about.  As a result, we made our way off-Strip for dinner on a Thursday night at SPARROW + WOLF.  The chef, Brian Howard, was the chef at Comme Ca, a place that we had really enjoyed when it was open at the Cosmo.  We arrived around 6PM.  We were greeted with a smile by the hostess as we walked in the door.  The dining room was fairly empty, but we requested to sit at the bar.       Sparrow + Wolf's cuisine was eclectic American but with seeming Japanese influences.  While we looked over the menu, I started off with a We Can Prevent Forest Fires ($14) made with Dalmore 12-year old Scotch, Cynar, Vida Del Maguel Mezcal, lemon, pine simple syrup, and garnished with a flamed rosemary sprig.  It was a delicious mix of boozy, bitter, goodness with a pronounced, but balanced smokey note.  Although the standard menu looked great, we decided on the Chef's Tasting Menu ($125/person) with beverage pairings ($45/person).  Since there wasn't a printed tasting menu, it's likely safe to say that it changes frequently, if not daily.  Most, if not all, of dishes that we received didn't appear to come off of the regular menu.  Every dish that we received seemed to be made fresh to order, incorporating high quality ingredients, and beautifully presented.  We found every course enormously satisfying.  The beverage pairings were spot on with the food and generous.  Service throughout was friendly and attentive, making us tourists feel like local regulars.  Sparrow + Wolf was an excellent start to our week of dining in Las Vegas.  Locals have probably already gotten the word on this place, but I'd highly recommend it for those adventurous (i.e. willing to leave the Strip) out-of-towners looking for an amazing food easily accessible from/to the Strip by Uber or Lyft.

22Z86ikZ123Pwbu1ywxv0Q.text: An incredibly crafted American cuisine off the strip in Chinatown  I've been to this location several times in its former business and never has it been this beautiful, this delicious, or even occupied with this many people at one time.  The head chef Brian Howard, who I've read about in LV Weekly and Seven magazine, really has something special here - it's more than just a meal.  My experience began with a drink:  - "Get off my Lawn" ($14) - a Camus v Cognac served with a technique to initiate its full enjoyment. A flipped sniffer glass arrives sitting atop singed cedar wood to encapsulate a smoky aroma. Once turned right-side up, a house cooked bacon slice is place inside at the base, and before pouring your classy booze, a thinly sliced orange peel wraps around the inside and rim to secure that hint of citrus flavor. Sounds like work, but damn, smells so good and goes down so smooth.  "I'll have another please!"  Ordering food is suggested to be done so from the left to right (cold to hot) of the menu, so the first round was this:  - Lamb tartare ($13) - gorgeous, light, fresh, and served with bhatura bread - Farm Egg ($11.50) - this one actually surprised me. Asparagus (two-ways) never tasted so good to me. Really cleaned up this one.  Before the hot round, the Urban Seen Chopped Salad ($12) was ordered to freshen the palate and prep for the next course.  Simple yet several ingredients assembled for this bowl of lightly dressed leaves. I could never put together a salad like this. That's because Sparrow + Wolf works directly with a local source specifically to produce all their greens, and I'm glad they do, it was great.  And now to the main attraction:  Beef Skewers ($18) - deliciously cooked beef bites with chickpeas, served with a side of crepes.  Damn that's clever. Campfire Duck ($21) - Three well-marinated duck strips along with a thick piece of foie gras made this dish my favorite of the night. Made me wanting more.  Since the closing of the former establishment, this neighborhood spot has kept me curious until it's grand opening yesterday.  Today, my visit and experience has satisfied the anticipation and only leaves me curious for more.  How are the other dishes and cocktails?  What will be on the next menu?  Will there be a happy hour??  I look forward to it all

WimvGFUb3K2wNUwRahSKcA.text: Had the dry aged porterhouse.  Too bad this is not on the regular menu, it was awesome.  As shown it came with a variety of Korean vegetables.

g_gj7cRcsHCG6heHxMPwVQ.text: Never did I thought I'd find a place like this in the infamous China Town. If you want to escape from many of the traditional Asian cuisine and step into a world of unique flavors and superb dining experience, Sparrow & Wolf may be the ticket you are looking for. My date and I tried a variation of different small shareable plates. These plates were very much portioned for two people, but the flavors from each dish made up for the small portions. So please take into account, if you plan to bring a family here just note majority or all of the items on the menu is not made for family style.  Besides the amazing food, the ambience and low lit setting is a nice touch for a romantic and nice chill relaxed vibe. They do have a nice size bar for plenty of seating but the beer list isn't all the great...their cocktail menu is the star of the show and I highly recommend you pick from there for a drink of choice. You will not be disappointed. I had two different cocktails, one of them that was prepared in a white mug that I think was an elephant? Doesn't matter, that drink was damn good! I did order dessert and I got their ice cream sandwich which boasted with unheard of flavors for an ice cream sandwich. It had a crunch and it had like the sorta gingery finish. Again, I wolfed mine down as soon as it hit the table, and my date couldn't finish hers so I ate hers too! Winning!!! Overall, I can't wait to come back. I hope to drop in just to vibe and have a beer after work since I work across the street. Good job guys! I hope to see you guys stay and succeed for many many years to come

PXHq8EvmoUshTkOZXJPmKg.text: This restaurant is located at the same plaza with Macy's so there's no problem finding parking space, which is a plus.  We had a reservation made but it didn't seem like necessary for the Friday night, maybe this restaurant would be busier later the night.  We check the menu online before this Vegas trip, however, the menu they are serving now is a bit different - no more bone marrow dumplings or campfire duck. So we ordered one of the Chef Special with Fig & Foie Gras $24.00, Spanish Octopus $21.00, and Braised Lamb Neck $42.00.  Chef Special with Fig & Foie Gras - At first you can't find the foie gras so it looks like just a bunch of figs, but it's hiding underneath the figs. Display was beautiful but the taste... foie gras was OK but miso paste was really salty and figs were sweet. I think they meant to eat altogether to combine the flavor but I don't think most customers would know about it.  Spanish Octopus - It came with a huge bowl so other customer would be curious what's inside the bowl. Octopus is tender but salty and Tempura Shitake was flavorless... Another dish was made to eat altogether to combine the flavor...  Braised Lamb Neck - This was a huge dish consider it cost $42.00... The braised lamb neck itself was cooked nicely, but flavor wise it's salty and a bit spicy from the sauce. Scallion pancakes were not the traditional Asian style, it's more dryer but a good partner to eat with the lamb neck. They also offered pickled green onion and pickled daikon and both were SOUR as hell... This is my first time eating pickled green onion but you get used to the sour after some bites... The pickled daikon is a bit spicy so I like pickled green onion more.  Overall the service was good, and foods portion wise was enough and we had to get a box for the leftover lamb neck. However, all dishes we had are considered too salty so it might be suitable for heavy flavor eaters.

99KEGQp9CfK28WcHyQ2k8w.text: I'll keep it simple.  The old adage - what happens in Vegas stays in Vegas - is so befitting in a good way.  Experience it.  I have, twice now.  First was an intimate dinner and the second time was with half my immediate family.  The third will be with my friends and family.   I don't know if there is such a thing as sexy and provocative food but this was on the cusp of that.  Enjoy my fellow Yelpers!  Our favorites not in chronological order but in level of joy:  Aged porterhouse was a melting pot of cultures. From pure meat flavor to a cornucopia of dips.   Uni was a treasure hunt - each dive was a success.   Braised lamb neck with roti-like pancakes - lots of melt in your mouth balanced flavor meat.   Foie gras - foie-get-a-bout-it - cheesy I know - foie-give-me.   Prosciutto appetizer - it'll want you to order more but remember - you have a lot coming! - so literally it did its job.    The Belgian ale and house Cab were perfect.  I love alcoholic beverages so if the level of joy is last -  then there you go.

lfpfzS8BgOu0WHE4Yxh6vA.text: Had a moment to break away from the conference. I treated myself to the lamb tartare and the bone marrow along with some grilled broccoli. The plates are meant to share, but I was hungry, and it was delicious! The roasted marrow reminded me of my mom cooking round steak and letting me have the round one and marrow to suck out. There was crostini to put the marrow on. The marrow also had a peanut sauce and glaze. The lamb tartare was excellent. The broccoli was perfectly cooked. Sometimes you get when cooks try to keep it green, it's still so hard to bite. This was green and yet I could bite and chew easily. Great wait staff. Manager was so nice. He was willing to suggest other good restaurants to try in the area if I was staying for more days (which I wasn't).

Photo of Sparrow + Wolf - Las Vegas, NV, United States

9MDwqavNPd0Rhu8vapw2zw.text: Came here during a cousins reunion trip :) This is a really solid restaurant off the strip, you can tell they really worked hard on making their menu items unique and special. The staff here is also really nice and helpful, so def ask them for suggestions! Here's what we ordered to share, we ordered doubles of almost everything since we had 8 people:  Hearth Baked Bread $5 Great way to start off the meal, yummy warm sourdough bread. Slather on that umami butter!  Really Good Lamb Tartare $17 Honestly I didn't really love this as the lamb tasted a bit gamey and overly salted. I did love how flaky the Bahturah bread was, their version is kinda like scallion pancake but without the scallions.  Duck Confit & Sweet Potato Dumpling $16 YUM, this was really good! Loved the sauce and the crispy garlic flakes, definitely eat it all together in one bite. I actually liked how the sweet potato wasn't overly sweet, it was just a subtle hint of those flavors.  Hot Potato $15 These are potato paves, I kinda wish these were a bit more flavorful. I think it needed a lot more sauce to make the whole dish a little more moist.  Roasted Bone Marrow $21 Not sure why they give you mini forks for this dish, you definitely need a spoon haha. This was good but I think a bit oily. We also added foie gras on top of one of the orders, that was cooked really well!  Lamb Bolognese $24 I really liked this dish!!! Not sure why I decided to only get one order for the table haha but I guess we would have been overstuffed if we got two. This was made with Udon noodles instead of pasta, I always love the bouncy texture of udon.   Dry Aged Porterhouse ~$90 Very good cook on the porterhouse, the meat was nice and tender. It also comes with a variety of banchan (small dishes that usually come with korean food) - different sauces, soba noodles, spinach, etc. I don't think we used a lot of them, but it was interesting haha.   Also, I was really looking forward to ordering their lasagna but that's no longer on the menu :(.  Remember to check in on Yelp for a free glass of wine!

Photo of Sparrow + Wolf - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Really good lamb tartare

eokuxANDZMpQ3_qDs-WD9Q.text: Wow the food is absolutely amazing here! The chefs are very talented! The menu changes on a consistent basis, I just hope they always have the scallops available. We had the best scallops imaginable here! The restaurant is fairly small, and extremely loud, but not so loud where you can't hear the people at your table. Every single table will be occupied. I'm not sure if they even accept walk ins, I would highly recommend making a reservation.   Cocktails: We tried a variety. They were all tasty and presented in beautiful containers. 8/10  Scallops: Again, the best scallops imaginable! We bought multiple rounds of these. 10/10  Oysters: Both raw and cooked were amazing. I personally preferred the cooked oysters though. Very buttery in the best way! 10/10  Steak Tartare: I've never been a big steak tartare fan, but with that being said, this one was pretty good. It came with garlic bread that paired wonderfully.  7/10  Duck Confit and Sweet Potato Dumplings: This was actually my first time trying duck. These dumplings were amazing! This came in a slightly bigger portion too. 9/10  Spanish Octopus: I love octopus! Unfortunately the entire table agreed that this dish was our least favorite. 6/10  I will definitely be returning again soon! I just wish the portions were slightly bigger. There was about three of everything per order. Luckily we were a party of 3, any more of us and we would of had to order multiple dishes to share.

ubRlZjIAm92cDFC_My7wZA.text: I've passed by this restaurant so many times in Chinatown and the reason why I wanted to come here, without even knowing what kind of food or drink they served, was the fact that I dug the name. Sparrow + Wolf! So cute. I finally did make my way here for Restaurant Week because I noticed they had a tasting menu and the price wasn't bad for what I was getting.  When I arrived, I was sat at the bar (chair for one), but I was perfectly fine with that because I like sitting at the bar to eat and talk to the bartenders making drinks. One of the bartenders there immediately handed me a glass of water and began going over the menus with me. She took the time to answer my questions and I decided that, yup, I wanted to try the menu for Restaurant Week. I even got a glass of wine because I checked in on Yelp.  The first course came pretty quickly. In fact, the timing of my food was pretty awesome because as soon as I finished one dish, the next one was already arriving within that course.  The first item I received within the first course was the wood roasted Romanesco & sugar snap peas with Thai chili and coconut. It was light and delicious.  Then came the swordfish aguachile with fennel, pineapple, lentil cracker. The swordfish aguachile was soft, but tasted a lot better when I put it on the lentil cracker and had that contrast of crunch.  The steak tartare with shiitake mushroom, kizami wasabi, egg yolk was my favorite. It came with a slice of bread that was charred in some places, but I liked that. The steak tartare tasted amazing.  With the second course, the Viking Village scallop with ramp pesto, marinated eggplant came out next. I love scallops and this tasted yummy. I wish there had been more than one scallop, but it's a tasting menu, after all.  The all-day braised lamb neck with sherry glaze, crunchy stuff and the broccolini with avocado, poblano chili, garlic and lemon arrived together. The lamb neck was super delicious, though with a little too much glaze, and the broccolini was a little too crunchy for me.  The third course was a brown sugar cake with strawberry and Thai basil. I don't particularly like strawberry all that much, but it went well with the cake, and I ate it all up.  There was a little too much seasoning here and there, but overall I enjoyed my tasting menu, and I assume the portions will be a lot better when it's a regular sized meal. The interior was very pretty and the bartenders were super awesome. They put on a show while making drinks, and discussed drink making in between my courses.  Sparrow + Wolf wowed me with their Restaurant Week menu and their friendly staff. I can't wait to come back and eat dinner here with my friends.

Photo of Sparrow + Wolf - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crunchy stuff
Photo of Sparrow + Wolf - Las Vegas, NV, United States. All-day braised lamb neck with sherry glaze

b9PRpSw43dCPVU6IlZM_7A.text: Sparrow and wolf never disappoints in the uniqueness and quality of their food. Their oysters are amazing and fresh. Their sweet potato and duck dumplings are a staple to order. They used to have beef cheek dumplings that tasted much better than the sweet potato dumplings but they are still good. The bone marrow is a must when ordering along with the asparagus.   Sparrow +Wolf is a restaurant that pushes boundaries with their menu but doesn't disappoint and is done with the utmost care taking into consideration the flavors of each item on the plate.   What is always a hit or miss is the service. My last experience there we had a waiter that was rude and tried to limit us on how much to order (I had only ordered 3 dishes at the time) the dishes were small but even if they weren't I felt it to be an extremely rude and out of place comment for her to make especially when I had not asked her thoughts on it.   This is my reason for my 3 star review. If the staff were not rude and trained better they would have a full 5 stars.

photos.caption: Photo of Sparrow + Wolf - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bone marrow

YqqPcrkhh0ILY67lIHSysw.text: We had an amazing dinner at Sparrow + Wolf.  The service was incredible with our waiter explaining in great detail about some of the dishes we were interested in ordering.  Our glasses were always filled with water and even random staff passing by were helpful when we had questions.  Plus, I loved how the dark and stylish ambiance was reminiscent of the 60s.  The food was creative and tasty.  Dishes are meant to be shared family-style so we ordered appetizers, sides, and a main entree.  The trout "chips and dip" was so interesting: trout roe, fried trout skin, and a trout "dip" with some potato chips.  The foie gras appetizer was delicious: fried foie gras sandwiched between toast with peanut butter and shallot jam.  I thought the roasted white asparagus with bearnaise sauce and nori was reallllly good.  I was hoping for more filling in the duck confit and sweet potato dumplings - with 5 per order, I definitely wished we'd had a few more.  The main dish of the night was a 32 oz, 55-day aged porterhouse steak ($95) with a miso-rub (?) that came banchan-style with 5 small side dishes (giardiniera, marinated mushrooms, pickled cabbage, sauteed spinach, and noodles), 3 sauces (chimichurri, peri peri, samba oelek), a Naan-like bread with Indian spices, and a soft-boiled egg.  We ordered it medium-rare but it came rarer than expected and sliced for sharing.  I really wanted to like the porterhouse but I struggled with chewing through the pieces of rare meat and happened upon some with gristle that I simply couldn't chew through.  My family, however, enjoyed the porterhouse so I was happy about that.  Overall, the entree was confusing for me but I'm glad we tried it.

photos.caption: Photo of Sparrow + Wolf - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Duck and sweet potato dumplings
Photo of Sparrow + Wolf - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Porterhouse steak
Photo of Sparrow + Wolf - Las Vegas, NV, United States

TEAOHtrqEMRZ5hV-M9z_tg.text: A lot of my friends recently tried Sparrow + Wolf so I decided to come and finally try it out when my brother was in town. It is not that big of a restaurant, so I am glad that I made a reservation for three, though it was not completely packed at 7PM on a Friday either. The interior is very modern and lighting was on the darker side.  Our waitress was okay. She was friendly and kept using my first name but didn't really check on us much during the middle of the meal. There was a slight feeling of disinterest that tarnished the meal.  The menu is not that big, and we went for the bento box. It was a beautifully presented and executed assortment of charcuterie (cured meats + cheeses), oysters, shellfish, and fish/steak tartare. I could taste the quality of the food and appreciated the balanced and creative flavors. We also got a detailed explanation of all of the box components when it was first served.  For dessert, we tried the pavlova which was a very interesting texture and taste.  Prices were not outrageously high but also not inexpensive. Portions were as expected for a higher-end place, though the three of us left satisfied after the bento box. I think the bento box is a good value at $75 overall.  I am glad I tried Sparrow + Wolf and enjoyed my dining experience, even though service was not quite as genuine as I would have liked on this visit.

photos.caption: Photo of Sparrow + Wolf - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Bento Box all stacked up.
Photo of Sparrow + Wolf - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oysters.
Photo of Sparrow + Wolf - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pavlova.

bGcFTWJwvVKOlsW6BjaEmQ.text: Three of us decided on sparrow and wolf for dinner.  + 1 star for free wine glass with check in  +4 stars for the food.   In the "meh" category. We had a trout dish (don't remember the name) served with house made potato chips. It was tasty but unmemorable. Wouldn't get it again.   In the "id get it again" category:  The charred octopus was great. The Foie of the night was served in a sandwich...it was AMAZING.   We ended with the dry aged porterhouse. Only comment about the porterhouse is that sambal and chimichurri are sauces, not banchan.  -1 star for the service. Our service was stupendous up through our entree. Then we were forgotten for 10-12 min. We made eye contact with and waved at 2 different members of the staff and they didn't come to our table. I won't go into details but shared the opportunity for improvement with their General Partner John.  No chance to review dessert because the poor service at the end signaled to us that it was time to leave.

6RxbIAFeFJuAju9XrNEWkA.text: Lamb Bolognese lasagna was spot on with perfect combo of crispy cheese and pieces of soft marinated lamb. Taking half a star off as the dish was lacking a bit of salt and was on the bland side. I guess good for those who don't need salt in their diet  Honey cake. Perfectly complemented with candied almond ice cream and blueberry compote this dessert was my favorite  I will bring my partner here next time but definitely skip on the drinks and go straight for the great food options  Awesome place just a couple of miles off the strip. Definitely gives most of the strip joints a run for their monies

photos.caption: Photo of Sparrow + Wolf - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lamb lasagna and miso flavored toast
Photo of Sparrow + Wolf - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bar area at SW

obU5TFx5WHuMIUKxo85OLg.text: I really enjoyed dining here. The interior is beautiful and the atmosphere is wonderful. When I went there were plenty of people in the restaurant and it made it feel very upscale casual. I came here after eating at another restaurant. I went with my friends and ordered one of each dessert. The menu at the time had Caramelized Honey Toast, Coconut-Kaffir Panna Cotta, Vanilla Bean Pavlova, and Roasted Peanut Ganache Bar.  From best to worst:  Panna Cotta, Honey Toast, Ganache and Pavlova  Coconut Kaffir Panna Cotta: Honestly this was so delicious. It wasn't heavy and overly creamy like a typical panna cotta. It was light but still creamy and rich. The kaffir lime flavor was a nice contrast to the creaminess and balanced the dish very well over all. The ganache was a bit on the heavier side so I definitely think that this dessert could be for 2 people The pavlova for me was disappointing. It was overly sweet and I wasn't a fan of the meringue I personally felt that it was a bit too crunchy.

photos.caption: Photo of Sparrow + Wolf - Las Vegas, NV, United States

MG0hJaQ_Wqm_x7ZyJ2jXcg.text: From the friendly hostess to the knowledgeable and cool bartender to the chef who took the time to come and say hi to us and ask us how things were going this place just did everything the way it is supposed to be done. The place is busy or was when we visited but everyone seemed to take it in stride - the staff was amazing. We got a mix of oysters to start the night, then moved across several recommended plates including the lamb tartar, scallops, and finished with the market rate Porterhouse steak. That Porterhouse was unreal and so good. It was not cheap at $85 I think but was a big piece of well prepared meat. The char on the outside was rich and tasty but the steak was prepared rare which made us all very happy.   Oh, and the bread here is mind-blowing.   This place goes toe to toe with the best other big cities have to offer. Well worth the visit.

97fBaRDKLJoGRDL4Ryh2yQ.text: Five of us went to Sparrow + Wolf on a Saturday evening.  It's located in a Macy's strip mall with plenty of parking.  Staff are friendly and several people came to check on us throughout the meal.    Beverages:  Great assortment of cocktails, modest wine list  We ordered a large assortment of tasty and creative fusion dishes:  - Oysters:  These were fresh and juicy oysters from British Columbia baked in miso - Uni Trout Roe In Celery Root:  the Uni was a little lost in the mash of celery root - Bone Marrow:  generous serving of fatty bone marrow.  We opted to add seared foies gras to this..piling on the richness - Grilled Octopus with Tempura Shitake:  This dish was underwhelming because the octopus was a tad too charred and dry.   - Braised Lamb Neck:  amazingly tender, fall-off-the-bone lamb was moist and buttery with softest fat that melts on the tongue.  This dish comes with a chive onion pancake that can be used a "taco" for the lamb. - Porterhouse:  Aged for 45 days, this was the star of the evening  Tapas typically outshine entrees, but this was surprisingly not the case at Sparrow+Wolf.  Prices are moderate so you can have a fantastic meal without breaking the bank.

Photo of Sparrow + Wolf - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bone marrow with an extra side of foies gras

oiRCL-LVftnaIWHHWDpPOQ.text: Frequently asked by regional pharmaceutical representatives for suggestions on where to hold meetings Sparrow + Wolf has become a top choice, the addition of a PDR comfortable for twenty expanding possibilities while Brian Howard's Food opens eyes to what is feasible rather than just what is comfortable.  Now in its third year of operation, the buzz died down but crowds still present at volumes that keep the Restaurant busy seven days a week, it is upon entering the foyer featuring Christmas Story's leg lamp that guests are greeted by a hostess, reservations confirmed and seating offered in one of two rooms or at a bar that is frequently found full of industry workers.  Fully occupying the Private Dining Room and Library during this visit, multimedia outlets allowing for a thirty minute presentation while dining on a tasting menu pre-selected by Chef Howard, it was with a glass of Bubbles $3 cheaper than one will find on The Strip that Bread was delivered, the housemade rounds still steaming when broken and Butter flecked with Nori quickly melting and soaking into a pillowy crumb coated in Seeds.  Served in three family-style courses, none of them 'dumbed down' despite a crowd that featured many guests more accustomed to events at Bonefish Grill or Del Frisco's, it was with service befitting the situation that John Anthony and team made sure everything progressed smoothly, round one's Steak Tartare outstanding yet somewhat polarizing considering the crowd while wood-fired Romanesco with Thai inspiration and Swordfish Aguachiles that bounced back and forth between sweet and savory both showed the kitchen's confidence with bold flavors and ingredients less commonly utilized.  Perfectly paced despite a throng of reservations for Restaurant Week, Brian later claiming that Sparrow + Wolf's special menu offers the "best value in town," it was just as the speaker came to her finish that course two flooded four tables, the assortment of "American Banchan" grabbing attention and holding it with Miso Spinach, creamy Octopus and Potato Pave while the 65-Day Dry Aged Porterhouse basted in Miso Butter delighted all but the rare guest who still thinks "Well" is the only appropriate temperature for a Steak.  Not nearly finished, the Duck and Sweet Potato Dumplings previously felt compromised by too much Chili Oil now more refined including a thinner skin, fans of heat should additionally order grilled Broccolini served alongside raw Avocados and poignant Poblano Peppers while everyone in Las Vegas that isn't Vegetarian should request at least one baked Sweet Potato topped in Salted Plum Creme Fraiche and snappy bits of housemade Chinese Sausage.  Adding an off-menu bonus, the combination of Scallops and Foie Gras recently seen at Michelin 3* Restaurant Vendome presented by Chef Howard as a complex Carpaccio with heterogeneity of texture as well as temperature amidst herbs and acid, it was with three Desserts that dinner reached its conclusion, the lack of Honey Toast disappointing at least a handful though the Chocolate Bar and Blueberry Tart both shined despite restrained sweetness while Coconut Panna Cotta proved a favorite for those seeking something light.

7fwEChaxHVWhC9mXnSANpA.text: This was one of the best, more memorable meals my wife and I have had in a long time. We're not fancy food people, but we've been to our share of fancy restaurants, and S+W was a real treat for us.   Every dish we had was unique in its own way. In a world of bland gastropub food that sounds more exciting than it is, every dish we tried was fantastic in its own right. We had the dumplings, asparagus, oysters, and skate (fish), and we were thrilled with the different flavors and care that went into each dish. It felt like our tastebuds had woken up after a long slumber living in the meh-food city of Denver.   Also, the service was fantastic all night. Our water cups were literally never empty, and we got fancy food service in a relaxed bar atmosphere where we didn't feel dumb for wearing hoodies (we were fresh off the airplane). Money-wise, expect to pay about $50/person before drinks and tip, and it's worth every penny.
