X_mSlbGgWqsvwIiepHilrw.text: Destination worthy dining.  We usually ask bartenders where they'd eat when we're in new places...industry workers usually know where the most innovative food is being prepared.  I wish I had still had the name of the kind gent who sent us to Sparrow + Wolf because he'd be on my holiday card list for life.  From unique cocktails to outstanding sides and perfect service, this is a must-dine when you're in Las Vegas.  Freed from the pressure to turn tables at the cyclic rate, or to season (generally over-season) dishes to the "medium palate" that might lead to success on the strip, the team at Sparrow + Wolf are able to draw from the best local products and take risks in preparation and presentation.  Stand-outs when we were there late summer included Japanese style sweet potato, oysters, maitake mushrooms, and the amazing fresh bread.  This is the kind of food that evolves the character of a city's culinary landscape.  Las Vegas is lucky to have Sparrow + Wolf.  We're heading back to Vegas and won't miss the chance to return.

Tw4PPF7qYQ__IqwzbzkacA.text: Sparrow + Wolf is my pick for the best dining experience Chinatown has to offer right now.  The interior is well thought out. It's a very nice remodel from when Jenny Pho was in the same location. They kept the best aspects, like the open kitchen, and gave the interior a really nice facelift. It feels very clean. The staff are warm and friendly. Quick to refill drinks, take orders, clear plates...  and they always had a smile. They were all very welcoming and it felt like they genuinely cared about what they were doing.  The food is wonderful. Brian Howard, the executive chef, has done a really good job creating a rich tapestry of flavor. We tried the beef skewers, which had a great charcoal taste like it just came off the grill (because it DID!). It was paired with a crepe and sweet and sour garbanzo bean relish, and it was a really creative dish that we both loved. Next we tried the beef cheek and bone marrow dumplings, and they were worth it! Again, very rich flavors. The marrow melted in our mouths.   The only thing we ordered that was a bit disappointing was the hearth baked bread. It tasted a bit bland... maybe a little salt or rosemary, or a side-dish of balsamic vinegar or something else to dip it in would add a lot to the dish. Five dollars for warm bread, when a lot of places just give you bread for free, perhaps set the expectations higher than maybe they should have been. But I feel like I can make better bread at home, so it was a disappointing pick from the menu.  For desert, we tried the lemon and blueberry Calamansi tart. It was perfectly sweet and sour. I loved the way the meringue melted in my mouth. I wish I had more!   The Sparrow has a few things we would change. For one, the music selection is confused. When my boyfriend and I walked in, we were greeted with a Notorious B.I.G. track that almost made me turn around. Next up was an old 60s anti-war tune, followed by some contemporary EDM, and then a bluesy track by Kai Straw called Hurricane. The playlist felt completely random, like each track is being decided by a roulette wheel rather than having actual thought behind creating a mood.  The other thing I would nitpick on... the spoons they gave us for the tart were huge. And when that's one of the only flaws you can find at a restaurant, well... that's pretty good.   I definitely wish the Sparrow great success here in Vegas and I will surely be coming back to try the shank and the duck.   An Honorable mention to the  general manager John. We got a change to meet John as we walked out the door and he overheard me commenting about the fire wood smell. He proceeded to show us around their kitchen and pointed out their amazing setup. I can't for the life of me remember the type of wood stove it was because I was so impressed by the GM's thoughtfulness.

RuUYgjZoUiEBaxWRdQlXRA.text: Really enjoyed our first time visiting here. The food & service was on point. Very unique & creative dishes. Presentation was excellent. Will definitely return to try more dishes!!

i9664RHlqSYr9Dy4hIu3NQ.text: One of the best meals in Las Vegas hands down, this place knows it's identity and sticks with it. I can write a long winded review or I can tell you to just go and experience it for yourself. To be honest order about 3-4 dishes and share don't forget the bread if you get the artichoke it's the best thing ever to dip with.   Enjoy an amazing meal and enjoy one of the best wait staffs I've seen since going to French Laundry honestly. They're spot on with the drinks as well.   Honestly the reviews that are 3 star or lower I believe to be explained by broken ass taste buds I think those people need to go back to Olive Garden ......   10/10

AFXyje31G5JtLd1RWGwVzA.text: Sparrow + Wolf is the brainchild of Chef Brian Howard, who was previously running the kitchen at Comme Ca at the Cosmopolitan. This new restaurant finally brings the farm-to-table, modern American restaurant concept off the strip, and bringing it over to the ever burgeoning popular Spring Mountain road area.  After hearing a lot of buzz about this place, I was able to finally check this place out on their opening night. The interior is really well done. It has a modern elegant/rustic casual feel to it.   Sitting down, our server took our drink orders. I partook in a lovely libation called a Lieutenant Dangle, a take on pina colada that has carrot juice mixed into it, it was splendid. I also ordered their draft of Stone Tangerine IPA, and that as well was fantastic.  Onto the food. As previously mentioned, chef Howard is doing the farm-to-table, artisinally sourced ingredient, modern American restaurant concept that people seem to be gravitating towards these days. The food here is fantastic. You can see a lot of influences in Brian's previous experiences, as well as him trying to branch out and try different things, which is always fun.   The service here is very good. They seem to have a strong GM here, which every successful restaurant needs. The servers did a good job, as did the runners and bussers. It was the opening night and those are always unpredictable, but I'm good at noticing things, and I could tell that they will improve quickly in time.  This is a brilliant, unique restaurant concept that no-one else is doing off the strip, and it is located in the most perfect location in town. I loved the ambiance of this place. Great food and drink options that are right on point in terms value. I see this becoming a super popular spot, and I will definitely be back.

Very trendy, Chic & sophisticated.   We will definitely be back to try other items in the menu.   I'm not a bread person but the hearth bread is to die for. The duck breast w/ Seared foe grais blew our minds. Everything was beautifully presented.   Just go try this spot! You won't be disappointed.

V2l9xMrexhqQzwok2mGyhw.text: Had marvelous meal here with a great friend who is a Vegas local. They have the best yellowtail carpaccio I ever had and the grilled duck breast with foie gras is delicious! We also enjoyed the apple and beet salad and the beef cheek & bone marrow dumplings. We were sad they were out of the braised bone marrow dish, but I will becoming back to Vegas soon and will be back at Sparrow + Wolf (not like we need another reason other than just really amazing food). The service was also superb, both servers helping us were very prompt and friendly. The server who took the food order really knew the dishes and made great recommendations. It was great a time to order a few dishes and share with a friend or two. The ambience of the restaurant is great, a nice chill vibe with eye catching decor, it's a good thing to go off the Strip and venture out, you end up at places like this!

iZxSISiIkRDCfn_QUbc6bg.text: Food is great, service is bad. Came here for a friend's birthday and we were a party of 8. It seemed like it would start off to a good experience because the manager showed up to our table and explained the menu and the different vegan options. The waitress took a year and a half to come take our drink orders and the drinks took at least 15 minutes to get to us and this was the trend for the rest of the night. There was a table next to us if a couple that the owner and waitress knew and she was over there much of the time. The food came at different times even though we all ordered at the same time and it took at least 45 minutes for the food. Which was all appetizers, nothing was a main dish so why did it take an hour for broccoli and asparagus? We were at the restaurant for 2.5 hours because they took forever for everything. We ordered a food item that we didn't even get. At that point we were there for 2 hours and were over it and wanted to leave.The place is really small too and we showed up at 530 when it was empty and we left at 8. They wouldn't split the check for us either. We had to write the totals on the back of the check and do the math ourselves with a calculator. It was completely ridiculous and I will never recommend this place. They also included a 20% tip on the check!!! I cannot believe how bad the experience was here and they expect a 20% tip?! Unbelievable. We all left this place hungry and had to get food somewhere else after. This place is a joke.

8sF0xe9XVgbZDqOuOsZG_g.text: Went to this place on a whim and luckily they had one open table for 3! The host and servers were all amazing and attentive. We ordered drinks and food, and we could hardly wait for the food to come out because all the food coming out the kitchen looked amazing.  The only thing I'd say about the menu is that it's a place to come and share multiple courses. We just ordered dishes for ourselves, and while it was filling, I would have appreciated more vegetable side options.  Side note: the rose they had was amazing. So good that I took a picture of the menu on the way out.  I would definitely come again!

t4SYFl3lItCPugZ6TTwR7Q.text: Had the pleasure of eating here tonight as part of a private party and it's by far the best meal I've had in Vegas in, well maybe in ever. I've been coming to Vegas since before the restaurant boom, and even with the celebrity chefs the food isn't as authentic as this. Our table quite literally begged for more of their homemade sourdough-and sure that's not usually the food item that people write a yelp review about, but the fact that they make perfect bread from scratch is an indication of the care they take.   Hanger steak was perfect. Fried trout was the best I've had since a beach restaurant in Mexico where they caught and filleted the fish on the spot. The dessert, zomg.   I'll be taking an Uber here next time I'm in town for sure.

siq7BroPnAADeQOFPYa1nA.text: Overall good flavors. They were busy the night we went so the service left some to be desired. Overall I'm more of a fan of menus that can put a different spin on everyday items. This menu had a lot more "exotic" proteins than I generally need to see on a menu. Seems a little try hard and the food is a little heavy. A good experience but I wouldn't become a regular here.

Order a few different plates they are perfect for sharing.  The atmosphere is upscale, hip and cozy.  I highly recommend checking this gem out especially for my foodie friends.  I would also make reservations, every time I've been there they have been pretty packed.

For the most part, the pairings worked although I might have switched out a couple of them.  The staff is welcoming and attentive.  Highly recommend and will definitely visit again.

xc0JsSPtD5-5cWu1esfPyQ.text: Been in Vegas many many times but this has been by far one of my best restaurant experiences! The drinks are definitely one of a kind, absolutely deliciously unique - we ordered the Scrooge McDuck and Safeword. Truly enjoyed their raw seafood treats, the flavored oyster and Chinatown Clam Casino are amazing. We also ordered their foie du jour for appetizer, the buttery texture melted perfectly on top of the strawberry crepe. Lastly, their dry-aged steak completely blew our mind, it comes with multiple creamy banchas on the side as well (be sure to wear loose clothing to fit all the food in your tummy)!    Definitely coming back here to try rest of their menu for my next and next next Vegas trips!!

aLCtPrLQ8AcTBwvF-FbEEA.text: Sparrow + wolf is a restaurant where we can go get food that is served on the strip for off the strip prices. Very unique looking food and our bartender suggested it was French fusion inspired. We had the oyster trio, steak tartare, duck dumplings, lasagna, and the chocolate dessert. The plates are made to share and my partner spent $111 before tip. All the food I just mentioned and two drinks. The vibe in there is dark and had a beautiful wood log wall. I loved the bar seating area which is where we sat. They also had an en elegant cocktail menu. Craft cocktails that you would get on some fancy bar on the strip from a mixologist. It's great to even just meet for a drink. Highly recommended and we will be back to try the rest of the items on the menu. Like the porterhouse!

MvPuc-h-p3XgF9ILxsoZ_g.text: If you haven't visited Sparrow & Wolf yet, what are you waiting for? They have done so many things right starting with the vibe from the moment you walk in. If they would let me, I'd move my bed in and take over their rent. I love the gold chains with a library vibe and the Wolf mural above the bar. It's a cozy space without feeling crowded. It's always full.   My most recent visit had me at the bar devouring creamy corn and scallops. Their cocktails are stellar but if you're lucky enough to have a friend who frequents often and has a drink named after him - order it. I won't give away the name because it contains a Japanese whiskey that is known to be in low supply.   Seriously though. The food is stellar so kudos to the passion of Brian Howard there and John does a seamless job of running the front. The staff is fun and passionate. It's a real good time. Every time.

xN5WEhndXy5Jg3w60vllrg.text: Came to Soarrow and Wolf straight from the airport.  The hostess was very welcoming and let me keep by luggage behind the counter.    I flew in late so got down to business soon after ordering a glass of Merlot (free with Yelp check-in!)   Chinatown clam was good but only if you really like unagi.  Beef cheek dumplings were very unique.  Very garlicky but very good.  Just make sure you're not meeting up with anyone afterwards.    For the main dish, I had the duck and foie gras entree.  Again very good and well prepared.  The duck was a little stringy but overall the dish was smoky and rich.

6gbaGkchYNH5KT6nKmeugw.text: Good food, new takes on classics. Not impressed with the drinks we had- they seem like they tried too hard there. Food was good, service was adequate, nothing special. Above average overall.

Q-e7DgDxVhJMyT7g4-Ckdw.text: This is the second part of my review and discusses the entree only.  And now for our final dish, the entree, a 32  ounce Medium Rare-Dry Aged Porterhouse, that is in a league of its own and cannot be compared to any of the other dishes.   Unlike several restaurants through the valley that pride themselves on their steaks-that come out over cooked or some parts of the steak are over cooked wile other parts are indeed medium rare-every piece of this steak was medium rare and perfectly cooked from the middle to the ends. This speaks volumes in the skills and techniques to ensure that the equipment is evenly heating the beef while cooking it.  As briefly stated earlier, we did not see how a different piece of beef could be better than that Cauliflower NY Strip which I still talk about today. Also, this dish included several Korean style small dishes called Banchan, which when paired with the Porterhouse will take you on this journey that sadly concludes with the last bite of one of the most perfectly flavored and cooked steaks of your life. Personally the beets are the highlight of the banchan. I loved the mild heat that was incorporated with the natural flavor and sweetness of a beet.  While taking in the first bite you quickly realize just how tender the Porterhouse is. Just as quick, you begin to discover the miso flavor, and it feels as if your eating buttery meat that literally melts in your mouth. The way this Porterhouse house is prepared by itself makes this steak far superior to most of the steakhouses in the valley. the steak is perfect without the banchan. However, the banchan is such a nice accommodation and allows you to customize each bite that will take you on a journey, where the sole purpose is too not have a care in the world, lose yourself in its flavors, and eat good food. Eating this steak made us happy. What a journey it has been and we look forward to our next dining experience.

Vee6TECVySP-8HMkJSoWMA.text: Late post! Love this place! My favorite was the uni clams they call Chinatown clams casino! I can die happy drowning in that ocean love. The uni grill cheese didn't wow me. It's good but the cheese over power the uni flavor. Maybe if they toss more uni (sea urchin) in between the the grill cheese than  just on top would make it better. The hamachi carpaccio is soooo good. Melt in your mouth.   The beef cheek bone marrow dumplings is one of their popular dishes but I thought it didn't wow me. It is good just not a wow. The hamachi Kama off the menu, special of the day is really good. Most places grill it fully cooked but this was cook medium just perfect for me. I thought it was the best hamachi Kama I have ever had.   The oysters are good and fresh but not wow. Their special cocktail drinks are ok. Service and Our waiter was super cool! John Anthony "partner" mention they will bring their yummy food to the Bay Area. I will definitely email him for updates on that. Not all the food was perfect but who is lol....overall it was pretty close to perfect for me. .I had a great time! So I give it top notch 5 Star!

ToIvmzGmHx58DfzpVxeLPg.text: Service was fair. Cocktail menu was disappointing. Quality of food is fresh, but execution and options was lacking.

XmGOait_3YWd6qGaIqChEQ.text: Wow, I could not have asked for a better spot to take my Vegas food virginity.   We left the menu in the chef's hands, and course after course, the creativity and flavors kept hitting the right spots.  We opted for the chef's choice tasting - if you don't see it on the menu, definitely ask! The dishes were a selection of current menu items, plus few unlisted courses. We ended up with 12 (generous) dishes for our party of 3.   Some highlights:   Charcuterie Plate - They make most of the charcuterie in-house, and it was noticeably better than your standard charcuterie. The pickled persimmon was also unexpected but amazing.  Caviar Bump - Yes, you read that right. This was literally a gigantic bump of caviar on my hand. Hilarious and amazing.  Maitake Mushrooms - Apparently I have a thing for food that looks like an autumn forest floor - I loved the woodsy presentation. The layers of sunchoke, chili, hummus, and mushroom created a pleasing variety of flavor and texture.  Spanish Octopus - I hesitate to say anything is the best, but this beat out my previous favorite (Evvia in Palo Alto) for the best octopus I've tried. The tenderness made me weak.   American Wagyu, Duck Breast, Foie Gras -  All three of these ingredients I'm particular about. Wagyu is often overcooked or under seasoned. Duck breast is usually gamey and/or too chewy for me. And I'm not a fan of most foie - I've only truly loved the taste one other time. Sparrow + Wolf pulled off all three on the same plate, and I loved every freaking bite.  Chocolate Caramel Tart - The plating for the whole meal was awesome, but this was especially stand out. The chocolate was decadent and not too sweet, the vanilla ice cream lightened the dish, and the cocoa nibs added nice texture contrast. A perfect ending.  Wine pairings - The sommelier and FOH manager John picked a fun mix of whites and reds. I liked that he switched it up and paired a white for the meat course. The Locations CA White was my favorite - oaky like a typical California chard, but also uniquely crisp at the same time due to the blend of chardonnay, sauv blanc, viognier, and roussan. I've never had a white quite like it.  I came with a VIP regular, so the service was especially great. The staff was full of passion and everyone seemed like they truly enjoy working there. Chef Brian Howard came out a number of times to describe the dishes. We also had a new server, but she already seemed seasoned.  Bookmark this off strip spot! Sparrow + Wolf checked off all the boxes and more - food, style, service, creativity, ambiance.

I never write reviews, but after finding this spot on accident, I wanted to make sure I let the owners and others know just how amazed I was.   We had many dishes, all shared. The service was top notch, a great atmosphere and overall I am super glad it happened to be next to the place we were going to go to and we decided to see what it was!  Simply amazing!

jGFmUhx6gAVzSBi72EC1fA.text: OMG!  Haven't had such a memorable meal in awhile. I had the 7 course tasting menu and it was a deal!  Ended up being more like 10 courses. Had some time to kill before flight home so decided to do the tasting menu. Love the Asian flavors mixed into everything. My highlights include seafood hodgepodge soup-mousse thingy (smoked trout roe and uni in a celery root base), octopus confit, duck sweet potato dumplings, scallops on daikon, clam casino, steak tar tar, hamachi, honey toast with anise ice cream, and some sort of fruity-savory foie gras with pineapple.  Everything was awesome!  I am so stuffed!  Such a great place to come off strip and non-pretentious. My server Christopher was great and had some valuable input.  Better than many SF restaurants I've been to that were triple the price.  I am definitely coming again when I come back to Las Vegas.

ckKDZkRgvXatNwo5inH1_Q.text: This was the food highlight of my Vegas trip. That food was sick - in a good way. Kudos to the chef, those dishes were both inventive and delicious. Where to start? Everything was so good. The waitress gave us some great pointers on what to order. We started with the ocean parfait. I don't even know how someone comes up with that combination. The seaweed powder and the crispy rice balls along with the trout roe and uni was ridiculous. Beef check and bone marrow dumplings, crazy combination that was just visually stunning and tasty. Pretty much a shredded beef dumpling, but definitely elevated. Hard to decide what was best though, the foie gras, or the steak. The foie gras was perfectly seared with that meat butter taste and a great sauce.  The steak could have been the whole meal. It was a big steak that was perfectly cooked and cut in to strips, served banchan style with a bunch of small dishes. It came with a chimichurri sauce that was packed with flavor. All of the different small dishes were also really good, the mushrooms and the carrots were probably my fav. Definitely a must if you're in Vegas.

KcOXTj4PfgaQOGKExwk4WQ.text: Please be advised: food portions are designed for sparrows, and no reservation = second class citizen service & treatment from staff.    normally don't write reviews for restaurants, but I am compelled to share this absolutely disastrous dining experience. A couple months back, I decided to try out what I thought would be a trendy new place with 3 friends. It was a Friday night, and we walked in around 6pm. Hostess tells us it would be around a 20 minute wait. 20 turned into 40, and 40 into an hour. Each time we checked back with them, we were teased along and told "it's a busy night, really hard to predict just when a spot will open up but it shouldn't be more than another 10-15 minutes". Granted, the dining floor is on the smaller size (capacity maybe 20). By that point, we should have just left but we were determined to stick it out since we already invested an hour. How much longer could it be?   After 2.5 hours, the staff finally told us we could be seated. A total of 3 HOURS elapsed since we arrived before we finally got seated. Safe to say, me & co were quite a bit hangry by then, so I flagged down the manager to ask if we could receive any sort of compensation for the unexpectedly long wait. Their dishes come tapa-sized, enough to feed a sparrow and we were all still hungry after eating our food. For most adults, it would take least $50/head to get full from an empty stomach. Manager offered us a round of drinks on the house, but snarked that we should have known better than to drop in on a busy night without a reservation and not-so-subtly told us it was our own fault. What the actual f***?! Rest of the service felt like our waiter was rushing to get us out of the restaurant as quickly as possible. Will not be returning ever again!! They should change their name to SORROW AND WOLF PISS

h1SmMMUeYG3NmlRV_5u-UQ.text: We celebrated my boyfriends birthday and we had such an amazing time! We both have been wanting to try this restaurant for quite sometime, now I'm a little disappointed that we hadn't come here sooner. The food is served family style, so it gives you the opportunity to try a few items at at time. I fell in love with the grilled miso oysters-I ordered seconds. My boyfriend LOVED the ocean parfait, bone marrow, and we both were in awe of the braised lamb neck. Can't wait to visit again!

photos.caption: Photo of Sparrow + Wolf - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Birthday boy

e0f48GWGsb3tLguMoymGtQ.text: Everything we had was delicious! My personal favorite is the Hamachi Carpaccio. We got the lamb, which is delicious, but was too much for just two people. The sommelier suggested a really good dark French wine, which went really well with the Duck Dumplings and the lamb. Dessert was amazing, especially the Pavlova, which gave you amazing flavors. It was bitter at first bite, then you taste the sweet and then the sour. Very clever dessert, I would definitely recommend it. The Honey Toast is just amazing, I loved it!   We got an excellent table, it was inside a small room where the wine was kept, with the books. I'm glad we got a four-seater table and not a small table where you get cramped up with your food. Interiors were beautiful, the cook books that were on the shelves made it even more interesting.  Overall a good dining experience, we would definitely come back and recommend it to everyone.

-9M9b4ugB9ZixiDqFCHy1Q.text: Although some of the dishes were out of my comfort zone, this is a really thought out restaurant. A lot of love and passion went in to creating everything here and I can appreciate all the hard work. I like that everything on the menu is designed for you to try something "new". The plates are small but you can get full quick. Fair pricing and vegetarian friendly. Cheese plate was excellent served with honey & homemade, pickled vegetables. Love the creative cocktail menu and the service is the best in town. Manager is going table to table wanting the best experience for every customer. The only thing I was left wanting was more textures on my plate. I felt soft came with soft and vice versa. Scored me a free glass of wine with a yelp check in! Was to full to try dessert but will next time as I would love to revisit.

MQNpAeIgrfKjNLBoSsUghw.text: Just a great place to eat and drink.  Our party had a wonderful time seated at the bar.  We had custom made cocktails to start.  Each of us started with something from the menu but then asked the bartender for her own creations, which were amazing.  For food we started with the Bento Box and then followed with a 32oz porterhouse.  One of the best dining experiences I have had in Las Vegas.  Definitely worth the cab ride off the strip.

fOaBHtVrAx7hjuwncegMfw.text: o2.17.18  We chose this restaurant since it seemed like it has great rating and the food looked excellent so my friends and I decided to come here for dinner, and to celebrate Chinese New Year. However, it was a disappointment.   First of all, when I called to make the reservation, I was not treated rudely but I felt like I wasn't very welcome either. I was not being thank for for making a reservation and not even a bye before being hung up on the phone. He already hung up the phone while I was saying, "Thank you and bye." Whoa...  Second of all, many of the items on the menu were not available and it was all the ones the reason we decided to come here. Then we were also informed later on that the whole menu got changed at the beginning of the year.   Third, staffs are nice but super slow service.   Fourth, the food were just an ok. The uni clam ($7.50 for one...lol) was salty. The uni melt was ok but the uni was a little fishy. The hamachi poke was good. The lamb neckbone was ok, it was way too oily and none of us liked the sauce. The drinks were ok, nothing impressive since the ones we wanted were no longer on the menu. Then there's something called sweet bread, boy how it tricked us, it was pig liver. And yes, just tasted like liver. Um, no.   We were just glad we didn't order that much for a group of 8. The bill still came out to be over $200 while all of the dish was small, only the lambneck looked like a main entree. My bf said this place should call Tapas.   An extra star is for the ok nice decor.   Now we are off for some oxtail soup for this cold weather.

nlqCWM1ZGKG18GeBD-B68A.text: We had the halibut which was delicious. The Chinatown clam casino was tasty. We also had the wood roasted bone marrow which the sliced beef was cold and the marrow rather bland. Service is excellent. Small dishes to share to nice entrees.

4QqxiUYjdldl5RA1uGYlcg.text: Alright guys and gals, buckle up, because your taste buds are about to go on the journey of a lifetime.   Not only did I walk out of this establishment full of joy and absolute satisfaction, I left with a belly full of STINGRAY (skate wing)! An acquaintance of mine was once stung by one of these creatures , so having the chance to chow down on one was quite the delicious revenge.

Pn0SIoM4MYIrPQC1K6dHJA.text: The food is decent. I love the fresh bread and butter. Roasted beets and artichoke is very good. The service is quite horrible all their servers have douchy attitudes and not really friendly.

photos.caption: Photo of Sparrow + Wolf - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Roasted Beets. Very good.

WNHek-uUwgc0Ml7k64kjgg.text: Sparrow + Wolf offers a selection of entrees of American dishes modernized to match the trendy and hip atmosphere of which you'll be dining in.   Offerings include fresh oysters with various options and specials to determine how they're prepared, beef cheek and bone marrow dumplings, and duck with delicious foie gras prepared on top.  We arrived around 6pm without reservations and were still seated promptly.  I can only imagine that as the popularity of this restaurant rises, a reservation might be a good idea if you want a seat.  First to try, an order of their "hearth baked bread with cultured butter".  While I can understand   the concept of selling bread instead of serving it complimentary for an upscale trendy establishment, I felt the rolls were on the small side and did not particularly stand out by any means taste-wise.  I'd save the dough (see what I did there?) and use that towards any of their fantastic appetizers and entrees.  The beef cheek and bone marrow dumplings with green onion emulsion, garlic foam was pretty delicious and shareable with another person.   It was weird because at this point, we were offered complimentary toasted bread to scoop up the sauce to enjoy all its tastefulness.  The bread itself was burnt though.  My wife ordered beef skewers which were paired with crepes, butter, and chickpea relish.  Slightly undercooked per my wife's taste with lots of red on the inside of each piece of skewered meat.  It also came out somewhere between cold and warm, probably sitting on a plate for some time before being served to us.  My duck entree was definitely the star.   The flavors were on point and the foie gras elevated the dish even further.   This was their saving grace for me.  Overall, a nice establishment with a great selection of appetizers and entrees but lacked a bit as far as execution goes.   We would have preferred our meats hot and our bread not burnt.

xBIXe80M4CP2xYdjm2HbQQ.text: Where do I begin? Let's start online. Booking my reservation here, could not have been easier. Confirmation was sent and my reservation was in. No problem. I received numerous text alerts about my reservation through the weeks of waiting to attend my 40th birthday and my beautiful girlfriend, Danelle's birthday.  Telling her young age is not appropriate, so we will not do that )).  When we arrived at the restaurant,  we were immediately greeted and seated. The restaurant is very warm and pleasing. Romance can easily be sparked here, due to its comfortable, chic atmosphere. We were sat at a 2 top table next to this chain wall, very classy. I had to touch it, sorry, but it is real!  The waitress immediately came to our table, along with the server assistant with water shortly after. She greeted me with my name and wishes us a Happy Birthday. POINTS for that for sure.  She told us the specials and then gave us the opportunity to decide upon ourselves.  When she returned we ordered cocktails and our food.  Danelle had a Easy Peasy, yum yum, and I had an Ichigo Time, yummy as well.   The manager, John Anthony, was so polite and generous. He gave us a glass of champagne for our birthdays and showed his True appreciation for our birthday celebration,  Thank You!!  The drinks came very promptly, and then the fun really began. They started us .........oh wait......We decided for our food to be decided by the Chef, Brian Howard. The Chefs Tasting Menu is the most amazing experience we ever have had.  Okay.......they started us with a wonderful freshly roasted bread that had a butter to die for. The inside of the bread was so soft and moist and the outside had a wonderful crunch.  As we enjoyed our bread, we felt this was going to be special.  Our first course brought to us was Beef Tartar. I personally never had it until that night. The taste was exquisite. The different spices and Asian influence were unbelievable.  We ate it all. Couldn't help ourselves. Next we had, forgive me I forget the name, but not the flavor, a tomato dish. It was very light and refreshing. Himachi Carpaccio was the next course. Can I say WOW!! And HOW!! As you observe the delicate placement of the flowers and grapes on top of this beautiful plate of Himachi. As you eat it your senses begin to tingle. You lips and tongue will grow slightly numb and it feels very euphoric.  It was quite the experience. For our next course we had Beef Cheek and Bonemarrow Dumplings. As everything before this was a preparation for a heavy dumpling. Heavy in a good way for sure! Almost like a wo derful homecooked beef stew in a dumpling. This was straight to the soul delicious! As we were enjoying the Carpaccio, Chef Brian came to greet us. We were floored. Never in my 22 years as an adult, have I had the Chef come to my table to greet us. I was pleasantly surprised as was Danelle.  He wished us Happy Birthday and started describing our next course. Beef Shortrib with a Flintstone bone! We were like, OMG, that sounds so delicious. Then he hand delivered it to our table and returned again to ask us how we were doing.  Let me just say, NO KNIFE NEEDED! The meat was so succulant and was easily torn from the large slab of meat, made for MAN, to devour. I ate about 4 oz. of that alone. We had to box that to go. Next we were brought a beautiful chocolate care to share. They wrote Happy Birthday on the plate and it too was unreal good! When we finished we wanted a picture with the amazing crew who made this all possible. They obliged with open arms, and a smile. Never in my life have I been treated so warmly, by strangers. You made this an experience of a lifetime. Thank you to everybody at Sparrow and Wolf! You guys really are awesome!!!!  PS...sorry I missed the Broccoli Rob we had as well. It too was delicious and the smokiness from the open fire was very good with the Avocado. Yummy

KhXEuxSIqUbWPUyR-IU_YQ.text: Maybe we would have enjoyed the regular menu. They had a special thanksgiving menu, and we had no choice but to have that. It was pretty terrible. All the calories, none of the taste. The turkey was moist, and the endive salad was delicious. The Brussel sprouts were too sweet and burnt. The fried chicken was tough as hell. The deviled egg was too creamy and underseasoned. And most people don't like pumpkin pie. The flavors were bland, even though all the dishes sounded so interesting from the descriptions. The cocktails were over sweet and I couldn't even finish mine. I was so happy I found a place open for Thanksgiving. If only my meal could have been as nice as the decor.

lzmPhs8V9wACqNxUFGLW1w.text: The menu seems a bit random, but definitely delights. Solid wine list and great staff! The Japanese potato, hamachi, and romanesco was very well done. Great for a date

NExkKE-or_OId6AbeMNASw.text: Disappointing. The venue is well thought out. There are plenty of staff and the vibe is upbeat. Food is very ordinary and left is wanting something a bit more adventurous. Flavors were not well balanced and generally the standard was sub par. It has serious potential under a really good chef.

AOPX9WweUOdbus5gyAaFWA.text: Made a reservation for Thanksgiving dinner with my husband. Everything from the beginning was amazing...the host was very friendly, server was outgoing and prompt, and the food was delicious! Highly suggest eating here!

Ibjn3swa7Gxbx0DJWjdc7w.text: I was excited to check out Sparrow and Wolf and had seen on Yelp that they were open until 11pm on Sundays so we stopped in hoping to get dessert and a drink after dinner (it's 10pm) but they were closing early. They said the kitchen closed early because they ran out of food and that we could probably still sit at the bar if we only ordered a drink but we were hungry and excited to try something off the menu. Bummer!

wbdgT4gWHETGhsxTYFPwjQ.text: Pardon my French but F*** Me!  Coup de foudre.  This is what happens when you let a chef play.  Brainchild of Chef Brian Howard of Comme Ca Vegas, this new eatery is a stunner.  Global cusine with a nod ot Asia. (possibly owing to it's Chinatown location).  Dishes are bold and rich offset with herbs, sprouts, flowers, and greens.   Beautiful plates of playful food that won't tire your palate.  The perfect expression of this, the outstanding sweetbreads.  Crisp on the outside, creamy on the inside, nice offal flavors.  Along side, bacon wrapped baby romaine lettuce, an interesting foil, that makes no sense until you combine it with the sweet peas and vegetal, raw pea tendrils and herbs; a great way to add brightness to the dish.  Bacon fat plays a role in the sauce bringing the dish together.  Artichoke, a take on the roasted artichokes of the Jewish quarter of Rome, excellent.  Bitter, crisp, creamy all at the same time.  It's flavor elevated by the white bean hummus, charred tomatillos, peppery wilted arugula, and pine nuts and a dousing of olive oil.    The beef cheek and bone marrow dumpling showcases tender beef cheeks enriched by melting bone marrow.  The wrap, relatively thick and cooked al dente, bordering on being too chewy but holds everything in.  The peppery beef perfectly matches the green onion emulsion but the use of foam; sorry I always think of cat spit, not appealing.  It's just me.  THE showstopper, albeit it inconsistent, the "campfire duck".  Holy $hit!  Beautifully rendered fat (almost no white under the skin), perfect mid rare, topped with a melting, pan seared thick slice of foie sprinkled with a few crystals of rock salt that adds burst of texture and flavor.  The whole thing sits on earthy, wood ear mushroom slivers and briny Japanese cucumber pickles (what you'd find in a bento). An Asian inspired, sweet sour plum and duck jus ties it together.  Sublime.  Sadly the fat of a duck breast from a second order (placed later in the meal) was so poorly rendered, disappointing.   The head on Argentinean red shrimp (creamy head fat with lime butter; just saying) and culatello both delish.  If that's not enough, get the hearth baked bread.  A True European style bread with great texture, perfect for mopping up any savory juices that remain on any dish.  Creative craft cocktails.  Well chosen wine list with very reasonable, off Strip pricing.  Check out their FB for promotions and specials.  HH from 5:30 - 6:30.  Addendum:  Be sure to check out Burger Night (Thursday - Saturday 11PM - close).  Great blend of cuts, cooked to temp, topped with burata and arugula plus a COEDO black lager for $20; steal!   Friendly, knowledgeable, local service.    A chef's playground of a restaurant.  And it's outstanding.

oaJIU_mxXLKL9wkO_6BwHg.text: Damn.   The huz found out about this place on the Las Vegas Beer & Brewery Facebook page. I'm super glad he did.  This place is fantastic. The chef is very creative and literally everything we had was so flavorful and unique.  Best dishes:  Culatello Ham Butcher Wings  Campfire Duck Beef Skewer (my fav)  The manager kept coming over to give us details about the food, which was awesome. He also mentioned to follow their Facebook page for events they'll be doing. They all sounded like a ton of fun.  Guys, this might be one of my new favorite restaurants in town now. The service was impeccable. The food...wah lah. And the overall feel of this place is ridiculously delightful.  Can't wait to go back!

HVa1c7KrPRRr8YqGOpVJQw.text: This place was recently opened. So I decided to give it a try. The atmosphere is more of a hangout /get together with friends. Definitely not a family type of place. It was a little pricy though. The place is a little bit small. We sat at a small table and when we sat down it was pretty tight where I was literally back-to-back touching the other person behind me. That was one thing that I did not like.

lKO7y8K8qnfnEUXEP6F2cw.text: Amazing.  Chef is a mad scientist of food. How can a potato be that good.  Octopus plate was crazy good.  Service wonderful. I was in Vegas for four days. Every restaurant we ate ate suffered from comparison  This place is a MUST

jqfpDkBq__H3XQ-DO0UDYw.text: I had no idea what to expect, but I love to give off strip Vegas restaurants a try.  I don't dig most tourist spots, which doesn't jive with the Vegas thing, but that's me.  From the first bite, I was hooked. The Ensenada oysters were a flavor experience that unfolded over nearly a minute.  So incredible.  Then the hamachi carpaccio followed. It was truly sublime.  I can't properly express how happy I was with each bite that I took. Every dish, every drink, every course--it was phenomenal. I'll be coming back next time I'm in Vegas.  Our server, Brittany, was knowledgeable, and totally accommodating with my obscure culinary questions. And one of the partners, John, took time to chat with us about the cuisine and approach to the restaurant that left us informed and completely satisfied with our evening. Thanks to the whole team at S + W for giving us such a memorable and exciting dining experience.

801eGg4uyFJ9uEdTrJxKCg.text: This restaurant is hands down my favorite place to go when I'm in Las Vegas. The menu is incredible, the staff is friendly and honestly it doesn't feel like being in a desert. The place excites the average joe, which I like to abbreviate peta. I will always go to this place no matter what anyone says!

taVW_GinUA126vStIA3Z-Q.text: I Everything is excellent. An Electric menu that is sure to please your pallet every single time! This is my 5th time here and it seems to be getting better!

MG-3DguK2If6cQH8ynImqg.text: So cool!  My lady and I spent our date night here. It was an amazing night. Funny cocktail names. I got the "Have Knives Will Travel" and she got a glass of Malbec. They brought out the hamachi tartare and trio of oysters. Life changing. Then they brought out the beef marrow dumplings, beet and endive salad, octopus (MUST TRY!!!), and Big Ass Pork Shank. A L L   A M A Z I N G !!!!  Also had the Gnome in Bangkok and their secret cocktail the German Slurpee. OMG!  Service was friendly but a little slow (the place was packed!)   Intimate ambiance.   Plenty of parking.  Can't wait to go back.

rx-xl9r3QEXEcn5Hr7IVzg.text: Sparrow and Wolf is the love child of one of the most passionate Chefs in the business! I've had the pleasure of working with and for Chef Brian over the past 12 years! When we moved back to Las Vegas our first stop was Sparrow and Wolf! What a smart, creative and adventurous menu!  Can't wait to go back!

8dL7AHBVxJSsUqY5b0hV1Q.text: Excellent restaurant with amazing service.  Food is exquisite and fairly priced.  Our party of four had some picky eaters but everyone loved the food and ambiance.  Great location off the strip.

YjfzbhLHXLrwcNNKYAN46Q.text: It's cool that it's a nonchain, locally owned spot with a vibe that'd be cool for a tinder date, and plating thats great for your instagram but I really feel like the food misses the mark.

SKoLzXu5vr0-rGhBAOVH3g.text: The drinks and food here should be on a short list of must eat places off the Las Vegas strip. Quality and flavorful dishes easily match the  restaurants on the strip. The nicely seared scallop dish has a nice smoke flavor that I enjoyed. The big ass pork shank is enough for one major appetite or easily shared for two not so starving people. The slow roasted fall off the bone pork amazed. Strangely enough I didn't think the accompanying sauce was necessary and preferred the pork solo. The  mushroom/hummus dish was a delightful surprise and a rewarding menu choice. Don't sleep on the house made bread. It's part of the appetizer menu and the warm sourdough had the prefect hint of "light sour" bread with an amazing texture crunch and chew. The honey toast is a perfect dessert a nod to the  Asian version but with their own twist.  Overall I enjoyed the atmosphere, thoughtfully executed menu and can't wait to come back.   Service: The primary server was just ok, had it not been for the interaction with the owner/GM I rate it a 5 out of 10. The owner/gm has charisma and enthusiasm that really adds to the overall dining experience 9 of 10. The staff will eventually match their gm's great level of service so go give them a try.

1fiTJYQ-yiGSh_oj5QXLDg.text: Really cool addition to Chinatown!  Beautiful ambience, good hospitality, and yummy food.   We started with a tasty mushroom dish served over hummus, then we shared the "big ass pork" and campfire duck.  We also got the hearth bread.   The mushroom dish was the tastiest. Super flavorful! Highly recommend.  Hubby loved the pork. I will always order duck if it's on a menu...bonus points for grilled fois gras on top!  The duck breast was a little too fatty for my liking...prefer the fat rendered a bit more. But the fois gras was good!  Two main courses, an app and bread was just enough food for the two of us. Pricing was about $9 on the low end glasses of wine and $13 for cocktails. Apps (or lighter courses I think they call them) were in the teens, the two mains we got were mid $30s. Not as high as the strip and definitely on par with a place trying to be trendy like this. I would come back for happy hour (if offered, I didn't check) or date night if we felt like American food (we almost always seek out Asian food tho). Next time I will try the octopus!

ITT2iXKfJ33-avI8G5Cd0g.text: This is our favourite restaurant in the Las Vegas area.  It's off the strip, but defending mutely worth an Uber. Service was fantastic; attentive but unobtrusive.  And the food was outstanding.  This is Asian fusion that bears no resemblance to the typical all you can eat variety. Portions were sized right for us.  It's pricy, and in my mind worth every penny.

OV6MjbZFyctTgZ8i3x0J1w.text: This is one of the best locals restaurant in town. I've brought all of my out of town guests here to enjoy hand-crafted cocktails, an ever-evolving menu and a gorgeous atmosphere. Order a few plates to try and share- every bite is full of flavor, even the vegetable based dishes. Bring a date, a best friend, go alone- you and any guests will be so happy you did.

t0TexXTGGRgeWJx5QagHnw.text: Blown away by the service and food. We had the bento box which is a little different every week. Will be back.

ramntHtx6L5BgPxzLdBX5w.text: Absolutely one of the best restaurants in town. Amazing service and food. Top notch and better than anything on the strip!

1aD3warlNIbs96CefzT3dg.text: Finally made it to this off the Strip new comer! Amazing experience! The food, the wine list, amazing cocktails and the service was fantastic! This is a place where people care!!! The space is casual and really comfortable. Try this place right away if you haven't been and treat yourself to a great night out.

QJSTCgHdoa3huXNbIdU3uw.text: It took 25 minutes to receive service and the waitress was clueless to the fact that warm had to ask the bus boy several times for someone to take our order.  Top it off with really poor timing on delivery of our food.  After our appetizers we waited another 45 minutes for our main course.  The food was tasty but the service was horrendous!!

GyNlkq0MH4aLdXRlFRVubw.text: Great food and service at this off the strip gem. Management was especially thoughtful and courteous.  The adult beverages were amazing as well.  This is the first of many visits to this awesome establishment.

ckgwrCsvKoIfhw1K-t_pRw.text: I would give it zero stars if possible.  I imagine that Alpo would taste better. Every dish was more disgusting than the last.  Hipsters enjoy. I will head to Raku and eat a meal worth paying for.

NGUQ-MPC-GZop3U6bgKghg.text: Seriously, the best food I've ever had.  Even their butter makes you melt. My boyfriend and I  ordered the Bread with fresh butter appetizer (I forgot it's official name) Bento Box, Beef Cheek Dumplings and Caviar Pizza... I think I just about died and went to heaven. The waitress was extremely knowledgeable and I can't say it enough, their food is out of this world!!! The only negative is that the restaurant gets pretty loud...but who has time to talk when you're busy enjoying each bite?! If you haven't been here, you MUST go!

bB5QeOjkBMhwNlZpzpSPvw.text: We were visiting with a bunch of friends for my birthday. We chose Sparrow and Wolf due to the reviews on line. Our expectations were exceeded!! We arrived and Brian, the Chef/Owner, greeted us and I informed him this was a birthday celebration. We were seated and the entire party was treated to a specialty drink on the house for my birthday.  Very nice and a great gesture. Perfect way to get the night going. Thank you, Brian. We had the Bone Marrow, Japanese Sweet Potato, Lamb Lasagna, Beet Tartar, Brussel Sprouts, Lamb Neck, Mitake Mushrroms w/ hummus and the trio of desserts.  Everything was FANTASTIC!! Best Brussel Sprouts we've ever had! Thank you Brian and team for a very memorable evening!

sT52CLBdfuSV_fFXsT8u8w.text: Alyssa taking care of the bar was phenomenal! Very knowledgeable of her drinks and great suggestions on the food menu! 10/10 will sit bar side for her any night!
